loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 31 years old and lives in Banga, South Cotabato with his family. He is married and has one child. Anthony is engaged in farming. According to him, he has been growing rice and corn crops for three years. He usually earns 5,000 PHP doing this farming. Anthony also owns cows.

Anthony's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. He hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Maria Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema es  un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa, ella  es una madre de familia cariñosa y atenta con sus 3 hijos y esposo. Tiene 43 años de edad y vive en un caserío (comunidad rural de condición muy pobre) ubicado en el distrito de Pitipo en la provincia de Chiclayo – Lambayeque.

Zulema tiene mucha experiencia en cuanto al manejo de las tierras, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años. Cuenta con 2 hectáreas de maíz amarillo duro que necesitan mantenimiento. Es por ello que Zulema solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles, que le permitirán fertilizar y deshierbar sus tierras.  Zulema tendría un mayor rendimiento por hectárea lo cual la llevaría  a tener mayores ingresos para su familia.

Zulema ha tenido dos créditos cancelados con puntualidad y responsabilidad. Estos la ayudaron a capitalizarse al sembrar más hectáreas de terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Zulema is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). She is the loving mother of a family and she is attentive to her 3 children and her husband. She is 43 years old and she lives in a community (a poor rural community) located in the district of Pitipo in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque.

Zulema has a great deal of experience in working the land. She has been dedicated to agriculture for the past 10 years. She has 2 hectares of hard yellow corn and it needs upkeep. For this reason Zulema requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) of 3000 nuevos soles. This will help her fertilize and weed her fields. Zulema will achieve a greater yield per hectare and this will help her earn a greater income for her family.

Zulema has had two past loans and they were both paid on time and responsibly. They help her capitalize the plantation by sowing on additional hectares of agricultural land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to weed her fields.

loans.name: Ileana Maria

texts.es: Ileana Maria tiene 50 años, es casada vive con sus 3 hijos. Ileana se dedica a una pulpería tiene muy buenos clientes como familiares, amigos, vecinos y amistades. Ileana siempre ofrece un buen servicio a sus clientes pues ellos siempre quedan complacidos la calidad de sus productos y el buen servicio. Las compras las realiza en el mercado en donde ofrece granos básicos, sopas, enlatados, detergentes, refrescos, pan y galletas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como el tiempo ya que tiene que realizar las compras y atender su negocio. Su sueño es seguir trabajando, darles estudio a los hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ileana María, 50, is married living with her three children.  She has a grocery store.  She has very good customers amng relatives, friends, neighbors and acquaintances.  Ileana always offers good customer service for they are always satisfied with her products and good service. She makes her purchases in the market where she stocks up on basic grains, soups, canned goods, detergents, soft drinks, bread and cookies.

With support from the loan she will be helped economically to meet her needs.  The challenge she faces is time because she has to do her purchases and tend to her business.  Her dream is to stay in business providing her children with education so that they will become professionals.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del banco comunal Las Mariscalas II del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos menores.
Lleva 3 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y tiene una bodega donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad.  Su esposo es profesor en un colegio de la comunidad.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará un poco de abarrotes para surtir la bodega: 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de leche, 1 paquete de avena, 5 kilos de harina, 1 bolsa de sal, 5 paquetes de papel higiénico, 2 kilos de ajos, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de conservas.
Estos productos son lo que la gente más consume y no le debe faltar en su bodega, sus hijos la ayudan  en la atención.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudar a todas las mujeres trabajadoras y especialmente a los de su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Mariscalas II” which is in the District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayli. She is 37 years old, married, and has four young children.

Celia has been working with Manuela Ramos and manages a store where she offers all types of basic products. Her husband is a professor at the community college.

With her new loan of 1000 PEN, Celia will buy a few groceries to restock her store. This includes one case of oil, one case of milk, one packet of oatmeal, five kilos of flour, one bag of salt, five packets of toilet paper, two kilos of garlic, one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, and one case of preserves. These products are what people consume the most, but they are lacking in her store. Her children help her manage the business.

Celia is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping all working women, especially those who are part of her Communal Bank.

loans.use: to purchase various products in bulk to restock her store.

loans.name: Chynargul

texts.en:
Chynargul is the mother of four children. She graduated from Medical School and worked as a gynecologist at the local hospital, where she earned a reputation as a responsible professional.   As it was very hard to raise her children on a low wage, Chynargul decided to start her own business in the medicine trade. 

Starting in 2008, she managed to broaden her business by renting a pharmacy and achieving success. But in June 2010, violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in Osh city. Chynargul lost her business, which was robbed and looted.  She didn’t give up, however, and is ready to resume her lost business and to continue to work. That is why Chynargul is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business. She plans to broaden her business by renting one more pharmacy. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is a group that uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to restart her business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela’s McAllen, Texas-based sporting accessory business, The Commander, grew slowly out of her and her husband’s dream of becoming self-sufficient entrepreneurs. Starting their careers as waiters, Marcela and her husband, Juan, began chasing their dream by selling sporting clothing and accessories at weekend flea markets. Recently, they made the largest business decision since they began pursuing their business goal: they moved to a permanent, fixed location.

Ten years ago, with strong encouragement from Juan, Marcela began selling military and hunting items at two McAllen flea markets. As the years passed, she began to envision a permanent location for her business, and she and Juan began to look at buildings with dimensions appropriate for their inventory. Six months ago, they found an affordable, central location and took a courageous leap of faith by signing a lease and moving their inventory.

At first, Marcela says, business seemed to flow smoothly enough; however, she soon started to see that her store needed more inventory. Customers demanded varied items that Marcela had never sold before, such as paintball gear and police suits. As she realized that her flea market inventory was not sufficient to fill the needs of the business’ permanent location, she began to search for ways to meet the demands of her new customers.

This loan was the solution to Marcela’s inventory problem. It was invested in new inventory, such as paintball products and police attire, to fill the unique demands of her new customers. After being denied a loan from a commercial bank, she came to Kiva partner, Accion Texas-Louisiana. Of this experience, she says “The loan helped our business a lot. Without it, with our lack of new inventory, I project that our business would have closed down in a short time.”

The Commander now supplies its customers with the sporting items they need. Some additions to her inventory include flashlights, caps, hats, bandanas, camouflage face paint, helmets, paintballs, facemasks, paintball guns, and boots. Marcela says that her business is successful in part because it offers more variety to her customers than her competitors. Without her loan, she says, none of this success would have been possible.

In the future, Marcela aims to continue her business’ success and growth by providing her customers with their sporting needs. She will continue running her business with the support and hard work of her husband and three daughters. Most of all, with the help of her new loan, she hopes to continue realizing her long-time dream of being a self-sufficient entrepreneur.

loans.use: to pay for sporting goods inventory such as paintball and police accessories

loans.name: Ivonne Del Rocío

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal San José este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ivogne, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 21, 16 y 10 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en Universidad y los otros en  colegio, todos aun  viven con ella. Su esposo es Ing. Civil.

Ella es una gran esposa y ama de casa que junto a  su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos tienen un negocio de venta de repuestos de carros, aceites, lubricantes y llantas, tiene un local en su casa el cual junto a sus hijos y su esposo cuando este no esta ocupado en sus obras atienden, nos cuenta que son más de 20 años que tienen este negocio y que poco a poco  a crecido a base de mucho trabajo y ahora es uno de los mejores almacenes de repuestos de sus localidad.

Este crédito es para comprar llantas, aceites y todo tipo de repuestos para automóviles. Lleva dos ciclos en el banco comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y amigables.
 
Sus sueños es seguir creciendo en su negocio y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the province of Manabí we find the 24th of May village, which is where the San José cooperative bank meets.  This area is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard-working residents that primarily dedicate themselves to farming and raising animals.

It is here that we meet Ivogne who is 42 years old, married, and has four children from this relationship ages 22, 21, 16 and 10.  The two older children are studying at the University, and the others are in school and still living with her.  Her husband is a Civil Engineer.

She is a great mother and homemaker and, together with her husband, dedicates herself to commerce.  They have a business selling car replacement parts, oils, lubricants and tires.  It is located in their house and she tends it along with her children and husband when he’s not busy with his tasks.  She tells us she’s had the business for more than 20 years and that, little by little, it has grown with a great deal of hard work.  It is now one of the best replacement parts stores in the locality.

This loan is for the purchase of tires, oils, and all types of replacement parts for cars.  She has two cycles with the cooperative bank, and likes it because her associates are very united and friendly.

Her dreams are to continue growing her business and for her children to become good professionals.

loans.use: buy tires, oils, and replacement parts for cars.

loans.name: Winay Jakaña Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WINAY JAKAÑA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Doris. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercialización, producción y servicios.

La señora Doris,  indica que hace cinco años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de las señoras de anterior grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de jugos y masitas que viene trabajando en una casa.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de fruta y masitas), que comprara del Tejar y los venderá en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud y todas las capacitaciones de negocio.
texts.en:
The “WINAY JAKAÑA” community bank are starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The group has eight members and is led by a board of directors which is headed by Doris.  The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include sales, production and services.

Doris says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for five years.  She joined through an invitation from some ladies who belonged to a previous group.  She currently has a business selling juice and pastries.

Doris is taking out this loan to increase her capital (buying fruit and pastries).  She will buy her products in El Tejar and sell them in her store.  This work allows her to make the income she needs to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the health services and all the business training.

loans.use: to buy fruit and pastries

loans.name: Juanita De Los Angeles

texts.es: Juanita tiene 54 años, su actividad es la comercialización de medicamentos. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran contentos con el servicio que proporciona. Ella lo realiza de manera ambulante. A pesar de los diferentes desafíos que enfrenta como es el tiempo y la salud ya que muchas veces no puede salir a ofrecer sus productos por problemas de salud. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de vitaminas, cremas, pastillas, jarabes entre otros.
texts.en: Juanita is 54 years old.  She sells medicines.  She has had this business for more than 20 years.  The majority of her clients are happy with the service she gives them.  She conducts her business by going door-to-door, despite the various challenges she encounters, such as the weather and her health, since many times she cannot go out to offer her products due to health problems. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of vitamins, creams, pills, and syrups, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, creams, pills, syrups, and other items

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 48-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.  Merlinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Merlinda is a new member of HSPFI, and she requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.  In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a variety of women's and men's clothing in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Eila

texts.en: Eila is 41 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has eight children aged 18 to 25; six are presently in school and live at home, while the others are living on their own. For the past  three years she has been selling  peppers, oil, and bitter ball (a local vegetable) in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers, but  she  has insufficient goods,  so  she is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, oil, and bitter ball for her business. She plans to build her own house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, oil, and bitter ball (a local vegetable) for her business.

loans.name: Roger Guillermo

texts.es: El Sr. Roger es un joven  trabajador y muy empeñoso en salir adelante día a día, es soltero y se dedica a la pesca artesanal de camarones en los ríos de quilca y camana; ya lleva en este trabajo por mas de 5 años, lo cual adquiere una ganancia semanal de S/. 300 nuevos soles aproximadamente. Los principales retos y desafíos que enfrenta el Sr. Roger es la temporada de veda del camarón ya que en dicho tiempo no se puedo pescar dicho crustáceo ya que entra en etapa de reproducción. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en  el mejoramiento de su vivienda como es poner techo a su casa; los sueños del Sr. Roger terminar de construir su casa y formar su hogar. El esta agradecido por la confianza depositada en su persona.
texts.en:
Roger is a hard-working young man who works hard every day to get ahead in life.  He is single and a small-scale fisherman.  He catches shrimp in the Quilca and Camana rivers.  He has been in this line of work for more than five years and it makes him a weekly profit of approximately 300 Peruvian soles.  Roger's main challenge is the closed season for shrimp as, during this time, he cannot fish for these crustaceans as they are in their breeding phase.

Roger will invest his loan in improving his house (installing a roof).  Roger's dream is to finish building his house and to set up home.  He is grateful for the trust that has been placed in him.

loans.use: to improve his house (installing a roof)

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is married with children. She is 53 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin Misamis Occidental.
Narcisa raises pigs for sale to earn a living. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase additional pigs to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Narcisa hopes to expand and improve her business to support their daily needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlene es una mujer trabajadora ella brinda los servicios de conserje. Los esfuerzos que realiza constante por su familia es algo muy importante para ella. Actualmente está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento. A pesar de que no gana mucho quiere realizarle estas mejoras a su vivienda que son necesarias.
texts.en: Marlene is a hard-working woman who works as a caretaker.  The constant efforts that she makes on behalf of her family are very important to her.  She is currently requesting this loan to buy building materials such as blocks, sand and cement.  In spite of the fact that she doesn't earn very much, she would like to make these necessary improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy blocks, sand and cement

loans.name: Ely

texts.es: Ely, de 21 años, es una madre luchadora, a su edad ella es madre soltera de un niño de 2 años, trabaja mucho y duro para poder brindarle lo mejor a su hijo. Vive en casa de sus padres a lado de sus dos hermanos. El trabajo de Ely, consiste en la venta de variados productos, como ropa, juguetes, accesorios para el hogar. Sus ventas lo hace en la calle, como ambulante, y entre sus principales clientes son sus amistades, vecinos y familiares. Tiene dos años realizando esta actividad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene ingresos a diario, lo que no le gusta es que tiene que caminar mucho, pero si no vende no tiene con que darle las comodidades a su hijo. Le esta yendo bien, pues considera que se gana bien siempre y cuando te dediques mucho a eso. Su anhelo es tener una tienda de juguetes, pero por el momento no puede pro que le falta capital de trabajo. Este será el tercer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente cómoda con su grupo de trabajo pues todos son muy responsables y solucionan sus problemas como grupo que son. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más mercadería para seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Ely, 21, is a tenacious woman.  She is a single mother of a 2 year-old child.   She works very hard to be able to provide the best for her child.  She lives in her parent's house with her two brothers.  Ely has a business selling a variety of products including: clothing, toys and accessories for the home.  She makes her sales in the street from place to place, and her main customers are her friends, neighbors and relatives.  She has been doing this work for 2 years.  What she likes about this work is that she gets daily earnings, but she dislikes having to walk around so much.  But if she doesn't sell, she doesn't have the means to provide comforts for her child.  Her business is going very well; she thinks that as long as she dedicates herself she can always make good earnings.  Her desire is to someday have a toy store, but at the moment she lacks the capital to do this.  This will be her 3rd loan with MFP, and she feels comfortable with her communal bank because everyone is very responsible, and they solve problems together as a group.  With the sum requested she will buy more merchandise so that she can continue to offer a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothing, toys and items for the home

loans.name: Asiraf

texts.en: Asiraf wants a loan to buy cattle to resell. This 22 year-old, hardworking man has been in the cattle trade for 4 years, having started with savings from the barber shop that he owned.  He faces a problem of price fluctuations and the current inflation affecting the country.  His dream is to own a ranch.

loans.use: to buy cattle to resell

loans.name: Njiyobiri Group

texts.fr:
Triphonie est une commerçante âgée de 41 ans qui habite la localité de Nyabitanga de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle vend les bananes depuis 25 ans,un métier qu’elle commence alors qu’elle était cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusq’en 6 è année primaire. Elle est mariée à Louis et ont ensemble 8 enfants dont 2 sont à l’école primaire et 3 à l'école secondaire.
Le crédit Kiva de 150,000 francs burundais q’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité de bananes à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses economies 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire NJIYOBIRI
texts.en:
Triphonie is 41-year-old saleswoman living in the town of Nyabitanga in the Gitega province in the middle of the country.  For 25 years, she has been working selling bananas, a job she began when she was working as a farmer.  She completed her education through the sixth year of elementary school.  She is married to Louis, and together they have eight children, two of which are in elementary school and 3 of which are in secondary school.

The Kiva loan of 150,000 Burundi francs that she is receiving will enable her to increase her capital to purchase a large quantity of bananas for retail sale in order to make significant profits and increase her savings.

She is a member of the Njiyobiri community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital to purchase a large quantity of bananas for retail sale in order to make significant profits and increase her savings

loans.name: Hy

texts.en:
Mrs Hy earns a living by selling fresh vegetables in a local market of Prey Chor district.  She buys vegetables in bulk from her frequent suppliers and then retails for a profit, earning an average of $2.5 per day. To share the income, her husband works as a casual worker around the province. This couple is blessed with four children, who are students and live under their income. 

Now, Mrs Hy would like to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a pumping machine, pipe and fertilizer for growing her vegetable crops. This loan will enable her business to improve and provide her family with a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine, pipe and fertilizer for growing her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Askaraly

texts.ru:
Аскарали 46 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. В 2005 году Аскарали начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота, а также – в продаже фруктов и овощей. Аскарали приложил все усилия для развития своего бизнеса  и добился успеха – на сегодняшний день, благодаря упорному ежедневному труду, его ежемесячная прибыль составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аскарали обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков для откорма.  Доходы от кредита Аскарали планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Askaraly is 46 years old, married with four children. In 2005 Askaraly began his business in fattening and reselling cattle as well as selling fruits and vegetables. Askaraly made ​​every effort to grow his business and achieve success. Today by working hard everyday his monthly income is 4,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop his business Askaraly has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase four calves for fattening. Askaraly plans to invest the income from the loan into increasing the herd of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Wako

texts.en: Wako 54 years old, married, and has seven children ranging from five to thirty years. He describes himself as an honest and faithful man. He has been running a general store for two years. He sells items such as flour, sugar and khat (a mild stimulant, legal in Kenya). His business challenge is inadequate stock. He will use the loan of Kes 10,000 to buy more sugar, flour, sweets and khat. Wako's hope and dream is to run another retail shop in the next five years.

loans.use: To add stock of products such as flour, sugar, sweets and khat.

loans.name: Asociacion Las Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es: En el hogar las mujeres parecieran tener una dotación especial de fortaleza que las hace invencibles.  Pueden dedicar cualquier cantidad de horas a trabajar incansablemente hasta alcanzar sus objetivos. Así es  Brenda ella tiene 19  años  y es soltera, Ella pertenece al grupo  "Asociacion las tres Estrellas" y está conformada por 7 integrantes, con el grupo tiene ya un año. Brenda siendo muy joven desde pequeña ayudaba a su mama en la jugueria, ahora ella administra el negocio con sus hermanas, la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar es su madre ya que gracias a ella aprendio todo lo que tenia que hacer en la fuente de soda. La  satisfacción que le ha dejado el ser negociante es que ha logrado estudiar y dar educacion a sus hermanos, La señorita Brenda aseguró que ahora va a iniciar su segunda etapa, lo que significa que podrá invertir sin ningún problema y postular a ala universidad.
texts.en: At home, women seem to have a special source of strength that makes them invincible. They can dedicate any amount of time to working tirelessly to achieve their goals. Brenda is 19 years old and single. She belongs to the Three Stars Association (Asociacion las tres Estrellas) group. This group is composed of seven members. The group has been together one year. Since she was very young, Brenda has helped her mother with the juice store. Now she manages the store with her siblings. Her main motivation for working is her mother. Thanks to her, she learned everything she need to know to run the store. The satisfaction she gets from being a businesswoman has allowed her to study and to give an education to her siblings. Brenda said that now she is going to start her next chapter. She can invest without any problems and apply to university.

loans.use: purchase supplies.

loans.name: Yudis Estela

texts.es: Yudis es una mujer dedicada a la actividad comercial independiente, vende productos por catálogo como perfumes, cremas corporales, cosméticos, lencería, entre otros, con lo cual ha logrado obtener recursos para soportar la carga económica en su hogar. Ella nació en una familia muy humilde, con muchas necesidades económicas, pero con el esfuerzo de sus padres lograron sacarla adelante y ahora es ella quien colabora llevando el sustento diario, gracias a los ingresos que obtiene por la venta de sus productos. Yudis es una mujer dinámica, emprendedora, siempre va con la fe puesta en Dios y poco a poco a logrado progresar, ya que siempre va en busca de oportunidades que le permitan salir adelante, por ello solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (cosméticos, perfumes, ropa, lencería, accesorios) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le dan y así poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes, especialmente sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector, así tendrá la oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos y podrá avanzar poco a poco hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, que es vender productos en red para poder obtener mejores ingresos a medida que va avanzando en la cadena y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Yudis is a woman who is devoted to an independent commercial business activity.  She sells products like perfume, body creams, cosmetics, and lingerie, among others, by catalog.  With this business activity she has managed to get resources to manage her household's finances.

She was born into a very humble family that had a lot of financial needs.  However, with her parents’ effort, they managed to get her ahead.  Now, she is the one that helps bring home the daily bread, thanks to the income that she gets by selling her products.

Yudis ia a dynamic and enterprising woman who always has her faith placed in God.  Little by little, she has managed to make progress because she is always looking for opportunities that will allow her to get ahead.

That is why she is requesting the loan to buy merchandise wholesale (cosmetics, perfume, clothes, lingerie, accessories) in order to take advantage of the  discounts that they give.  This way she will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers, especially her relatives, friends, and neighbors.  

This way she will have the opportunity to increase her income, and she will be able to advance, little by little, towards fulfilling her main dream.  That is to sell products on a network in order to be able to have improved income by advancing on the chain.  This way she will be able to improve her quality of life and her family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (cosmetics, perfume, clothes, lingerie, accessories).

loans.name: Katonzi Men & Women Group

texts.en: Juliet is a 30 year old married woman with two children. She is a member of Katonzi Men and Women's Group living in Kasese, Uganda.  She is a food vender selling fresh foods.  She began the business to have a source of income and pay school fees for her children. She dreams of expanding her business and making more profits, however, she is faced with the challenge of limited capital and competition.  Juliet is a hardworking woman and intends to use the loan to buy tomatoes, avocados, onions and other fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, avocados, onions and other fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 30 years old and married with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Margret sells cassava flour, a business she has been operating for four years. She began the business to earn a living, as business expansion is her dream. She is faced with a challenge of competition. 

Margret is a hardworking woman who is requesting money to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 30 years old. He is married with three children aged between 3 and 12 years, 1 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 17 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece land and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Madam  Sélom Kafui

texts.en:
Madam Kafui Sélom G. operates a beverage bar and food store in the area N’kafu. A young, dynamic woman of 29 years old, she is married and is a mother of a child and had four (04) dependents. A hair dresser by trade, she had to abandon this career which was not profitable.She launched her retail business in 2004 with the opening of her own shop. She started her commercial activities with her own financial means of $180 and is entirely dedicated to her trade. She had benefited twice from a credit of $550 and promptly repaid and without incident.

Her commercial activity lies mainly in selling beverages and staple grocery products (sugar, soap, milk, tomatoes…). Today, this trade is coupled with the opening of a restaurant which has been growing marvelously for about more than five (05) months. This secondary activity, which she only runs during the weekend for the moment, is well-liked because the menus and meals presented to the customers. Today, considering the significance that her activities are taking on, Madam G. is requesting a credit of $ 750 to increase her trade and to respond to her customers needs.

Madame G. Sélom Kafui est détentrice d’un débit de boisson et d’une boutique d’alimentation générale et de divers au Quartier N’kafu. Jeune femme très dynamique âgée de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant et a en charge quatre (04) autres personnes. Coiffeuse de profession, elle à dû abandonner ce métier qui ne lui était pas très rentable pour se lancer dans le commerce depuis 2004 avec l’ouverture de sa propre boutique. Elle a commencé ses activités commerciales avec ses propres moyens financiers de $180 et s’est sacrifiée totalement à son commerce. Elle avait bénéficié deux fois de suite d’un crédit de $ 550 promptement remboursé et sans incident. Son activité commerciale repose essentiellement sur la vente des boissons de la Brasserie et des produits alimentaires de première nécessité (sucre, savon, lait, tomate…). Ce commerce est couplé aujourd’hui avec l’ouverture d’un restaurant qui marche à merveille depuis plus de cinq (05) mois. Cette activité secondaire qui se fait uniquement les week end pour le moment, marche très bien compte tenu des plats et des mets proposés et très appréciés par les clients. Aujourd’hui, compte tenu de l’importance que prennent ses activités commerciales, Mme G. de sollicite un crédit de $ 850 pour agrandir son commerce et répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, milk tomatoes…  and beverages

loans.name: Gaupule

texts.en: Gaupule is a 49 year old mother of 6 daughters, all grown up and married with kids. They’re all in Samoa with 2 of them still living together with her and 4 living on their own at different villages. Gaupule’s talent was been taught to her by her mother, and she’s now passing it on to her two daughter staying together with her. Gaupule has introduced some new creative ideas to her business, by adding names on her bags, flowers and tapa prints. She can make different types of bags, from square, rectangular, oval, heart shaped and much more in desired sizes to suit their shapes. Her regular customers are gift shops, hotels and flea market owners. Gaupule admits that her business may have good markets, but she still needs the modern tools to make the job fast and time. With her requested loan, she plans to take her business up to another level, not just by selling them to her customers for the public, but she will be selling themdirectly to the public at a very affordable price.

loans.use: To purchase materials -- pandanus leaves, weaving equipment, dyes, paints, feathers, and other accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to buy supplies for the convenience store (milks, eggs, bread, drinks, rice, beans, etc.).

loans.name: Kouakou

texts.en: Kouakou K. is a 44 year old woman with three children. She lives in Anono, a township in the eastern suburb of Abidjan. She has sold grilled fish in Anono's open market since 1981. She is a dynamic woman. She is married and greatly contributes to her family's revenue generation. A portion of the profit from her business goes to pay school fees for her children, as they all go to school. She heard about AE&I in May 2004 from her friend and received her first loan two months later. She has been a good loan recipient.

loans.use: Kouakou Koffi will use the loan to purchase goods.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Hiep (45) and his wife Tam (40, pictured) own a small produce stand at the marketplace.  They sell a variety of fruits and vegetables; however, they often are only abL. to raise enough money to feed themselves and their 4 children. Their 4 children, Dung, Hanh, Phuc, and Truong, are all in school. Mekong Plus has helped the family by giving their daughter Phuc a scholarship to ease the costs of schooling.  Phuc is an excellent student, and the family and Mekong Plus wish for her to succeed in school. Hiep's body has been in a lot of pain, which has prevented him from working. Tam often tends to their stand at the marketplace. They would like a loan in order to increase their stock so that they can sell more each day.

loans.use: To buy more stock for produce stand

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice is married with 4 children. She is 35 years old and lives in Benin City. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. This was a business she started 8 years ago. She is requesting a loan of $175 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & foodstuffs

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac, 51, sells sawed wood at the Tema timber market. With the loan, Isaac will buy wood from the Eastern Region of Ghana. He will then process the wood to sell to furniture makers. Isaac’s business has expanded greatly over the past eight years. He now has five employees. 

Isaac hopes to expand even more in the future. His passion is making furniture, not just processing the wood for other people to build furniture. If he has the time and capital, he will open a furniture store. 

Isaac is a member of the lending group, Zion. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David D. is a bicycle repairer as well a trader who sells bicycle parts. David is married and has 2 children ages 4 and 1. His wife is a hairdresser who is working very hard to support her husband with the family’s finances. David wants to expand his business and increase his income.

He is asking for $1,200 to buy bicycle parts (rims, tyres, peddles, etc) and tools for his repair works.

loans.use: To buy bicycle parts (rims, tyres, peddles, etc.) and tools for his repair works.

loans.name: Ngham

texts.en: Mrs. Ngham S., age 21, is married and still lives with her parents. She works with her husband cooking Khmer foods and rice and sells them near Pshar Pouk market in Siem Reap, earning on average around $10 each day in revenue. Her one child is too young to attend school. She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to invest in her business by purchasing food supplies and using the leftovers to repair her house.

loans.use: Ngham would like to purchase food supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: Quach Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Quach Thi H. is 29 years old. She lives with her husband (38 years old) and two children, one boy, one girl. She has joined TYM Fund (Kiva partner in Vietnam) for 5 years. Her main job is to sell fruit and candy. This is a pretty popular job in her village. Mrs. H. chose this job because she can easily get money and pay back the weekly payments, while she is still able to stay at home with her kids. Each day she earns about 4 to 5USD from this little grocery store. Her husband, Nguyen Van That, opened a motorbike/bicycle repair shop right next to her store. In the free time, he often helps her with her work. Mrs. H. family is very happy. Her wish is to continue to borrow from TYM Fund to buy more goods for her grocery store. This time she wants to borrow 950USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Quách Thị Huệ năm nay 29 tuổi, còn chồng chị 38 tuổi, họ có 2 cháu, 1 trai, 1 gái. Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương được đến nay được 5 năm. Công việc chính của chị Huệ là bán hàng hoa quả, bánh kẹo. Đây là một nghề phổ biến với người dân trong vùng. Chị Huệ chọn công việc này vì vừa thuận tiện cho việc hoàn trả tuần vừa tạo thu nhập thường xuyên lại có điều kiện ở nhà chăm con nhỏ. Tiền lãi hàng ngày từ cửa hàng khoảng 4-5USD. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Thất, mở một quầy sửa xe ngay cạnh cửa hàng tạp hóa của gia đình. Những lúc rảnh rỗi anh là người phụ giúp đắc lực cho vợ trong việc bán hàng. Cuộc sống của hai vợ chồng thật hạnh phúc. Mong muốn của chị Huệ là tiếp tục được vay vốn từ Quỹ để mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho người dân. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị lần này là 950USD.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es:
Clemencia is married with 2 children. She sells various products for women like silver jewelry, cosmetics, new and used clothing, and other items.

She has worked in this business for over 10 years and has a loyal customer base that is always in need of her products. Clemencia’s previous loans from Fundacion Paraguaya helped her to increase her working capital, investing it in wholesale merchandise since that is the best way for her to get her products at a low price.

With the profits from her business, she helps her husband to pay the living expenses and her children’s education. She says that there are weeks when things go very well where she has had her best sales records; now she has begun selling school supplies since classes are just beginning.

Clemencia requests a loan in order to purchase more merchandise, such as creams, makeup, silver jewelry, clothing, pens and notebooks and large quantities in order to meet the strong demand of her new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Clemencia, es una señora casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de diferentes artículos para damas como ser joyas de plata, cosméticos, ventas de ropas nuevas y usadas, entre otros.

Ella se dedica a este rubro hace ya más de 10 años, posee una clientela fija que constantemente solicitan sus productos. Clemencia nos comentó que los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya anteriormente, le sirvieron para aumentar su capital de trabajo, invirtiéndolo en mercaderías a precio mayorista, ya que esta es una de las maneras en que uno consigue los productos a mejor precio.

Con las ganancias que le genera su negocio, ella puede ayudar a su marido a hacer frente con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos. Ella nos cuenta que hay semanas dónde le va bastante bien y registra mayor movimiento de ventas; y actualmente ella ha incorporado entre su stock de mercaderías artículos de librería y útiles escolares ya que estamos en época de inicio de clases.

Clemencia solicita hoy un crédito para la compra de más mercaderías como cremas, maquillajes, joyas de plata, ropas, lápices y cuadernos en grandes cantidades y así abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene de sus clientes nuevos.

loans.use: Purchase of creams, makeup, silver jewelry, clothing, pens and notebooks in large quantities

loans.name: Verónica Del Socorro

texts.es:
Verónica del Socorro is receiving her first loan from AFODENIC to carry out home improvements. This will enable her to fulfill her dream of having a pleasant, comfortable home that meets the basic needs of the family and allows them to live decently. Her house was recently constructed—it is built of concrete and has a metal roof. She needs this loan so that she can finish the construction work, since she wants to build a kitchen and divide the bedrooms.

Verónica works for the Minister of Education teaching in the Dolores Urtecho center, which is located in the Carlos Delgado area about 5 km from the Rio Plata neighborhood. She devotes her free time to agricultural activities, growing staple grains along with crops that are non-native to the region, along with raising birds and pigs. Her husband makes his living as a social worker in the communities of Nueva Guinea, where he works for the ADENG organization. The couple has two children. Their son is 18-years-old, has graduated and is teaching—he helps provide educational opportunities to adults in the Rio Plata neighborhood—while also studying mathematics at URACCAN university’s Nueva Guinea campus. Their daughter is 13-years-old and is in her second year of secondary school.

Verónica is an exemplary woman, one who is dedicated and self-sacrificing as she works for a better future for her family. She is both a mother and a leader of her family, who energetically shows her children the way and is able to provide a decent home. Verónica has confronted every challenge in life, graduating with a degree in teaching primary education, and has thus provided an example for her children. She very much hopes to complete her construction work.

Translated by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Verónica del Socorro solicita su primer crédito AFODENIC, para realizar mejora en su vivienda, así poder cumplir su anhelo de tener una vivienda cómoda justa bonita en la sociedad, con las condiciones básica que requiere la familia y poder vivir como ser humano, su vivienda es de concreto, techo de zinc recién construida, requiere este crédito para finalizar esta obra de construcción, pues desea construir una cocina y dividir los dormitorios.

Labora para el Ministerio de Educación como docente en el centro José Dolores Urtecho, comarca Carlos Delgado localizado a 5 km de colonia Rio Plata, y en sus tiempo libres labora en actividades productivas del campo, establecimiento de granos básico y cultivos no tradicionales en la zona, también se dedica a la crianza de aves y cerdo; su esposo aporta en los gasto del hogar, él labora de promotor social en las comunidades en la institución de ADENG Nueva Guinea, tienen dos hijos, uno de 18 años, es docente graduado, brinda servicio de educación de adulto en la colonia de Rio Plata, también estudia Lic. Matemática en al universidad URACCAN Nueva Guinea, y una hija de 13 años de edad que estudia segundo año secundaria.

Verónica es una mujer ejemplar, luchadora, abnegada al trabajo por un futuro mejor de la familia, esta mujer es madre jefa de familia, emprendedora para salir adelante con sus hijos, y poderle dejar un vivienda digna, Verónica ha enfrentado todos los desafíos de la vida, se gradúo en sus carrera de docente educación primaria, de esta forma a salido adelante con sus dos hijos, esta clienta sueña de tener finalizada su obra de construcción.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Grupo Belén - Carmen, Maritza, Yusli Group

texts.es:
Carmen, Yusil and Maritza are members of the Belén Communal Bank (first loan: www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28900&_tpos=1&_tpg=1).

Carmen lives with her common-law husband, is 35 years old and has five children. She sells animal intestines, which she buys at the slaughterhouse and then washes before selling them at an outdoor stand.

Yusil lives with her common-law husband, is 21 years old and has a 3-year-old son. She sells haberdashery like necklaces and ear rings, which she gets at wholesale in the markets of Ayacucho city.

Maritza is single and 21 years old. She, along with her sister, run a cebiche (regional dish made with fish and lime) stand on a rented site, which they hope to improve after the loan.

Carmen, Yusli and Maritza are requesting loans of 600, 400 and 1200 soles, respectively, which they plan to use to purchase intestines, toys, tables, chairs, pots and confectionary.

The three women dream of having their own homes, their own stable stores and build their business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28900&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Carmen, Yusli y Maritza son socias del Banco Comunal Belén.

Carmen es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 5 hijos, Carmen vende tripas de animales, que compra del camal y luego de lavarlas lo vende de manera ambulatoria.

Por otro lado Yusli es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo de 3 años, Yusli vende mercería como collares, aretes y los reparte por mayor en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Maritza es soltera y tiene 21 años, Maritza junto a su hermana tiene una cebichería en un ocal alquilado, con el préstamo que obtendrá implementara más su negocio.

Carmen, Yusli y Maritza necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tripas, juguetes, mesas, sillas, ollas y reposteros.

Los sueños de Carmen, Yusli y Maritza son tener casa propia, una tienda estable y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: Purchase intestines, toys, tables, chairs, pots and confectionary / Carmen, Yusli y Maritza necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tripas, juguetes, mesas, sillas, ollas y reposteros.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.es:
Mr. Loreto P. is from the city of Itacurubi del Rosario. He is a 55-year-old man who is married to Mrs. Francisca Capdevil, age 49. Loreto owns a factory in which he makes horsecarts.

He has been in business for 12 years, and has established a strong client-base. He is a very hardworking man who has his entire family’s support. Thanks to his efforts, they are all getting ahead in life. He hopes that his children will be able to pursue a university education in the capital city, and he will give them all the support they need.

With the loan that he is currently requesting, Loreto will set up a car wash—which his son will be running—thus increasing the family income with this new venture. Loreto already has the business space, but what he now needs to kick start the business are things like water hoses, cleaning products, motor oil, office furniture, and industrial vacuum cleaners, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Loreto es de la ciudad de Itacurubi del Rosario. Tiene 55 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Francisca Capdevila de 49 años. Loreto tiene una fábrica de Carros que son estirados a caballos.

Ya van 12 años que trabaja en esta actividad, y ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada. Es un señor muy trabajador que tiene el apoyo de toda la familia, y gracias a su gran esfuerzo están saliendo todos adelante. Su deseo es que sus hijos puedan estudiar en la Universidad en la capital y poder brindarles todo el apoyo necesario.

Con este préstamo que solicita, Loreto habilitará un lavadero para vehículos donde su hijo estará atendiendo, de este modo incrementarán con un nuevo proyecto los ingresos de la familia. Loreto ya posee el local lo que necesita ahora es montarla con los accesorios necesarios como mangueras, productos de limpieza, aceites para vehículo, algunos muebles de oficina, aspiradoras industriales, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase materials to set up a car wash

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio F., 30, has been living for three years with his partner, Liduvina Cañete, who is 24. The pair has a one-year-old son.

For eight years, Emilio has headed a motorcycle repair shop where spare parts for motorcycles are also sold. Emilio began his current business with modest savings from his former position at another shop where he worked as a motorcycle mechanic. In his own shop, Emilio receives his brother's assistance.

Emilio already has a regular clientele thanks to the customized attention and quality service he provides. His dream is to extend the business to include the sale of spare parts.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of spare parts of motorcycles, such as: clutch and brakes, oils, chains, crowns, and pinions. He wants to offer his clients a full array of merchandise so that they are able to find everything they are looking for.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Emilio F. de 30 años de edad vive hace 3 años con su pareja, la señora Liduvina Cañete de 24 años. La pareja tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad.

Desde hace ocho años, Don Emilio se encuentra al frente de un taller de Motos donde tambien tiene venta de repuestos para motos. En dicho rubro se inició con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba de su antiguo empleo en donde se desempeñaba como mecánico de motos para otro taller. En su taller recibe la ayuda de su hermano.

Actualmente ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a su personalizada atención y de buena calidad. Como sueño personal desea ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos.

El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de Repuestos para motos, táles como: cabo de embrague y frenos, aceites, cadenas, coronas, piñon. Para ofrecer a sus clientes un stock de mercaderias mas completa y el cliente pueda encontrar todo lo que busca.

loans.use: For the purchase of spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Mr. Eim Sarin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank President of this loan is Mrs. Eim S., who owns a small restaurant where she sells Chinese noodles to both villagers and visitors. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Eim S. is requesting a loan to buy more beef and other ingredients to cook delicious noodle dishes for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Meas Sophy, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make $5 a day to support his family. 

Mrs. Eim S. is 36 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a waiter while another is a carpenter. The third one is enrolled in school while the youngest is yet too young to work or stuD..

The 16 people in Slab Ta Oan Village in Kandal Province who comprise this loan group will use the loan for a variety of purposes.

loans.use: To buy more beef and other ingredients to cook delicious noodle dishes for her customers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is single and has no children. She has received schooling through Senior High level. Elizabeth sells footwear and groceries such as sugar, rice, biscuits and others at Mfantsipim Junction in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2004.

Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband in the payment of rent and utility bills. Elizabeth will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more shoes and groceries for sale to meet her ever-increasing customers' needs. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land she wants to buy with her husband.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more shoes and groceries for sale

loans.name: Lilliam Martina

texts.es:
La señora Lilliam Martina F. S., quien tiene la edad de 38 años, actualmente su estado civil es acompañada y con un pequeños hijo en edad escolar que tiene la obligación de mantener sus estudios. Se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 3 años en la ciudad de Masaya. Desde que inició el negocio ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y de mucho esfuerzo ya que cuando inició su negocio solamente contaba con 2 estantes de madera, y poco producto y ha logrado una superación personal y en su negocio, ya que el sueño de ella es darle una buena vida a su hijo. Una de las necesidades que atraviesa ella es la urgencia de obtener dinero para la compra de los productos de pulpería y es por esto que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan comprar sus productos como granos básicos: Arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles y cosméticos para comercializarlos, con el único fin de mantener su hogar y continuar dándole educación a sus hijos.

Es necesario destacar que desde que Ceprodel le brindó el crédito ha venido mejorando su situación económica ya que al incrementar los productos han incrementado sus ventas. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 1 créditos desde hace 3 meses.
texts.en:
Lilliam Martina F. S. is 38 years old. She lives with her partner and one young son who is school-aged and she is responsible for seeing to it that he can study. She has had a small grocery business for the past 3 years in the city of Masaya. Since beginning the business, she has shown herself to be a very responsible and hard-working person. When she began her business, she only had 2 wooden shelves and few products. She has achieved an improvements personally and in her business and her goal is to give a good life to her son. One of the needs she has is to obtain money to buy the products for her store. That is why she is applying to Ceprodel for a loan, which will allow her to buy products such as basic grains: Rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, and cosmetics she can sell. Her goal is to support her household and to continue providing an education for her children. It in necessary to emphasize that since Ceprodel gave her a loan she has been improving her economic situation. Increasing her products has increased her sales. Currently, her credit record is one loan three months ago.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mrs. Soeun K. is a 48-year-old farmer in An Doung Samreth village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who cultivates rice.  Her husband, Mr. Chea Chuon, is a duck breeder. Two of their are children are fishermen and the third is a construction worker.  Mrs. Soeun K.'s paddy is far from irrigation and the soil is infertile. In order to solve these problems, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump and fertilizer to increase production.

loans.use: To buy a pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Adelino João

texts.pt:
Adelino João B. é natural de Boane província do Maputo, tem 21 anos de idade, solteiro, apenas sustenta dois irmãos e a sua mãe. É professor primário com um horário das 7:00 as 12:30h, tem um salário mensal de 4700,00mt e faz poupanças por 500,00mt. Vive numa casa própria no bairro 3 de Boane.

Para Adelino este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro foi de 10000,00mt também destinou para compra de material de construção e tomou conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku através de colegas da escola que já eram clientes.

Adelino pretende pagar antes do tempo com propósito de voltar a solicitar outro empréstimo no valor de 20000,00mt para a conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
Adelino João B. is a native of Boane, in the province of Maputo. He is 21 years old and single. He supports two siblings and his mother. He is an elementary school teacher and works from 7:00am to 12:30pm. He makes 4,700 Meticais (MZN) and saves 500 MZN per month. Adelino lives in his own house in Neighborhood 3 of Boane.

This is Adelino's second loan request from Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner) and his first with Kiva. The first loan was for 10,000 MZN and also to buy construction material. He learned about Hluvuku through his colleagues at school who were clients.

Adelino intends to repay the loan early and to request another in the amount of 20,000 MZN to finish the job.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. is 45 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She sells foodstuffs like yams, peppers, crayfish, melons, stockfish and palm oil. She travels to the village to purchase foodstuffs to sell in Benin City. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mayela Cayetana

texts.es:
La señora Mayela Cayetana E. labora en el mercado La Terminal de León dedicándose a la venta de dulces como galletas, caramelos, chiches, entre otros.

Ella ha laborado desde hace tres años en este negocio y ha logrado suplir las necesidades que a diario atraviesa su familia. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual una vez más acude a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las especies y así ofertarlas. Es importante destacar que con el crédito que le brinde la institución ella a lo inmediato comprará las especias dando lugar a su venta.
texts.en:
Mayela Cayetana E. works in the La Terminal market in León, selling sweets like cookies, caramels, gum, and other things. She has worked for three years in this business and has been able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Now she has come to Ceprodel once more to request a loan to buy spices so she can sell them. Is it important to point out that she use the loan from this institution to buy spices right away so that she can sell her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets

loans.name: Farzana Arshad Group

texts.en:
Farzana baji, 36, is a married lady and a citizen of a historic place called Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 16 years. Her husband's name is A. and he has a jewelry-selling business. He has been selling jewelry for the past 10 years. He buys jewelry from famous cities (Lahore and Multan).

Farzana baji is the mother of five kids: four daughters and one son. Her son works as a salesman in a famous bakery in Lahore named “Gourmet”. Her daughters stay home and do the household work. Farzana baji is a seamstress and she sews clothes, taking orders from her relatives and from her neighbors. She charges US$ 2 per dress. She has successfully repaid three loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more jewelry to expand her husband’s jewelry-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Asia baji and Parveen Akhtar baji and Ruqaiya baji each want a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to re-sell

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar K. is a successful father of four children and a dedicated husband. Yashar began a small grocery store more than ten years ago with a small amount of savings. He is aided by his wife who helps him serve his customers. Today his clientele has grown larger and his grocery is more popular. He is asking for a loan of $1200 so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Yashar is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: purchase more goods for grocery store

loans.name: Balogun

texts.en: Balogun A. is 39 years old and married with 4 children. He makes shoes of various sizes and colours for his customers. He is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more shoe materials to make more shoes to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoe materials to make more shoes to sell

loans.name: Leonid

texts.en: Leonid is 37 years old and he is a farmer. He has land with an area of 15 hectares. He has worked on this land since 1999. He has no agricultural technique. The manual work he does with his wife, and for the weeding and harvesting he pays workers. He works with growing vines. He has planted 1 hectare of Moldovan sort vine. Last year he had difficulties in selling grapes, because of low prices on the market and he also received the money with delay. He grows wheat and corn for household needs and the surplus he sells to dealers of wheat. This loan was used to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and to pay for services in agriculture.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tursunoi

texts.ru: Турсуной Саттарова 1966 года рождения, замужем, но детей нет. Она Сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2007 года. Турсуной сама ездит за товаром в Истаравшан.  Торгует на рынке  10 , раньше торговала мелочами , постепенно поменяла товар на обувь и домашние тапочки. Также благодаря КИВА открыла еще одну торговую точку , где продает мужскую и женскую обувь.
texts.en:
Tursunoi S. was born in 1966, she is married but does not have children yet. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2007. Tursunoi travels for products herself to Istaravshan. She sells her products at market 10, at first she sold small items and gradually switched her products to shoes and house slippers. Also thanks to KIVA she opened another sales location where she sells men’s and women’s shoes.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expansion of trade

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe R. manages a small parcel of land. Before, she and her late husband has rented a land. Now, she gets income from a share of harvest that the real owner gives them. She is 52 years old, and a widow already.

She requests a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, which she will use to purchase herbicides, insecticides and complete fertilizers. The loan will greatly help her whole family improve their harvest.

CEVI has been providing financial services to rural communities. CEVI offers loans as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, insecticides and complete fertilizers

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel L. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old, widowed, and has three adult children. Isabel is just starting a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. In 2009, Isabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn Ngọc

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Ngọc (144001768) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has two school-aged children.

M. owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, primarily providing photographic services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month.

In 2000, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.

M. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 10th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar G. is 52 years old, an admirable mother and widow  She has shown a great enthusiasm for agricultural work and raising cattle. These activities have provided an education for her children. She continues to strive towards providing the well-being and education for her children and also towards being able to cover the expenses that her delicate health demands.. As a result of this, her work has been very limited, and her profits have decreased notably.  Mutabar would like to increase the quality of her produce with the purchase of fertilizers with the goal of obtaining a larger income to continue the children's education and improve their living condition. She is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni, which she will use to make her plans a reality.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.en:
This is Cholpon, the leader of this group. She is 38 years old. Her husband is raises livestock. They have three children. Their son and daughter are 19 and 17 respectively and the smallest child is just 3 years old. Apart from taking care of her baby, Cholpon keeps a cow and sells its milk to purchasers. Cholpon’s brother, working in Russia, once sent her money, with which she was able to buy five cows. Gradually she and her husband saved enough money to pay Cholpon’s brother back. This is due to their 20-year experience in cattle breeding. Raising livestock, Cholpon and her husband have been able to buy some furniture for their house as well as some household equipment. Now, they need to obtain a loan. With this loan they would get an opportunity to purchase calves to send to mountain pastures, keep them and then resell after bringing them back. They want to increase the total population so that after selling some of the livestock they would be able to pay for their son’s education. 

Here is Cholpon’s team: Asilbek, Kadicha and Halima. Asilbek, 44, rents a piece of land, where he grows watermelons, onions, tomatoes and cucumbers. Farming helps him provide for his wife and five children. Now he is in need of a loan to purchase fertilizers to grow more crops.

Kadicha, 49, is married and has raised seven children! Most of her children have gone to Russia for work. As for Kadicha, she sells vegetables: onions, potatoes and carrots. Kadicha needs a loan as she wants to begin selling fruit and thus expand her offerings. She also requests this loan to buy a calf.

Halima, 26, is married and has one child. Her husband does odd jobs at a construction site, whereas she keeps two cows and sells milk and yogurt. They want to increase the amount of milk for sale by buying one more cow. To do that, the only way is to get a loan. They have already built a new shed for that. 

======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept -- People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase calves for breeding to sell later

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes D. R. started her small colmado (a corner grocery store) many years ago by selling basic staples like flour and rice from her home. Over the years she has grown her business and has opened up a separate location right outside her home. 

Her home and her grocery store are made out of wooden planks. When Hurricane Georges hit in 1998 her house and business were destroyed. Hurricanes and tropical storms are very common here and there is always the threat that everything can be lost in an instant. Mercedes would like to reconstruct her house and business out of cement blocks so that they can weather the storms safely when they come.

loans.use: cement blocks

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine manages a general store business in front of her house. Aside from this, she also rents a stall in their school where she put up a small canteen and sells snacks during school days in order to have an additional source of income. From 7:00-10:30 in the the morning she sells snacks in the school and resumes again at 12:00-2:30 in the afternoon. After selling snacks, this is the time when she opens her store at home.
 
Lalaine would like to obtain a loan of PHP 5,000 to be used as additional business capital for her store and school canteen business. She is hoping that, through her business and with the help of her husband, who operates a passenger tricycle, they will be able to provide for the educational needs of their children and enable them to finish their college education.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Upper Jasaan in Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Josephine is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine makes and sells a variety of candies and other delicacies in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Josephine's 8th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to educate her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is 36 years old and he is single without children. He sells crates of drinks. He is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta C.' wish is to be a successful retailer. She is 55 years old and blessed with two children (already grown up). She likes selling a variety of goods. She enjoys trading her valuable items and she earns enough income to buy her family most of the basic necessities at home. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. By doing so, she believes that she would be able to grow her business even more. The loan will truly help her sustain her livelihood while its still unstable.

loans.use: Additional ingredients and buy kitchen equipment

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 33 years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Mary is a trader. She runs a grocery store by the roadside in her community.
