She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her inventory. Mary desires to give her children the best education that she can afford.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Unidas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
UNIDAS POR SIEMPRE

La alcancía comunal Unidas por siempre participa hace tres años en EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, el propósito D. sus diez integrantes es alcanzar el progreso a través D. sus negocios para brindarles a los miembros D. su hogar una mejor calidad D. vida. Ellos se dedican al comercio minorista como: venta D. calzado, ropa, golosinas, carteras, refrescos. Nos cuenta su caso Primitiva Huamán quien tuvo que trabajar a los quince años D. edad por falta D. economía en su hogar (Huancavelica) departamento más pobre del Perú. Preparaba en mi casa bolos más conocidos como panes D. la sierra, para ello compraba el trigo entero lo molía en casa y lo horneaba en el horno que hizo mi padre. Me levantaba temprano para recorrer las calles ofreciendo los bolos. 
Así mismo tenía que estar a las 3:00 am. en la parada (mercado mayorista D. Lima) para comprar verduras: cebolla, choclo, limón, espinaca todo por paquetes, después los repartía a las tiendas y al día siguiente les cobraba, del mismo modo elaboraba canastas hecho D. junco, vendía fruta (manzana y tuna). Con estos trabajos ayudé a mi esposo en mantener y educar a mis ocho hijos en el colegio. Trabajé vendiendo muchas cosas la situación era bastante crítica porque mi esposo se enfermó teniendo que apoyarlo aún más hasta que se restableciera. Estuve vendiendo comida, lo dejé debido al incremento D. la renta del local. Compré mercadería D. frazadas, edredones, pantalones los llegué a vender todos, consiguiendo aumentar el número D. pedidos, lo cual necesité créditos para cumplir en ello.
Los préstamos que recibí lo invertí en mercadería (ollas, baldes, tazas, cama, casacas, frazadas, edredones y zapatos). Con la voluntad D. Dios terminé D. educar a mis hijos en el colegio, mejoré mi casa D. esteras y techo D. calamina en una vivienda D. material noble todo fue posible con las ganancias que obtenía D. mis ventas además D. la ayuda D. mis hijos que hoy trabajan en el extranjero. Mis hijos ya no quieren que siga trabajando porque tengo 65 años y recibo D. alguna manera el apoyo D. ellos, pero he decidido continuar trabajando como microempresaria porque me siento una persona activa y útil en esta sociedad, así mismo mis ganancias pagan los gastos básicos D. mi casa y no depender del dinero D. mis hijos porque sé que también tienen su familia y eso involucra gastos adicionales. El préstamo que recibiré lo invertiré en ropa interior para damas, medias, conjunto D. ropa que es D. mayor demanda en esta fiesta naviD.ña.

Yenifer Girón, tengo 27 años D. edad, me inicié como microempresaria debido a que quería estudiar una carrera profesional; sabía que mi familia nos podía costear la inversión porque la situación económica D. mi hogar no lo permitía, así es que los fines D. semana prestaba servicios D. mesera en los clubs campestres; durante ese tiempo ahorré con el propósito D. invertir en sandalias D. verano (30 pares), adquiriéndole a mi primo la mercadería a menor precio dado a que es fabricante. Gracias a Dios vendí toda la mercadería a mis amistades y conocidos; estoy trabajando más D. un año D. esta manera los ingresos D. estas ventas más los trabajos que ahora realizo D. cocinera en clubs me permite estudiar la carrera profesional D. gastronomía en el instituto Continental (Huancayo), aportar en mi hogar y me compré un juego D. dormitorio. Requiero D. este préstamo para comprar cincuenta pares D. zapatos entre botas y sandalias. Terminar mi carrera es mi meta, sé que será duro pero al final lograré terminarlo porque seré cocinera profesional, desempeñándome en lo que más me gusta hacer. La carrera que elegía actualmente es bastante rentable lo que me permitirá ayudar más a mi familia.
texts.en:
Unidas Por Siempre The Unidas Por Siempre Communal Bank has participated with EDAPROSPO for three years. The intent of its ten members is to make progress through their businesses in order to give the members of their households a better quality of life. They have small businesses like selling footwear, clothes, sweets, purses, and soft drinks. Primitiva Huamán tells us her story. She had to work when she was 15 because of the lack of economic resources in her home (Huancavelica), which is the poorest department in Perú. In my house I maD. the most well known breads like mountain bread. To do so, I bought the wheat whole and ground it at home. I baked it in the oven my father maD.. I got up early to travel the streets offering the breads. I had to be at the stop (the wholesale market in Lima) at 3:00 a.m. to buy vegetables like onion, corn, lemon, and spinach. All are in packages, which I then distributed to the stores. The next day I collected payments. I maD. baskets from reeds. I sold fruit (apple and prickly pear). With these jobs I helped my husband support and educate our eight children. I worked selling many things. The situation was critical because my husband got sick, and I had to support him even more until he could reestablish himself. I was selling food. I stopped that due to the rent increase on the stand. I bought merchandise like blankets, quilts and pants. I sold them all and was able to increase the number of orders. I needed loans to be able to fill the orders. I used the loans I received to buy merchandise (pots, buckets, cups, bed, jackets, blankets, quilts, and shoes). Through God’s will I finished educating my children in school. I improved my reed house with a corrugated metal roof into a house maD. from strong material. All of this was possible because of the earnings I got from my sales and with help from my children who now work abroad. My children do not want me to keep working because I am 65. I receive some form of help from them, but I have decided to keep working as a small businesswoman because I feel like an active and useful person in this society. My earnings pay my basic household expenses, and I do not depend on the money from my children because I know that they have their own families, which means extra expenses. I will use the loan I receive to buy women’s underwear, hosiery, and outfits that are in great demand during this Christmas season. My name is Yenifer Girón, and I am 27 years old. I started as a small businesswoman because I wanted to study for a professional career. I knew that my family could not afford that because the economic condition of our household would not allow it. That is why on the week ends I worked as a waitress in the rural clubs. During this time I saved in order to buy summer sandals (30 pairs). I got the merchandise at a lower price from my cousin because he manufactures them. Thanks to God, I sold all of the merchandise to my friends and acquaintances. I have been working this way for over a year. The income from these sales, plus the work that I now do cooking in the clubs, allows me to study for a professional career in gastronomy in the Continental (Huancayo) Institute. I can also pay my household expenses, and I bought a bedroom set. I need this loan to buy 50 pairs of shoes, sandals, and boots. Finishing my career is my goal. I know that it will be hard, but in the end I will be able to finish it and be a professional cook. I will be doing what I most like to do. The career that I chose is profitable enough, which will allow me to help my family more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, shoes

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desD. hace 5 años atrás, del distrito  y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno. Ella  tiene 57 años D. edad, no cuenta con estudios, es casada y tiene 8 hijos (1 vive con ella y 7 tienen familia).
Marcelina se dedica a la venta D. carnes y paralelamente se dedica a la venta D. artesanìas. Nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar carne D. cordero, alpaca, porcino y res.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio. 
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Marcelina has been a member of the Communal Bank “Tupac Amaru I” for the past 5 years, and is from the Yunguyo District and Province, located in the Puno Department. She is 57 years old, does not have any formal schooling, and is married with 8 children (1 lives with her, and 7 have their own families). Marcelina sells meat, and concurrently also sells handicrafts. She tells us that with her first loan of 300 PEN that she requested through the Manuela Ramos Movement she was able to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN which will be used to purchase lamb, alpaca, pig, and cow meat. Her dream for the future is to improve her business. What she enjoys the most about her Communal Bank is saving and meetings with the other group members.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pig, lamb, cow, and alpaca meat.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José E. se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador ya que ha llevado el sustento a su casa de habitación gracias a sus esfuerzos y a su lucha por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Él tiene un negocio de tienda de comestibles donde ofrece todo tipo de comestibles pero requiere mejorar su localidad para brindar mejores condiciones a sus clientes y así lograr su satisfacción. Es por esta razón que ha decidido ampliar su local y para ello solicita un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para dar lugar a la ampliación y de esta manera tener un buen local que agrade a sus clientes que a diario le visitan.
texts.en:
Mr. José E. stands out for being a very hard worker since he has supported his household and has improved his family's quality of life through his work. He has a grocery store where he offers all types of edible goods but he needs to improve his location to offer better conditions to his customers and keep them satisfied. For this reason, he has decided to expand his store and is asking for a loan to purchase the construction materials so that he can have a better store that will please his daily customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, ella tiene un negocio que es la venta de ropa y especies al por mayor, el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Hace más de 8 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, sin embargo fue hasta hace dos años que la señora decidió invertir en la compra de especies, buscando de esta manera como incrementar sus ingresos. Últimamente han tenido muchos problemas relacionados con la inestabilidad en el precio del producto, y es por ello que necesitan financiamiento para cubrir cualquiera de estos problemas. Su sueño siempre ha sido agrandar más su negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa is 41. She has her own business in her home selling clothing and spices. Although she has been working on her own for the last 8 years, it wasn’t until two years ago that she decided to invest in buying spices to increase her income. Lately there have been many problems related to the instability of the price of the products. That is why she needs financing to handle these problems. Her dream has always been to increase her business to give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mr. Long R., 58, is a low-income person who earns a living by operating a farming business. He plants crops and raises pigs, which he sells when they are mature.

Long R. is married and has two children, both of whom are married. His wife is a partner in his business. As Long R. was not available for the photograph, his wife is shown instead.

Long R. is looking for a loan to buy piglets for his pigpen and to buy fertilizer to sustain his crops.

loans.use: To buy piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Lopepe

texts.en:
Lopepe T. is 50 and married with 6 children (ages 15 - 26).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Lopepe has many years of experience in this business.  Lopepe needs a loan of WST $2250 to rent land to raise additional crops.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Lopepe joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lopepe's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Lopepe T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to rent land to raise additional crops

loans.name: Oneness Group

texts.en:
For three years, Deddeh G. has been selling food such as oil, beans and eggs at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She sells her products at reasonable prices which keeps customers coming back. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children who range in age from 7 to 19 years old. In addition to her children, Deddeh supports three of her relatives. 

Deddeh plans to use her 30,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 100,000 LRD group loan to buy more food for her business. Her goal is to send all of her children to school.

Deddeh is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Oneness". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Deddeh is the person in the middle.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as oil, beans and eggs

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es:
Alicia G. es una socia activa D. L. alcancía comunal “UNIDOS PARA TRIUNFAR”, elL. tiene 25 años y vive en L. zona D. Huaycán distrito D. Ate, el grupo lo conforman 9 socios puntuales y responsables ya que su único objetivo es el bienestar D. su familia.

Hace varios años Alicia trabajo en una empresa D. costura  pero deseaba realizar otros trabajos, asi que empezó el negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo. Esto le beneficio mucho ya que pudo apoyar con los gastos en casa y L. mantención D. su hijo. Su mayor sueño es ejercer su profesión ya que elL. estudio Enfermería. El crédito será empleado para L. compra D. suministros textiles.

Con el préstamo otorgado los demas socios invertirán en productos e insumos que les permitan obtener  mayores ganancias y atender a exigentes clientes.
texts.en:
Alicia is one of the active members of the community bank called “United We Triumph”. She is 25 years old and lives in the Huaycán Zone, in the district of Ate. The group is maD. up of nine members who are punctual and responsible. Their only objective is the well being of their families. For many years Alicia has been working as a seamstress. She would like to start another line of work. She just began to sell beauty products by catalogue. This helps her a lot as she can now assist with the household expenses and help pay for the care of her child. Her biggest dream is to work in her profession. She studied nursing. She will use her loan to buy fabric. With the requested loan, the other group members will invest in products and supplies, which will allow them to optimize earnings and attend to the demands of their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona tiene 39 años de edad, es separada y tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, vive en el sector Santiago de Miraflores en el distrito de Zaña, una zona conocida por sus danzas típicas de influencia afro – peruana, queda ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de dos años se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en un ambiente de su domicilio. Este negocio nació de la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacarlo adelante, ella trata de brindar productos de calidad y ofrecer un buen trato a sus clientes. Su negocio goza de buena acogida y ello la pone orgullosa y contenta.

Las continuas lluvias que se presentaron durante los pasados meses de verano en la zona norte del país hicieron que su vivienda se vea afectada en algunas partes, pensando en el bienestar y en la calidad de vida de sus hijos, ella desea hacer las reparaciones necesarias para mejorar su vivienda. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles 
Asunciona es una madre responsable y bastante luchadora. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de calidad que les aseguren un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Asunciona is 39 years old, separated from her husband and has four children under her care. She lives in Santiago de Miraflores, district of Zaña, an area known for its Afro-Peruvian influenced dances located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than two years she has made a living selling grocery items out of a small store set up in her home. The business started out of the necessity to make headway for her children, for whom she always wants to provide the best. Asunciona tries to offer quality products and treat her customers well. Her store is well-maintained and it makes her proud and content. The continual rains in northern Peru that occurred during the past summer months have affected her home in some parts, and, thinking of her family's well being and quality of life, she has been hoping to make necessary repairs to improve her home. For this, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. Asunciona is a responsible mother and quite a fighter, and her biggest goal is to provide her children with a better quality of life and a quality education to assure them a successful future.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs and perform maintenance on her home, which was damage by continual rain.

loans.name: Eim

texts.en:
Eim E., 53, is widowed and resides with her six childrE. in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer growing rice and producing roof mats made from palm leaves for an income of about USD 2 per day. One of her daughters is a skillful tailor working at home, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

E. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more fabric for her daughter to produce more clothes for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy fabrics to produce clothes

loans.name: Yesu Ne Hene Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Victoria is a 40-year-old woman who describes herself as enterprising.  Victoria’s husband is a farmer and together they have 5 children between the ages of 6 and 22.  Victoria would like to give her children access to quality education. 
  
For the past 5 years, Victoria has operated a soap manufacturing business.  She will use the loan to buy caustic soda, vegetable oil and perfume for soap making.  Victoria hopes to eventually expand her operations so that she can reach more customers.  In addition to her soap manufacturing business, Victoria helps her husband with farming as well.  

Victoria is the leader of the trust bank group named “Yesu Ne Hene”, which means 'Christ is Lord' in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana.  There are 17 members in this group.  The group is all women except for one man.  The other members in this group operate retail businesses selling items such as plantains, cooked rice, onions, maize, beans and clothing.   They plan to use the loan to buy assorted inventory to grow their businesses and enrich their familes' living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for soap-making in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia T. is from the town of Albur. She is 53 years old and married to Francisco. Anastacia owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years now. In 2007, Anastacia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her eighth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia T. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 49 years old. Virginia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years. She works hard to be able to sustain her children's education because she wants them to finish college someday.

Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Virginia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees and to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy L.  is a 43-year old married woman who lives in Poblacion, San Jose, Negros Oriental.  She earns her living by operating her vegetable and fruit vending businesses.

Lucy’s husband, Pablio, is a driver and they have 2 children who are 13 and 15 years old.  Both children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Lucy  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a vegetable and fruit vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP13,000 from her business activities.

She is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP13,000 was used to fund the operations of her vegetable vending, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 8th loan, in the amount of PHP25,000, which she intends to use on her vegetable and fruit vending business. Lucy  is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma S. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of different variety of vegetables  in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sufuriana

texts.en: Sufuriana K. is currently in the business of selling bags of groundnuts and 'simsim' (sesame seeds) at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize  and millet to sell.  Sufuriana is 36 years old and is married to a husband who is a police officer. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a real shop in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: Stock bags of maize  and millet to sell

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.en:
Demetrio S. is from the village of San Juan. He is 44 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Demetrio owns and operates a furniture-making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Demetrio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Demetrio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Demetrio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand the products offered. This will be the 3rd loan Demetrio has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to expand the products offered

loans.name: Helen Silvia

texts.es:
La señora HELEN SILVIA A. O. de 26 años es soltera y tiene un hijo de 4 años, ella vive en el Barrio Villa Bolivia de la Zona del Plan 3000.

Ella tiene su propio restaurante, hace comida todos los días para poder subsistir, cocinando diferentes platos diariamente.

Necesita el dinero para poder aumentar su cantidad de Platos que elabora por día y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y asi mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
HELEN SILVIA A. O. is 26 years old. She is single and has a 4 year old son. She lives in the Villa Bolivia neighborhood of the Plan 3000 area. She has her own restaurant. She makes food every say to get by, cooking different dishes daily. He needs the money to be able to increase thw number of dishes that she makes every day and thus improve her income and improve her and her son's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is happy-looking because she feels so excited about the support that she got from Kiva lenders for her fishing business in her previous loan. Josephine prays they may all be blessed. She has a sound team relationship with Kiva as well as her ASHI partnership. Now she is requesting another Kiva loan to continue growing her fishing business. She has been able to improve her business due to her access to credit with a bigger loan from Kiva Lenders. 

In addition, Josephine revealed the huge impact the loan has had in her family, as she was able to afford to buy desired food items for the family to eat and still ensure prompt weekly payment of her obligation to ASHI and cover other needs. She is also happy because she is able to feed her husband well and still cover the needs of the family. 

What Josephine hopes right now is that their business will continue to be successful, because this has been their life, providing for their family. They love what they do in creating business achievements.

Josephine's fishing business has been very helpful in achieving her children's dreams. For her it is a pleasure to see the accomplishments in her business and family. With her children growing, she wants to see them have the best in life. Above everything else, Josephine’s happiness and contentment in life, being a mother and a wife, depends on the success of her business.

loans.use: To continue supporting her fishing business

loans.name: Hidia

texts.en: Hidia S. is 32 years old and married with five children. Her husband is serving in the army and all of her children attend school. Hidia is currently in the business of selling various goods at a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more items to sell such as bags of sugar, soap etc. With the extra profits from her loan, Hidia hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Tp stock more items to sell such as bags of sugar, soap etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She operates a hardware shop selling cleaning products, chemicals, car wax and polish. Her potential customers are car owners, neighbors and passersby. Elizabeth faces the challenge of delayed payments from creditors who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase paints, tough bond for cleaning products, chemicals and taping screws. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility to sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase paints, tough bond for cleaning products, chemicals and taping screws.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Mariam has a business selling fish, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more fish and cooking oil.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. 

 In the future, Mariam hopes to own a plot of land and build a house.  Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: more fish and cooking oil

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 29 years old and he is still single. Eugene has had his business for one year and his store is open from 7 am until 6 pm every day. Eugene owns a small business where he sells shoes. His business is well-known and organized.

Eugene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more shoes.   

He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Vive en el municipio de el Torno,  es nacida en el departamento de Chuquisaca, hace uno 10 años que se vino a vivir a la ciudad de santa cruz, su esposo con el cual tiene dos hijos se dedica al  transporte de personas(taxi), en la ciudad de santa cruz, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa en el mercado de la comunidad, hace unos dos años que se dedica a este negocio, viaja a la ciudad de la Paz a comprar mercadería ya que este fin de año se incrementa su venta y desea abastecerse de mercadería, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería por fin de año, es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Zonia lives in the town of El Torno.  She was born in Chuquisaca department but 10 years ago she came to live in the city of Santa Cruz.  Her husband, with whom she has two children, is a taxi driver in the city of Santa Cruz.  Zonia's main business activity is selling clothes in her local market.  She has been in this business for two years.  She travels to the city of La Paz to buy merchandise since her sales increase suring the end-of-year season and she would like to stock her business with merchandise.  Her loan will be used to buy merchandise for the end-of-year season.  Zonia is a young and very hard-working person.  She is grateful to our institution for the support she receives.

loans.use: To buy a variety of merchandise

loans.name: Abdibait

texts.en:
Abdibait N. was born in the Republic of Tadjikistan, in a large family of farmers.  From early childhood he had to help his parents in the field where his family cultivated vegetables. After graduating from Pedagogical University with diploma with honors, Abdibait returned home and began to work as a teacher of Russian language and literature at the local school. He was 26 years old, when he married and moved to Kyrgystan.

Using the money he had earned, Abdibait bought a house and rented land for cultivating crops. With the revenues from this activity, he bought a crushing machine and started his business of producing combined feed. He sells his products at the local market and supplies his loyal customers in neighbouring villages. In order to broaden his business and purchase crops for planting, he obtained his first loan from Bai Tushum, which was repaid without any delays.

Abdibait plans to use this loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase 10 tonnes of barley and 4 tonnes of corn. It will allow him to resell combined feed from these products in winter at higher prices. In the future, Abdibait is planning to give a higher education to his children and build a house for his family. Being a very purposeful and positive person, Abdibait works hard to support his family.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase crops.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: Erick is a business man who does outdoor advertisements including branding vehicles and billboards. He has been in the business for the past four years. He works with five casual workers. With the income he gets from his business he is able to educate his three children. Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to keep business records and to save his money. He has been guaranteed a loan of 50,000 Kes with the group members. He will use the loan to buy a laptop and a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a laptop and a welding machine

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
This is 56 year-old Yeabu. She is married and has three children. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they help with her family. In 1990, Yeabu established her home appliances business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 2,610,000 every month from this business.

 She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy additional rubber bowls. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 432,200. 

In the future, Yeabu plans to buy a concrete shop with steel doors. Yeabu would also like to increase her stock and renovate her home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional home appliances

loans.name: 18 De Mayo Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento I8 D. MAYO es un banco nuevo  y el Banco está conformado por 8 Integrantes 6 Mujeres y 2 Varones y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta ropas y otros, y L. Sra. GUADALUPE es L. presidenta del Banco y  tiene un hijo y elL. se dedica a L. elaboración D. masitas, galletas, pan elL. se dedica a L. repostería en su mismo domicilio y también se dedica a L. venta D. comida los días sábado y domingo, con el préstamo comprara harina, azúcar, por cantidad para L. elaboración D. sus galletas y D. esta manera incrementar su capital D. trabajo y L. Sra. MAURA es L. secretaria en el Banco y elL. se dedica a L. venta D. ropas por el catalogo a pedido del cliente a facilitad y con el préstamo comprará más mercaderías para su negocio D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos económicos, todas las socias están agradecidas con L. institución por el apoyo brindado en L. otorgación del crudito, una D. las socias no se encuentra en L. foto por problemas D. salud.
texts.en:
The “18 D. Mayo” communal bank is a new one.  It has 8 members, 6 women and two men.  The women are merchants selling clothes and other items.

Guadalupe is the bank President.  She has a son and she makes masitas (pastries), cookies and bread.  She is a home-based pastry baker and also sells prepared food on Saturdays and Sundays.  She will use the loan to buy flour and sugar in quantity to make her cookies thus increasing her working capital.

Maura is bank Secretary.  She sells clothing via catalogue on order from customers and with payment plans.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her business thus improving her income.

All the members are grateful to the institution for the support provided by granting the loan.  

One of the members does not appear in the photo due to health issues.

loans.use: To buy flour at wholesale.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita G. is from the village of Linabu, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 63 years old. Esterlita is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Esterlita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish such as sardines & salmon in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Esterlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell such as mackerel & sardines. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Esterlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell such as mackerel & sardines

loans.name: One Ward Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “One Ward” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Thaimu B.. Thaimu is aged 34; he was born in Port Loko, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Currently he is residing in Kenema together with his wife and two children. His wife is a trader and his children are attending school. Thaimu sells drums, tarpaulins and rain coats. He has been a businessman for seven years now. With his share of the loan, he will buy more drums, tarpaulins and raincoats to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy drums, tarpaulins and raincoats to add to his business

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en: Ngoun S. is 27 years old.  She resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. is a tailor, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Her husband is a mechanic, earning an income of USD 8 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 53 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase yams to stock for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income generated from her business to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: stock more yarns to sell

loans.name: Didaikan's Group

texts.en:
Didaikan M. is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and two sons.  The first son and the first daughter are married and live separately with their families. The second daughter went to work in Russia and the second son is handicapped. All her life, Didaikan has been breeding cattle, and she earns 3000 soms per month by reselling farm animals at a higher price after fattening. With money received from the loan, Didaikan wants to increase the number of cattle. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Isatu B., a small scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to ask for a loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to invest in her business. 

Isatu sells assorted goods, both in wholesale and in retail. She sells items such as sugar, salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, vegetable oil, and so on. She has been a businesswoman for eight years in the township of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone.

A wife and a mother of two children who attend primary school and one child who attends secondary school, the 25-year-old was born in Magburaka town, but now lives and sells in Kabala town. Isatu has requested this loan in order to buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, vegetable oil, and so on, in large quantities to resell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 40-year-old married man and the father of three kids. He has worked for twenty-five years as a car mechanic. He was fifteen years old when he first started this kind of business. He mentioned that his childhood wasn't interesting, and he wished he had been able to live it the way he had hoped.

Mohamad is requesting a loan for the fifth time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy car engines necessary for his business at a very good, encouraging price. His previous loans were invested in improving his business, and they had a great effect. Most of his customers are friends, relatives and neighbors, in addition to nearby villagers.

He hopes to keep on improving his business, in order to keep fulfilling his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy car engines necessary for his business.

loans.name: Cleofacia

texts.es:
La señora Cleofacia, vive en unión libre con el señor Saúl, con quien procreo cuatro hijos  que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Angélica María  de siete años, Carolina de cinco años, Elver  de tres años y el más pequeño  que  no tiene nombre es de tan solo tres  meses  de edad.

    El préstamo solicitado lo invierte en la compra y venta de becerros  para luego vender en la misma  localidad, en esta actividad nos platica que lleva  un año y se siente  contenta porque le va bien ya que con ello está sacando adelante  su pequeña familia.

   Ella lo animo su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar en el campo  y también a la venta de ganados así los dos tener como obtener ingresos  para  tener una mejor calidad de vida.

   Su más grande deseo   es que  con su actividad pueda  seguir trabajando para ahorrar y así lograr seguir apoyando a sus hijos y así sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Señora Cleofacia lives in a common-law marriage with Señor Saúl, with whom she has four children who are still in her care: Angélica María, who is 7, Carolina, who is 5,  Elver, who is 3, and the youngest, who does not yet have a name, is only three months old.

She will invest the loan she is applying for in the purchase of young bulls, which she will then sell in the same area. She tells us that she has had this business for a year, and she feels happy because it is going well for her, since with her business she is raising her little family.

She inspired her husband, who works in the fields and also in the sale of livestock. Thus the two of them have a way to obtain income to have a better quality of life.

Her greatest wish is that with this activity she can continue working to save and thus continue supporting her children so that they can continue going to school.

loans.use: to buy young bulls to sell.

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es:
Maria tiene 28  años de edad, ella cuenta con casa propia donde vive junto a su esposo, dicha vivienda está ubicada  en una zona rural del distrito de Túcume, dicha vivienda cuenta con los servicios básicos,  lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias.

María se dedica a la comercialización de animales en especialmente el de aves como patos, pavos, gallinas, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro, durante este tiempo, ella realiza sus ventas en caseríos cercanos a Túcume y también realiza entregas desde su domicilio. En todos estos años María  ha adquirido clientela fija para su negocio.  

Maria está solicitando un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles para comprar animales y alimento balanceado para  el engorde de estos además adecuará corrales para una mejor crianza.

María  es una  persona emprendedora y responsable, ella desea poder crecer como empresaria y poder alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old.  She owns her house where she lives with her husband.  Said dwelling is located in a rural zone in Túcume District and has all basic utilities.  The place is a small community made up of approximately 50 families.

Maria raises small farm animals to sell, especially fowl like ducks, turkeys and chickens, which she raises in corrals located in her back yard.  She’s been in this business for five years, that is to say, she knows the work to perfection.  During all this time she’s made her sales in hamlets near Túcume and also sells at home and she has also acquired a fixed base of regular customers.

Maria is asking for a 700 new sol loan to buy animals and nutritionally balanced feed for their development.  She will also equip additional corrals to better raise them.

Maria is an enterprising, responsible person.  She wants to be able to grow as a businesswoman and attain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Рахим житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него 5 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Рахим более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. Он арендует четыре гектара земли, где сеет пшеницу и хлопок. Сейчас он посеял хлопок и для получения хорошего урожая ему необходимо внести удобрения. Поэтому он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Rahim lives in J. Rumy.  He is 49 years old, married, and has five children.  His wife is a housewife.  Rahim has been farming for more than fifteen years.  He rents four hectares of land where he sews wheat and cotton.  Now he has planted cotton, and to reap a good harvest, he needs fertilizer.  Therefore, he is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer to reap a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou a 49 ans, elle est marié et fier de ses six enfants dont l’ainé à 17 ans. Elle habites dans un village un petit 20 kilometres de la grande ville régionalle, à l’interieur du Senegal.
Elle fait le maraîchage dans son terrain et après elle vend les produits alimentaire comme les carottes, les oignons et les aubergines. Elle aime bien son travail qui lui permettre de faire des nouvelles connaissances interessante.
La saison de pluie commence bientôt en Senegal et c’est la periode de l’année la plus chargé pour les agricoles. Elle cherches un crédit  pour l’aider a se préparer avant cette période en achatant les produits nécessaires comme le gazoil, les graines et les poudres engzais.
Avec les produits qu’elle va pousser elle va augmenter ces chiffres d’affaires qui lui permettra d’acheter des meubles pour sa chambre.
texts.en:
Fatou is 49 years old, married, and proud of her six children, of whom the eldest is 17. She lives in a town about 20 kilometres from the large regional city, in the interior of Senegal.
She has a market garden on her land, and sells food products such as carrots, onions, and eggplant. She likes her work very much, since it allows her to gain new and interesting knowledge.
The rainy season will start soon in Senegal, and it is the busiest time of the year for farmers. She is seeking a loan to help her prepare for this period by buying necessary items such as diesel, seeds, and powdered fertiliser.
She will farm using these products and raise her sales volume, which will allow her to buy furniture for her room.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilisers, and diesel before the rainy season.

loans.name: Dang

texts.en: Cultivating rice is part of 30-year-old Mrs. Dang’s daily routine. Rice is an essential product, vital to Cambodian people. She learned to do this from her grandmother and she was very well known in this sector from before she was married. Her husband assists her with the farm work. The family also raises a few pigs at home to generate extra profit. She has only one kid who is still unemployed and helps on the farm. Mrs. Dang will be using the loan to purchase a few pigs to raise and sell when they are big enough.

loans.use: to purchase a few pigs to raise

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.es:
José, es casado, vive con su esposa y una hija de 6 años de edad, vive con sus padres en vivienda familiar, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz, tiene 15 años de realizarlo y fue su padre quien le enseño el proceso, su horario es de 4:00am a 11:00am, todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y herbecidas para aplicarlos al cultivo, su objetivo es mejorar la producción del cultivo, teniendo una buena cosecha, su riesgo el clima, que puede afectar el exceso de lluvia.
Su aspiración es mejorar los cultivos, comercializar la producción y darle una vida digna y confortable a su familia.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his wife and a 6-year-old daughter.  He lives with his parents in the family house.  He grows corn, and has been doing this for 15 years.  His father taught him the process.  His schedule is from 4:00am until 11:00am every day of the week.

Currently he is asking for a loan for the purchase of fertilizers and herbicides to apply to his crops.  His goal is to improve the crop yield and have a good harvest.  His main risk is the climate, since an excess of rain can affect the crops.

His aspiration is to improve his crops, to sell what he harvests, and to give his family a dignified and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Santos Cristina

texts.es:
Santos tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Santos se dedica a la elaboración, venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú) y crianza de aves de corral, estas actividades los realiza desde hace varios años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de la chicha de jora y cerveza en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer Santos a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de harina de maíz para la elaboración de chicha de jora y alimento balanceado para sus aves, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y prmitirá que su familia se siga superando.
texts.en:
Santos is 59 years old. She lives with her husband and children in their own house. The house only has electricity as a basic service. It is located in the rural district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura. The population of this entire area is dedicated to agriculture, livestock and crafts.

Santos manufactures and sells 'chicha de jora' (a rich beverage made of corn and widely consumed in the north of Peru) and rears poultry. She has been doing both for several years, a custom passed down from generation to generation. Lately, the sales of 'chicha de jora' and beer have increased in the area where she lives which has helped increase her revenues and improve the quality of life for her family.

With this opportunity to grow the business, Santos has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy more corn flour for the preparation of 'chicha de jora' and nutritionally-balanced feed for her poultry, and in so doing to increase profits and the number of customers. The increased profits will be used to cover the loan and allow her family to continue bettering itself.

loans.use: to buy more corn flour for the preparation of chicha de jora (traditional corn-based beverage) and feed for her poultry

loans.name: Améyovi

texts.fr:
Améyovi est une femme âgé(e) de 54 ans. Elle est veuve avec 01 enfant en charge. 
Améyovi travaille comme revendeuse de parfum, de déodorant depuis 2006. Elle vend à domicile. Elle achète à LOME. 
Améyovi a requis son second  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des parfums et des déodorants.
texts.en:
Améyovi, age 54, is a widow responsible for one child. 

Améyovi has been selling perfume and deodorant since 2006. She sells out of her home. She buys her goods in Lomé. 

Améyovi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy various perfumes and deodorants.

loans.use: to buy various perfumes and deodorants.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: Wilber, tiene la edad 40 de años, está casado y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar unos novillos para el engorde. El cuenta con la experiencia y el lugar necesario para su explotación adecuada. El quiere aumentar el número de ganado a su poder y así poder tener más animales para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad. El quiere generar más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y así tener mayores facilidades. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Wilber is a 40-year-old married man who lives with his wife and 3 children, his main priority. With this loan, he will purchase some young bulls to fatten. He has the experience and the space necessary to adequately do so. He wants to increase his livestock so that he will be able to sell more at the local market. He wants to generate more profits for his family's well-being, thus he can have greater comfort. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has never had any loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has easily given him a loan at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase young bulls.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 37, married, and has a five-year-old child.  She runs a salon to earn a living.  She has been in the business for six years and has employed two people.  She also does poultry and pig farming to supplement her income.  Previously, she used to sell clothes.  She was able to open a salon after getting capital from Faulu Kenya.

Lucy hopes to open a hair-dressing college in the future.  She needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair blow-dryers.

loans.use: To buy hair blow-dryers.

loans.name: Henrry Milagro

texts.es:
Henrry (aparece en la foto con su esposa e hijo) tiene un negocio familiar ya que se levanta desde las 05h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días atender su pequeña tienda con ayuda de su esposa e hijo. 

Empezó su tienda hace dos años atrás cuando lo liquidaron del trabajo. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos hasta ahora que sigue con su negocio y su casa de bloques y ladrillos. En su tienda vende arroz, aceite, legumbres etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo vitrinas, arroz, legumbres, bebidas para que la tienda tenga variedad.
texts.en:
Henrry (who appears in the photo with his wife and son) has a family business.  He gets up at 5 a.m. and works till 6 p.m. every day, tending to his small store with the help of his wife and son.

He opened his store two years ago when he was let go from his work.  Little by little, he has been able to improve his income up to this point, where he can continue with his business, and with building his home from cinder-blocks and bricks.

In his store, he sells rice, oil, vegetables, etc.  He has many aspirations for his business, and so with the loan he wants to buy display counters, rice, vegetables, and drinks so that his store will have variety.

loans.use: to buy display counters, rice, vegetables and drinks.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 31 años, es una mujer luchadora con ganas de ser una gran empresaria, es madre soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de sus cuatro hermanos, su pequeña hija a quien adora y se esfuerza por darle lo mejor y que no le falte nada en esta vida. El trabajo de Patricia consiste en la elaboración y venta de productos lácteos como queso, yogurt, para lo cual cría vacas en el terreno de sus padres. Dedicada 10 años a esta actividad, le han servido para  ganar experiencia en su rubro, dedicándose íntegramente y contando con el apoyo de sus hermanos y asu vez contrata peones de la zona. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso para poder mantener la economía de su casa, trabajando arduamente y sacar adelante a su hija y hermanos. Viendo que  tiene mucha  demanda los productos pues tiene pedidos pendiente por atender, espera poder seguir creciendo y agradece la oportunidad brindada en el otorgamiento de su préstamo solicitado. Este será el quinto crédito con la institución MFP, se siente cómoda  y conforme con el grupo que conforma, siente que son personas responsables y ella también se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos para poder seguir contando con el apoyo de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprar frutas y envases para la elaboración de yogurt así como alambres para su cerco donde cría sus vacas.
texts.en: 31 year old Patricia is a hardworking woman who aims to be successful businesswoman. She is a single mother and lives with her parents, her four brothers, and her young daughter who she adores. Patricia strives to give her daughter the best and to make sure she is lacking for nothing. Patricia makes and sells dairy products such as cheese and yoghurt, and for this she raises cows on her parents' land. She has dedicated 10 years to this business and has gained a lot of experience in this sector. She has devoted herself to the work and has had the support of her brothers and has hired local laborers. What she likes about the work is that it enables her to have an income with which to support the household while she works hard and brings up her daughter and brothers. Being as there is considerable demand for her products and she has pending orders to attend to, she hopes to continue growing and is grateful for the opportunity offered to her by having this loan granted. This will be her 5th loan from the institution MFP, and she feels comfortable with the group she is a member of. She thinks they are responsible people and she also promises to be punctual with her repayments so that she can continue to have your support. She will use the sum of money requested to buy fruit and containers for making yoghurt and also wire fence for the yard where she raises her cows.

loans.use: to buy fruits, containers, and wire to secure her cowshed.

loans.name: Rosa Ramona

texts.es: La señora Rosa es cliente antigua de la institución, ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como salchipapas, hot dog y hamburguesas en un kiosco que tiene por su domicilio, ella sale a vender a partir de las 19 horas. Hasta las 23 horas, ella tiene su casa propia donde vive con su esposo, quien continuamente se  va de viaje por cuestiones de trabajo, ella vive en la casa con  su hijos, nuera y nietos, la señora rosa anteriormente tenía su puesto de comida en una para de trufis, encontrándose en el lugar ya hace unos tres años, ahora el crédito que solicita es para arreglar su kiosco, en el pintado y reforzado del mismo, además comprara insumos como papa y aceite para la venta de su comida, se encuentra agradecida con la institución por la confianza brindada.
texts.en: Rosa is a long-standing client of the institution. Her business is selling fast-food such as salchipapas (thinly sliced sausage or hot dog with French fries and sauce), hot dogs and hamburgers from a stall she has at home. She sells her food from 7.00pm until 11.00pm. She has her own home where she lives with her husband who is always traveling for work reasons. She lives in the house with her children, daughter-in-law and grandchildren. Rosa used to have her food stall at a taxi stand but has been working in her new location for three years. Rosa will use the loan that she is requesting to fix up her stall, painting it and strengthening it. She will also buy some supplies such as potatoes and oil for preparing her food to sell. She is grateful to the institution for the trust they have placed in her.

loans.use: to buy paint to fix up stall and to buy supplies

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Pisey  is 23 years old and her husband, Vanny is 30 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one young son. 

Pisey is a weaver and her husband is a farmer. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her husband's farming business and to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide and  to buy weaving materials.

loans.name: Tülay

texts.en:
Tülay is 36 years old and married with no children. She joined a Maya business development training meeting about a year and half ago. After the meeting she asked herself, "What can I do for myself?" She spent about 6 months researching and then applied to Maya for individual credit. With the credit she received, she rented a little shop where she sells bulk wholesale and retail cleaning supplies as well as some household brand name supplies, hygienic products and gift items. Most of her clients are housewives. She has been operating her shop for one year. She says the first 6 months were very hard and she didn’t make much money. She was new to the neighborhood and the neighborhood was slow to start doing business with her. They wanted to see what kind of person she is, if her business was solid or would she be gone in 6 months, and what kind of prices she had before they would do business with her. 

Tülay did not ask her husband for support to start her business and, in turn, he wasn’t very supportive. He kept saying and thinking that she wasn’t going to succeed. She wanted to show him she could succeed and after 6 months her business started making money and she paid off her first loan early. Tülay says that to show him she could succeed from her own efforts was very satisfying. She wants to grow her business but did some additional research before taking out her second loan with Maya and her first on Kiva.

From the market research she has done, she will make agreements with two companies in order to buy bulk wholesale cleaning products from them. This is why she needs capital and how she will use her loan. She believes that by working with these two companies she can increase her profits. In the future, she wants to transition her business focus from retail sales to wholesale and expand the types of cleaning products she offers to customers. For example, instead of only selling household cleaning products to housewives, she would like to offer cleaning products for industrial workplaces, such as factories, restaurants, and car dealerships. Tülay is ambitious but plans her business in small steps after careful research.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Tülay 36 yaşında evli ve çocuğu yok.

Maya’nın eğitim toplantısına katıldı.  Kendi adına ne yapabilirim dedi.Önce 6 ay araştırma yaptı ve bireysel kredi için Maya’ya başvurdu.  Kredi ile küçük bir dükkan kiraladı ,burada toptan perakende satışı ve temizlik malzemeleri,çocuk bezleri,kadın pedleri ve hediyelik eşyalar satmaya başladı.Müşterilerinin çoğu ev hanımıydı.  Dükkanını 1 yıldır işletiyor.  İlk altı ayın çok zor olduğunu söylüyor ve bu sure zarfında hiç para kazanamamış.  Başarabildiğini eşine göstermek istiyordu ve 6 ay sonra para kazanmaya başladı ve kredisini erken ödedi.

Çevrede dükkanı kimse tanınmıyordu ve çevredekiler zamanla tanıyıp,dükkana gelip gitmeye başladılar.  Nasıl bir insan olduğunu öğrenmek istiyorlardı,İşi devam mı edecek yoksa, 6 ay daha böyle mi gidecek ve fiyatlar nasıldı.

Ama eşi hiç destek olmadığı için başaramayacağı gözü ile bakıyordu.  Başarılı olacağını düşünmüyordu.  Eşime de birşeyleri başarabildiğimi gösterdim,en güzel yanı buydu.  İşinde büyümek istiyor ama ikinci krediden önce araştırma yaptı,ikinci kredi ilk defa kiva da.

Market araştırması yaptı ve iki firma ile anlaşma yaptı ve buradan temizlik malzemesi alıcak.  Bunun için sermayeye ihtiyacı var ve krediyi nasıl kullanacak.  Yeni aldığı mallarla anlaştığı 2 firmaya satış yaparak daha fazla kara geçicek.  Gelecek için perakende satıştan toptan satışa geçecek.  Mesela,ev hanımlarına tek tek temizlik malzemesi satacağına,endüstriyel yerlere,fabrikalara,galerilere satıcak.  Tülay Hanım,çok hırslı fakat işinde adım adım ilerlemek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy bulk wholesale cleaning products

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma's group is comprised of hard working women. Mwajuma is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Mwajuma has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Mwajuma has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, which will help Mwajuma generate greater profits and pay for her mother’s medication. Mwajuma hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Mwajuma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mwajuma's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Fadhili Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Fadhili group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Moses takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Moses was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Moses will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Fadhili group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Akuol

texts.en:
Akuol is a 28 year old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food stuffs in bor south Sudan for three years.
Akuol is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Diana Marbelly

texts.es:
Diana, 33 años de edad, originaria de León, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Ella nos comparte su experiencia vivida con el primer préstamo Kiva ya que la ayudo a comprar un freezer para almacenar su producto ahora tiene capacidad de almacenar 300 libras de mariscos, esta muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido que la ayudado mucho a impulsar su negocio. 
Ella requiere un segundo crédito para compra al por de mariscos. Pues con esta inversión pretende satisfacer parte de la demanda de sus clientes además de seguir con sus planes de mejorar su local y reparar su hogar.
texts.en:
Diana is 33 years old and is a native of León.  She makes a living selling seafood.  She describes her experience with her first Kiva loan, which helped her to purchase a freezer for storing her products.  She now has the capacity to store 300 pounds of seafood.  She is very grateful for the support she received, which helped her a lot by giving a boost to her business.

Diana needs a second loan so that she can purchase seafood.  She hopes that she can satisfy some of her customers’ demand with this loan.  She also hopes to continue with her plans to improve her premises and to repair her home.

loans.use: to purchase seafood.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora Luz es socia del banco comunal Zhullin, vive en por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es conocida como San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues y es considerada como una ciudad patrimonio arquitectónico y cultural del Ecuador, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan porque ser gente amable y gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora. Luz tiene 30 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 10, 6,4 años y un bebé de 10 meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en una panadería como panificador, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
  
Ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar en donde pasa al cuidado de sus hijos y también cría pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas y en alimento para las mismas.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the “Zhullin” communal bank.  She lives in the sector of the same name in the city of Azogues.  This city is known as San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues and is considered to be one of Ecuador’s cultural and architectonic heritage cities.  Its residents are merchants, raise animals and farm and are noted for being nice and kind people; they preserve their culture and traditions.

Luz is 30 years old, married and has had four children who are 10, 6, 4 year old and a 10-month-old baby.  Her two oldest children go to the local elementary school.  Her husband works as a baker in a bakery.  They do not own a house; they rent.

She does her household chores where she spends her time caring for her children and also raises chickens and guinea pigs that she sells in her community whenever she needs money.

She’s in her fourth cycle in the communal bank and will use the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed.  Her dream is that her children study and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Yiéli

texts.en:
