Yiéli K. is a young man of 29, married, has one child, and is responsible for two others. After finishing grade school, he chose to pursue agriculture, but the difficulty of manual labor did not allow him to fully enjoy his work. His tools were quite rudimentary and thus dampened his goals and ambitions.

The resources at his disposal do not allow him to save money that could allow significant borrowing. And so he is requesting financing of $1,200 to buy a motorized pump and plow and to buy soil amendments. This young man, brimming with courage and energy, is offering to repay this financing in 18 months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Jeune homme de 29 ans, K. Yiéli est marié et père d’un enfant et de deux (02) autres personnes à sa charge. Ayant arrêté ses études après le cours primaire, il a choisi l’agriculture mais la dureté du travail manuel ne lui permet pas de jouir pleinement de son travail. Ces outils sont très rudimentaires réduisant ses objectifs et ses ambitions.

Les ressources qu’il dispose, ne lui permettent pas d’effectuer des épargnes pouvant lui permettre d’accéder à un crédit conséquent. C’est pourquoi, il sollicite un financement de $1200 d’une moto pompe et une moto cultivatrice pour les billons et pour l’achat des intrants. Ce jeune homme plein de courage et de dynamisme propose de rembourser ce financement en 18 mois.

loans.use: To buy motorized pump, a motorized plow, and soil amendments

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson es nativo del sector arrocero de Baba. El vive con sus tres hijos y dos hijos de un compromiso de su esposa que tenia antes. Wilson ha podido mantener su familia gracias a la producción de arroz y plátano que le da su hacienda. El quiere invertir en fertilizantes y pesticidas para mantener y cosechar estos productos. El tiene la esperanza de arreglar su casita que ahora es de caña y esta vulnerable a las lluvias.

English:

Translated by Nuria Ruiz, Kiva Voluteer.

Wilson family has lived in Baba for a long time. His family has always worked in the rice fields and industry in Baba. He lives with his wife and five children, two of his children are from his prior partner. Wilson is been able to provide for his family thanks to the rice and banana production of his plot of land. He is requesting a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his crops and to fix his house. Right now his house is made out of bamboo and thus not very well suited for rainy season.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Rosa de Oro (Golden Rose) Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Rosa de Oro helps the farmers by providing access to machinery, training services and government assistance. The farmers from Rosa de Oro are very close to each other and cooperate to help one another on their farms.

The members of Rosa de Oro will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Rosa de Oro Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Baba compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large mulitnational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by the small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soy beans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Baba

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soy beans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Cosechar arroz

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mr. Suy E. K. is 34 years old and lives in Kampong Chnang with his wife and their 4 children. Mr. Suy and his wife operate two small businesses--one washing motorbikes and cars, and another raising and selling pigs. Their combined income from these activities is about $6/day, which is just enough to send their children to school.

Mr. Suy E. K. will use this loan to purchase more pigs and feed for raising his animals. He knows he can increase his income if he raises more pigs, and the business also allows him to continue washing motorbikes.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and feed

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel is 42 years old, separated and has 3 small children. In order to be able to send her children to school and feed them, she started to bake bread in her house in small quantities and to sell it around her neighborhood. Now she has a small bread shop in her house which enables her to support her household with the bread she sells. With a loan she hopes to buy a large kitchen where she could bake more bread. She is a member of the Solidario 11 microcredit group. Also in the group are Martha Ureña Martínez (perfume and cosmetics sales) and Martha Martínez Trejo (perfume and cosmetics sales). They hope to combine their loans to order larger quantities and varieties of products from another city to then divide them and expand each of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

MARIVEL, tiene 42 años , esta separada y quedo con 3 hijos pequeños , para educarlos y alimentarlos empezó a hacer pan en su casa en pequeñas cantidades los cuales salía a vender por su comunidad , actualmente tiene una pequeña panadería en su casa que le permite mantener su hogar con el producto de sus ventas, con el préstamo espera comprar una cocina grande donde pueda producir en mayor cantidad su pan . Pertenece al Grupo Solidario 11 junto con doña Martha Ureña Martínez (venta de perfumes y cosméticos) y doña Martha Martínez Trejo (vende perfumes y cosméticos) ellas esperan unir sus préstamos y encargar a otra ciudad mayor cantidad y surtido de productos para luego repartirlos y acrecentar sus respectivos negocios

loans.use: TO MAKE AND SELL BREAD

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Diana pertenece al Banco Comunal Lomas de Yarina,  del Jr. Comandante Suarez nro. 1069 del sector del Arenal  del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja como taxista en motocard, apenas tiene un ingreso de S/. 550.00 (US$ 177.00) ingreso que no es suficiente para los gastos de la familia. 

Diana por invitación de su vecina decide participar en los prestamos de Manuela Ramos, desde entonces decide vender dulces, panes, etc.  Ahora tiene un horno hecho a barro con el cual puede elaborar los panes, bizcochuelos, ñuto de yuca, turca (bizcocho de Maíz) y Puchucuy (hecho de maíz, masato), además dada la necesidad, tuvo la iniciativa de vender por medio de otras mujeres, les da una cierta cantidad de panes a precio de costo dándoles el 40% de utilidad.


El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500 (US$ 500 Aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses,  será utilizado para mejorar su horno actual e instalar otro horno de barro, además comprará 1 saco de maíz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de yuca. 

Diana  esta muy contenta de dar oportunidad a otras mujeres para que generen ingresos así como contribuir económicamente para su hogar.

loans.use: Mantenimiento y compra de horno.  Compra de insumos.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
My husband and I have a bakery. Little by little we have been gaining customers and the business has gone well, thank God. Now we want to buy a vehicle in order to be able to sell bagged bread on the street and also visit other stores where they could sell our bread, thereby increasing our earnings. I am seeking a US$1200 dollar loan to buy a vehicle to deliver bread.



Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

“Mi esposa y yo tenemos una panadería, poco a poco hemos logrado tener nuestros clientes y nos ha ido bien gracias a dios, ahora tenemos la intención de comprar un vehículo para poder vender el pan en bolsas por las calles y también visitar otras tiendas donde vendan nuestro pan, de esa manera obtendremos más ganancias” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar un vehículo para repartir el pan.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of a vehicle in order to sell bread in other stores and in the street.

loans.name: Hekima B Group

texts.en:
Khadija, age 23, lives with her parents and takes care of her 12-year-old orphaned nephew. She owns a cosmetics shop, which she opened in March 2007. At her shop, she sells cosmetics from 9am to 8pm daily, and makes a monthly profit of about $212.

Khadija hopes for a loan to buy more stock for her shop. She will share this loan with her fellow subgroup members Salma and Hanifa, both doing food sales.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics stock

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey R., age 56, is a widow and a mother of four children. She works selling porridge to the people in her area making on average around $2 each day. One of her children works as a construction worker, one is employed at the Angkor Cultural village, and the other two are married and live separately.

She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to purchase a motorcycle to use for family’s transportation. This will lower transportation expenses to work for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for family’s transportation.

loans.name: Aydalina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Aydalina is 36 years old and lives with her family in the housing development Laureles Norte, a semi-rural, poor neighborhood where the majority of the population has difficulty satisfying their daily needs. Aydalina's family is made up by her husband, who works as a self-employed truck driver, and their son. Her husband handles the responsibility of providing for the family; he also pays all of the basic services including the family's grocery bills. Two years ago, with her husband's economic support, Aydalina was able to launch her own small business selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics in the street. The income that her business generates has allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses. They are a very close family. Together they have been able to progress, always with the objective of offering their young son better quality of life during his developing years, including a decent home. Aydalina's dreams of one day running her store out of fixed premises where she can offer her products in a more secure manner while also caring for her son. This mother's most urgent need at the moment is the need to close the back wall that faces the patio of her home, since it is the only wall still missing. She dreams that her humble home will soon be a more secure place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Aydalina tiene 36 años, habita con su familia en el asentamiento Laureles Norte, el cual es un barrio semi-rural, pobre, en donde la mayoría de la población tiene dificultades en satisfacer las necesidades del día a día. La familia de la señora esta compuesta por su esposo quien trabaja de camionero por cuenta propia, se encarga de proveer al hogar y pagar todos los servicios básicos así como de la alimentación de su pequeño hijo. Con el apoyo económico de su esposo, pudo hace 2 años emprender su pequeño negocio, en el cual ofrece de manera ambulante ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. Los ingresos que le genera dicha actividad le permite apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, son una familia muy unida, juntos han podido salir adelante, todo con el fin de brindarle a su pequeño hijo mejores condiciones de vida en la cual se pueda desarrollar ,así como un hogar digno. El deseo de la señora es el de llegar a tener un local fijo en el cual pueda ofrecer sus productos de manera más segura y al mismo tiempo cuidar de su hijo. La mayor necesidad de esta madre en estos momentos, es el de cerrar el muro de atrás de la vivienda que da con el patio, ya que es la única pared que le falta de construir, lo que más desea es que su humilde vivienda se encuentre segura de habitar.

loans.use: Buy blocks, sand, iron and cement to use in the construction of the rear wall of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in cloth, threads and other materials

loans.name: Sok Un Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sok U. lives in Kralanh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is the group leader of a five member group. She is 33 and married with five children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while two others are enrolled in school. The last two stay at home because they are too young to work or study. Mrs. Sok U. is a basket maker and seller in the local village. Her husband, Heang Huon, is a construction worker and he also helps his wife. In order to improve her business, Mrs. Sok U. has asked for a loan to buy more raw materials to make baskets to sell.

loans.use: These women would like to buy raw materials to make baskets to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Rosalinda started her business due to the need to contribute to the household expenses, given that her husband could not pay for their two children’s educations as well as their living costs. She started 12 years ago with a grocery store in her home, since she had always been good at sales. Over time, she has consolidated and grown her enterprise.

She is now asking for a loan of $775USD to be repaid over a term of six months in order to purchase merchandise. This credit will be very useful to her in continuing to grow as a small business owner. Let’s support Rosalinda.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosalinda inició el negocio por la necesidad de apoyar con los gastos del hogar, ya que su esposo no podia pagar los estudios de sus 2 hijos y los gastos familiares. Comenzó hace 12 años con una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio ya que ella simpre ha tenido una gran facilidad para las ventas. A lo largo de este tiempo ha consolidado su negocio y lo ha hecho crecer.

Ahora solicita un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia. Este credito le va ser de gran utilidad para que siga crecindo como microempresaria. Apoyemos a Rosalinda

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Kifoyat

texts.en:
Kifoyat R. is 38 years old. She’s married and the loving mother of two children. For a long time her husband couldn’t find the good job and recently left for Russia to seek out a living. Thus currently Kifoyat's business is the main source of income of the family.

Kifoyat is a farmer. On her plot of land she is growing such crops as potatoes, onion, tomatoes, cucumber and cabbage. Having been working the land for seven years, Kifoyat has gained rich experience. Each day she works diligently to make sure that she takes good care of her crop. Each year she is growing sufficient food for the family consumption and for selling. She is doing all the best in order to give her dearest children a good education and to meet all their needs. With her job, she has been able to pay for the schooling of all her children. This motivates her even more to keep working the land.

Now Kifoyat needs to purchase mineral fertilizer and seeds for seasonal planting. She’s asking for a loan of $US525 for a term of 12 months. This amount would help her accomplish her goals in a short time. Your generosity can change her life.

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
This microentrepreneur Maribel M. B. is from the city of Bluefields. She is 38 years old, married to Mr. Alfred Castillo, she has two young children. With the income from her business, Mrs. M. pays her children's educational expenses. Mrs. M. has sold cheese, cream, curd, and eggs for more than eight years. Her customers include passers-by who prefer her because she offers a variety of milk products. This is the second loan for this microentrepreneur. It is worth noting that the products she offers are in high demand by her customers. Currently, she needs to buy 300kg of cheese at $120/kg, 3 cans of cream at $32/can, 50 packages of cuajada (dry curd cheese) at $0.80/package and 1 box of eggs at $4.00/box. With this investment, she will be able to satisfy increasing customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La microempresaria Maribel M. B. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Alfredo Castillo, ambos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, con el ingreso del negocio la Sra. M. paga los gastos de educación de su hijo. La Sra. M. vende queso, crema, cuajada y huevo por más de 8 años, teniendo como clientes a los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos lácteos. Este es el segundo crédito de la microempresaria. Cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no han disminuido su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar: 3 quintales de queso a $ 120.00 dólares el quintal, 3 bidones de crema a $32.00 dólares el bidón, 50 pares de cuajada a $0.80 centavos el par y 1 cajilla de huevo a $ 4.00 dólares la cajilla, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, cream, cuajada, (dry curd cheese), and eggs.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji lives in Shah Rukn-e-Alam, a part of the city of Multan. Multan is famous for its historical places and handicrafts. She owns a two-room brick house where she has lived for the past 25 years. She is the mother of seven children: two sons and five daughters. Her elder son works in a hospital. The other children are getting their educations. Naseem baji's husband, R. M., is a worker in an organization named "Saeed Building."

Naseem baji has a business of selling clothes. She has 20 years of experience. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Saba baji wants a loan to buy supplies (telephone set and wires) to make a telephone booth. Safia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zareena baji wants a loan to buy chickens for her chicken meat business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.pt:
Jose tem 29 anos nasceu em homoine um distrito da provincia de inhambane, vive maritalmente e pai de duas filhas a primeira com 6anos e a segunda com 2anos de idade so a mais velha é que se encontra a estudar. Jose mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira com Swazilândia a procura de emprego  na companhia da sua tia que já vivia neste distrito.
José chega a Namaacha em 1997 em casa da sua tia. Trabalha num restaurante durante 2anos e recebia  mensalmente um salario no valor de 250.00mtn, mas  como o valor não conseguia satisfazer  as suas necessidades, inicia o seu proprio negocio com o valor colectado nos seus 2 anos de trabalho. Começa a vender bolos e recargas de telemoveis na fronteira, trabalhando das 7h as 20h quando a fronteira fecha as portas o seu negócio tem bons resultados hoje Daniel já tem sua propria casa onde vive com a sua familia. O melhor produto de Daniel são as recargas que compra por 15,00mtn, 45.00mtn, 74.00mtn e  90.00mtn e vende por 20.00mtn, 50.00mtn, 80.00mtn e 100.00mtn consecutivamente, tem um rendimento mensal de 3,000.00mtn e consegue poupar 500.00mtn, ajuda os seu avo que se encontra em homoine enviando-lhe uma caixa de sabao, 50kg de arroz e 25kg de acucar em cada 6 meses que coresponde a 1,500.00mtn..
Este é primeiro emprestimo de jose na hluvuku e kiva no valor de 12.000.00MT pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria para satisfazer as necessidades e exigencias dos clientes. Tem como objectivo ampliar a sua barraca e iniciar com a obra de ampliaão da sua casa
texts.en:
Jose is 29 years old and was born in Homoine, a district of the province of Inhambane. He is married and the father of 2 daughters. The first is 6 years old, and the second is 2. Only the oldest is in school. Jose moved to Namaacha, a town on the boarder of Swaziland, searching for a job at his aunt's company who already lived in that district. Jose came to Namaacha in 1997 and stayed at his aunt's house. He has worked in a restaurant for 2 years and receives a monthly salary of 250MT, but because the income does not satisfy his necessities he started his own business with the earnings from his 2 years of work. He started selling rolls and cellphone refills on the boarder. He works from 7:00am to 8:00pm when the boarder closes. His business has good results. Jose already has his own home where he lives with his family. Jose's best product are the refills that he buys for 15MT, 45MT, 74MT and 90MT and sells fo 20MT, 50MT, 80MT, and 100MT consecutively. He has a monthly income of 3000MT and is able to save 500MT. He helps his grandfather who is in Homoine by sending him a box of soap, 50kg of rice, and 25kg of sugar every 6 months that corresponds to 1,500MT. This is the first loan for Jose with Hluvuku and Kiva for the amount of 12,000MT. He intends to increase the volume of his merchandise to satisfy the necessities and demands of his clients. His objective is to improve his stand and begin work enlarging his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell products

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Gloria M. es actualmente una pequeña microempresaria la cual comenzó trabajando desempeñándose como obrera, pero posteriormente con la ayuda de su esposo y esfuerzo propio comenzó con un pequeño negocio de talabartería en donde solo realizaba trabajos pequeños como fajas, cartucheras, grabados en cueros, billeteras, etc.

Después cuando fue conociendo el mercado y con la ayuda de pequeños préstamos en Ceprodel comenzó a elaborar y comercializar artículos más grandes como monturas albardas y otros artículos que son demandados por ganaderos de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Hoy en día la razón por la cual solicita un crédito es porque requiere invertir en la compra de los productos. Con este préstamo se beneficia tanto ella como su familia a la que quiere mucho.
texts.en:
Gloria M. is currently a small microentrepreneur who started working as a laborer. Later, with her husband’s help and her own efforts, she started a leather goods business making small items such as belts, holsters, leather engravings, wallets, etc.

Subsequently, as she got to know the market and with the help of small loans from Ceprodel, she started producing larger products such as packsaddles and other articles in demand by ranchers in the northern zone of Nicaragua. Today, the reason why she is requesting the loan is because she needs to invest in purchasing products. This loan will be of great benefit to her as well as to her family which she loves very much.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products such as glue, leather, and metal rings.

loans.name: Peter Musyoki

texts.en:
Peter Musyoki is a 38-year-old man who resides in Kayole, an informal settlement on the outskirts of Nairobi. Peter is married and has two children, ages 8 and 6, who are both in primary school. Apart form his family, Peter also takes care of his grandparent, father and stepmother.

Peter is in the tailoring business, having started Synthex Designs in 2000. He has previous experience working in the metalwork sector, and he also took a tailoring course at a local polytechnic. He began Synthex Designs with Ksh 5,500 that he received from a merry-go-round, and this enabled him to purchase cloth and materials and rent a kiosk. Peter now wants to increase his stock through a loan of Ksh 25,000, with which he wants to purchase suit materials, kitenges (cloth for local attire) and lining rolls. Peter would like to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for the loan.He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy cloth and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Hoa

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị Hoa năm nay 44 tuổi, gia đình chị có 5 nguời con trong đó có 3 con đã trưởng thành. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Trong suốt 12 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị Hoa luôn chấp hành tốt các quy định của Quỹ sử dụng vốn hiệu quả và hoàn trả vốn đúng hạn,. Hiện tại hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm khoản thu nhập ổn định từ lương làm bảo vệ của chồng nên cuộc sống gia đình chị đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị Hoa  mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm bò về nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. D. Thi Hoa is 44 years old. Her family has 5 children, and 3 are grown. She has been a member of TYM fund since 1996. For the 12 years that she has been with the fund, she always complied with all stipulations, using the loans effectively and repaid the loans on time. In addition to raising farm animals, her family also has additional income from her husband as a security guard, and thus their standard of living has gradually improved. For the next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to purchase additional cows to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase additional cows to raise

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina A. is 54 years old. She is divorced and the mother of seven children. At the moment, four have completed senior high school. She sells baby clothes, Pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, feeding bottles, etc., through hawking. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to her customers at their doorsteps to sell. She needs the loan the enable her to inject more capital into the business to make progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, Pampers, baby oil and detergents, to increase her stock and to make more income, to provide her children with a good education. Ernestina says she would be grateful for your assistance. With the loan she wants to save more to rent a store so that her burden of hawking would be minimized. This, she says, would also help her to support her kids at the university level.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, Pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastic materials

loans.name: Mamadjon

texts.en:
Mamadjon T. is a 27-year-old, married father of two children. Mamadjon has been in the taxi service business for the past 5 years. In addition, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in purchasing and selling cattle and a great deal of hard work, he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Mamadjon harbors in his heart is to increase his capital so that he can acquire more animals. As such, he is seeking a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase more animals and to satisfy his customers' demands. In turn, he expects to generate an increase in sales and to therefore improve his family's future prospects. Information about Tajikistan: Tajikistan is well known for the following: (1) its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; (2) the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and (3) its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi, to name a few. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. On the other end of the spectrum, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and thus only 7% of the land is arable; accordingly, this confluence of factors has resulted in high levels of unemployment and has forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries (primarily Russia). Even though the people of Tajikistan are working hard to improve the country's agriculture and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expand his business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
T. is 47 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has four children: two of them are single and live with her, and the other are married and lived separately. To help earn a stable family income, one of her sons works as a rice trader in Sereysophon market with an income of $4 per day. T. is married to Khy, 64, who owns a rice milling machine. T. currently wants to plant crops on her farmland for the coming traditional festival. So T. is applying for a loan of $600 to hire a tractor to plow her farmland and to buy natural fertilizer.

She dreams of having a bigger house and a master's degree for her daughter. T. was not available for the photograph so Khy is in the picture instead.

loans.use: To hire a tractor to plow her farmland and to buy natural fertilizer

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina S. is 53 years old and a resident of Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Hermilo and they are blessed with three children: Melvin, Hermilo and Katherine.

Sabina is engaged in the buying and selling of frozen foods in their village. Some of her products are hotdogs, tocino, longganisa and so on. She has been in this business for two years.

With her strong determination to expand her business, she decided to request a loan of PHP 5,000.00 that she can use as her business capital for her frozen food products. At present, she is able to earn at least PHP 500.00 a week and she is hoping that her income will also increase. One of her business dreams is to put up a village store and a small eatery or canteen. She believes that patience and hard work will pave a way to her success.

loans.use: To buy additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah A., 44, is the married mother of four children, three of whom have completed senior high school and been working for a while. The last born is still in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the fishing community of Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 
	
Hanna trades in vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, and onions on a table top in the market square. She also sells foodstuffs such as yams and plantain, procuring her goods at effective prices from wholesalers and farmers in the nearby small communities. She says food vendors and other retailers normally purchase from her. Hannah has been in business for 15 years and is requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To procure vegetables and foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose H. currently sells mangoes at the market. She is married to a teacher who has taught Juba day secondary school for almost five years. Rose has three children (two boys and a girl) who all attend school at Austra-Tuna basic primary school.  She requested this loan to buy more fruit to sell.  In the future, she wants to build a rental house.


 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy different types of fruits to sell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A. is 38 years old and married to an army captain. She has three children who go to school. Sabina sells beer and is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beer for resale. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open another bar for selling beer.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a rice seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Tumaini group loan. She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more rice for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Neema is a 33-year-old widow with three children, ages 13, 7 and 5.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth K. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through primary education. Her husband is a fisherman.

Elizabeth sells fried fish and kenkey at Akuase (kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish). She has been in this business since 2006 and uses her income to pay school fees and other domestic expenses.

Elizabeth will use the loan to buy more fish and maize. With the new profits from her expanded business, She plans to reinvest to generate more income and profits.

loans.use: To buy more fish and maize for the production of kenkey on a larger scale

loans.name: Jeannei

texts.en: Jeannei M. is from the town of Sapang Daalaga. She is 59 years old, married, and has seven adult children. Jeannei owns and operates a dressmaking business, primarily providing women's dressmaking services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Jeannei joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Jeannei is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be use to redeem a cocoland (a piece of land planted with coconut trees). This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem her cocoland

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан Камолов проживает в городе Явана. Возраст 59 лет. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Хасан по специальности "зоотехник". Его сын работает в России. Хасан более 40 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот на рынке. Ему в этом помогает младший сын. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
59-year-old Hasan K. lives in the city of Yavan. He is married and has eight children. By specialization, Hasan is a veterinarian. His son works in Russia. For more than 40 years, Hasan has been raising livestock. He cares for and sells cattle in the market. In this way, he is able to help his young sons. The loan requested will be used to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es: Silvia Lorena R. L. de 41 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Delgado ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Silvia posee su negocio hace cuatro años llamado ‘‘Tienda Lorena’’ donde vende variedad de productos de consumo, el deseo de Silvia es ampliar la gama de productos que tiene en su tienda por eso ella solicita un crédito que le ayude a surtir su negocio el cual ha ido creciendo en estos años y Silvia puesto mucha fe y esfuerzo en el, ella utilizara este crédito para surtir su negocio con el cual lograra obtener mayores ganancias para seguir consolidado su tienda.
texts.en:
Silvia Lorena is 41 years old, lives in Ciudad Delgado in the state of San Salvador. She lives there with her husband and two children. Silvia has had her business for four years called "Tienda Lorena" where she sells a variety of food products. Silvia's wish is to increase the variety of products she sells and for that she is asking for a loan that will help her replenish her stock. Her business has been growing in the last few years and Silvia has put a lot of faith and effort in it. She will use the money to replenish her stock and that in turn will generate more income to continue consolidating the her store.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replenish store stock

loans.name: Koffi Medodji

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un enseignant. Il est marié et est père d’un enfant. Depuis 2007, il a décidé de vendre des produits pharmaceutiques communément appelés "génériques" pour avoir des ressources financières supplémentaires lui permettant d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille. Pour agrandir son stock et renforcer celui existant, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des boîtes de comprimés, de sirop, des injections, de l’ampicilline et bien d’autres produits. Cette activité lui apparaît de plus en plus rentable
texts.en:
This gentleman is a teacher.  He is married and the father of one child.  In 2007, he decided to sell pharmaceutical products commonly called "generics" in order to have additional financial resources allowing him to improve his family's living conditions.  To expand his inventory and to bolster what he has, he's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy boxes of tablets, syrups, some injections, some ampicilline (an antibiotic), and many other products.  This seems to be more and more a profitable business for him.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical products (generics)

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: The picture shows Mr. S. and his wife.  They work breaking stone. S. was born in 1966 and married in 1991. He currently helps meet his family’s living expenses by selling stone that he carves with his wife. He has been working in this field for more then ten years and is typically earning an average of US $10 each day. S. has two teenage children who go to study or work with him in carving stone. S. said that it is hard to get to the field to work because he does not have his own vehicle. Therefore, he has decided to seek a loan to purchase a motorbike which he and his family will use to ride to work or elsewhere. With the remainder of the loan he will buy more carving tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. is from the village of Owaon. She is 60 years old. Norma is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Norma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise including fertilizers. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, fertilizers

loans.name: Afoussé

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce depuis 2005 le commerce de produits génériques au Grand Marché de Lomé. Grâce à cette activité, elle apporte sa contribution financière dans le foyer pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs 03 enfants. Elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail à des revendeuses ambulantes de ces produits. Elle est connue de beaucoup de clients qui arrivent à trouver dans sa boutique tous les produits dont ils ont besoin. Elle a même des relations d’affaire avec certaines cliniques de Lomé en leur fournissant des médicaments génériques pour leurs patients. Elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES en ce moment pour acheter certains produits manquants dans son stock de médicaments. Elle a l’assurance de tenir ses engaments de remboursement.
texts.en:
Since 2005, this woman has been doing commerce in generic pharmaceutical products at the Grand Market of Lomé.  Thanks to this work, she contributes her financial share to the household to educate their three children.  She also sells wholesale, as well as retail, to itinerant sellers of her goods.  She is known by many customers who manage to find everything they need in her store.  She even has business contacts with certain Lomé clinics, to which she supplies generic pharmaceuticals for their patients.  She's requesting a WAGES loan at this time to buy certain products in short supply in her inventory of medications.  She is confident of keeping her loan repayment obligations. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic medications

loans.name: Catherine Akinyi

texts.en:
Catherine is married to Charles and they have two children, Snythia and Nathan.

Catherine was introduced to KADET through existing clients and she has no previous credit history. She has a beauty salon and intends to use the loan to purchase beauty chemicals, hair pieces and a flat iron.

The area of her business is densely populated.  Her clients are her friends. With the extra profits, she will expand her business by stocking all types of beauty chemicals.

Catherine's hopes are to become a wholesale supplier of hair pieces and beauty chemicals. She believes she is focused, hardworking and determined.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase beauty salon items: chemicals, hair pieces and a flat iron

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 50-year-old divorced woman with five children, who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to be able to provide for the family. She is a trader. Elizabeth is in the palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. Elizabeth has been in business for barely one year and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To refurbish and look after her workshop

loans.name: Evelyn Teresa

texts.en:
Evelyn Teresa S. T. is 27 years old and was born in Villa Nueva, Guatemala. She is married and has two children. Evelyn started helping her mother sell shoes and dresses. Five years ago, she started her own business selling clothing. Little by little, her earnings increased and her client base started expanding. Now, she has many clients, which she can attribute to the fact that she gives them a lot of attention. She is going to use this loan to invest in dresses, maternity clothes, and baby clothing.

Evelyn's business is located in Villa Nueva's market, where she sells dresses for fifteenth birthday celebrations, maternity clothing, and baby clothing. In addition to her business, her husband also helps provide for their family. With this loan, Evelyn hopes to increase her earnings and provide more for her family. Her dream is that her children receive a good education and use it to get a good job.

loans.use: to buy dresses, maternity clothes, and underwear

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 47 años, madre abnegada y junto a ella viven su esposo e hijos en su propia casa. Siendo una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de puertas y ventanas, actividad que realiza hace 4 años, resultándole muy rentable ya que gracias a ello solventan los gastos de su familia. Lourdes considera que el trabajo que realiza es muy arduo ya que se dedica a la administración del negocio y en compañía de su esposo y con ayuda de un asistente fabrican ventanas, creando buenos acabados en cada uno de los trabajos y que son en mayoría admiración de sus clientes. Tanto a Lourdes como a su esposo les gusta mucho su trabajo y siempre piensan en mejorar y para ello requieren la ayuda de un crédito. Es su dieciochoavo préstamo con MFP y se le considera muy puntual en los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita,  desea comprar máquinas para facilitar el trabajo de su esposo así como también economizar tiempo y dinero en el futuro.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 47 years old and is a selfless mother. She lives with her husband and their children in their own home. As she is a hard-working and responsible woman, she and her husband make doors and windows. They have been in this business for 4 years and it has been very profitable, allowing them to cover their family's expenses. Lourdes feels that it is hard work since she manages the business and together with her husband and an assistant, they build windows with nice finishes on all of their projects which their customers admire. Both Lourdes and her husband like their work and always think about improving things. To do so, they need a loan. This is her eighteenth loan with MFP and she has been very punctual in her payments. She will buy equipment with the loan that will make their work easier, saving time and money in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment to make doors and windows

loans.name: Akaa

texts.en:
Akaa is 56 years old; he is married and the father of four children. All have completed school and are fully independent. Akaa works very hard to support some of the members in his community by sponsoring brilliant but needy students in his own small way. For his kindness and generosity he is loved by many in the community. He runs canoe business that goes for fishing for him. Through that business he has managed to buy a taxi that generates additional income in support of his love for helping others.

Akaa was a retired fisherman with lots of fishing experience when he finally stepped down so that the upcoming ones can take over from him. He complains of the breakdown of his engine and also needs an additional canoe so that he can maximize his profit margin. He requests your loan assistance to buy a canoe and a taxi cab. He would be grateful for your support as he dreams of using his proceeds to support the needy ones in his community.

loans.use: To buy a canoe for fishing

loans.name: Sarantstsralt

texts.en:
Sarantstsralt is the mother of two children and a local seamstress. She has lived in the city for about 4 years. She was concerned about the effects of  pollution on her young children. She wanted to reduce the pollution from her house and reduce the amount she spends on heating fuel. So far she has been very happy with the new ger (yurt) insulation.  

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: purchase of a six-layer highly insulated yurt covering

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from Pagadian City. She is 61 years old. Gloria is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gloria is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a tailoring business providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Orfelinda Esther

texts.es:
Orfelinda es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a dos de sus seis hijos en el sector Licapa del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace diez años tiene instalada en su vivienda una bodega en donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes, verduras y bebidas. Ella nos comenta que inició su negocio vendiendo bebidas gaseosas y que poco a poco fue haciéndolo crecer con su esfuerzo y dedicación.

El negocio goza de buena aceptación debido al buen trato que ofrece y a que pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes productos de uso diario por los que tendrían que ir hasta el centro de la ciudad para adquirirlos, vale decir que la zona en donde vive queda alejada de la ciudad de Paiján.

Orfelinda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más abarrotes y verduras, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Orfelinda es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y que gusta de colaborar con sus vecinos cuando se le pide ayuda. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Orfelina is 52 years old, and she lives with her husband and two of their six children. They live in the Licapa section of the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. It is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For ten years she has had a convenience store set up in her home. She offers her customers basic needs products (rice, sugar, oil), groceries, vegetables, and drinks. She tells us that she started her business selling soft drinks. Little by little she made her business grow through her effort and dedication. The business is widely accepted by her customers because of the quality service provided. Also, she puts daily use products within her customers’ reach. Otherwise they would have to go to the center of the city to get the products, and the area where they live is far from the city of Paiján. Orfelinda wishes to expand her business by purchasing more groceries and vegetables. That is why she is requesting a loan for 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. This will help her achieve her objective. Orfelina is a very responsible and hard-working woman who likes to work with her neighbors when they ask her for help. She has previously worked with our institution, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries and vegetables to expand her business

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es casado, de 54 años, tienen 6 hijos, tres de sus hijas se encuentran estudiando carreras universitarias y el único hijo varón le ayuda con los que trabajos de la zapatería y los  otros dos se encuentran cursando sus estudios secundarios. 
Su esposa trabaja bendiendo chipa hace más de 25 años para así ayudarle a tener más ingresos con el objetivo de que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios. 
José hace más de 35 años se dedica a la confección y compostura de zapatos, es uno de los zapateros mas renombrado de la zona, cuenta con clientela formada, también trabaja al por mayor entregando más de 250 pares de calzado terminado para su posterior venta en la ciudad de Asunción. 
Gracias a su dedicación  y perseverancia en su profesión está saliendo adelante, brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijos.
Precisa del préstamo para la compra de materia prima (cueros) para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
José is married, he is 54 years of age and has 6 children. Three of his daughters are studying in the university, one of his sons helps him work in the shoe shop and the other two children are enrolled in high school. His wife has worked bending "chipa" for over 25 years now in order to help bring in more income so their children can finish their education. For 35 years now, Jose has worked designing and making shoes; and is one of the most renowned shoemakers in the area. He has a steady clientele, and also sells some of his shoes wholesale (over 250 pairs of shoes so far) in the city of Asunción. Thanks to the dedication and perseverance in his profession, his business is moving forward and it has provided a better quality of life and education for their children. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials (hides) to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de cuero (to purchase raw materials - hides- to be used in his business)

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa D. Jesús T. D. S. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como fontanero, y sus dos hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Con la ventaja D. habitar en una D. las ciudades con mayor comercio D. la ciudad D. San Salvador, Teresa posee una venta D. comida, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, en donD. comercializa diferentes tipos D. sopas, las cuales son tradicionales D. El Salvador, y que por esta razón se venden mucho. Teresa es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza a diario por poder obtener ganancias extras para poder contar con una mejor estabilidad económica es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. los alimentos D. manera que pueda realizar mayor cantidad D. ellos.
texts.en:
Teresa D. Jesús T. D. S. is 41 years old. She lives in the township of Soyapango, located in the Sal Salvador district. She lives with her husband, who works as a plumber, and their two minor children, who are in school. With the advantage of living in one of the cities with major traD. from the city of San Salvador, Teresa sells food from her home. She sells different types of soup, which are traditional in El Salvador, and for this reason she sells a lot. Teresa is a very hard-working woman who exerts herself every day to obtain extra earnings in order to have better economic stability. It is for this reason that she is applying for a loan, which she will use to buy all the basic ingredients to prepare her foods in such a way that she can produce larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a mill

loans.name: Develop Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Patience is a 59-year-old who describes herself as responsible.  She has four children between the ages of 25 and 39. For the past 30 years, Patience has operated a retail business where she sells items such as stoves, powders and body sprays.  She will use the loan to buy more items for her business.  Patience would like to expand her business by opening a store in another town, so that she can sell more items to customers.  She would like to build a home for her family.  

Patience is the leader of a trust bank group named 'Develop'.  There are four members in the group.  The group members trust and love each other.  The other members also operate retail businesses such as selling foodstuffs, maize, and fried fish.  They plan to use the loan to purchase assorted stocks to grow their businesses to enable them to support their families.

loans.use: To purchase stock such as stoves, powder and body spray.

loans.name: Altynai's Group

texts.en:
Altynai T., the leader of the group, breeds and fattens cattle. She has been doing this for 15 years, and when others in the family are available, they help her. Altynai is married to a social worker; she is 56 years old and has two children. The older son works in an automobile factory in Korea and the other just graduated from medical school. Altynai started her business buying two sheep with 3000 som (65.28$). Today she makes 2000 som (43.52$) per month. She has a plot where she can cultivate land and would like to increase her monthly salary, thus with the loan she plans to buy fertilizers and a variety of seeds.

Anar A. is the 39-year-old treasurer of the group. Her husband is a tractor driver, who often helps her farm, and she has three children. Her older son works in Russia, and the others are students. Anar is a farmer who has been plowing the land and breeding cattle for ten years. She makes 1500 som (32.64$) a month and her initial investment was 6500 som (141.95$). She would like to use the loan to purchase more livestock: chickens in particular.

Mahabat O., like the others in her group, is a farmer, but helps out in her husband’s family welding business. From her welding work, this 25-year-old was able to buy three goats and now she has eight. Her monthly profit is 1000 som (21.76$), and she plans to use the loan to purchase fertilizers for farming. Mahabat wants to increase the number of livestock and resell them to buy a vehicle.

Abdygapar A. has a 24-year-old son who works in Russia and a 22-year-old daughter who is a university student. He is a farmer and also provides transportation services. Abdygapar has been farming for 10 years. He started with an initial investment of 2400 som and cultivated one ton of potatoes, as well as buying two cows. Today, Abdygapar makes 6000 som (130.57$) per month and wishes to use the loan to buy fertilizers and a variety of seeds for farming.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and a variety of seeds

loans.name: Judy's Group

texts.en:
Judy S. is from the village of Taguntungan, Baggao, Cagayan. He is 39 years old and is the group leader of this thirteen-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Judy is married and has two young aged children. He owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Judy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI.

Judy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his third from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Achat de sorgho,haricot,...pour les vendre en détail

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol Z. is from the village of Dadda, Tuguegarao City. She is 36 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Mirasol owns and operates a business raising and fattening pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Mirasol joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Melina

texts.en: Melina A.'s main source of income comes from running a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 37 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. Melina has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Melina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Melina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase inventory and for working capital. Melina is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 32 years old.  She has 5 children who range from the age of 1-9 years. All her children are in school apart from the two youngest who are not yet of school age.  Her husband is a motorcyclist and farmer. Angelique sells locally-made banana juice and helps her husband with farming.  She has done this business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle that will be used to transport the items she sells and to transport other goods and people in the area.

loans.use: Buying a motocycle

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie P. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 49 years old and is married with two adult children. Jessie owns and operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide her manicure and pedicure service

loans.name: Enocracia

texts.en:
Enocracia V. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 65 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Enocracia owns and operates a business operating boat-ride services. Enocracia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Enocracia joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to repair an existing vehicle in order to provide a better service. Enocracia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a new engine. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat engine

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 55 years old. Cirila is married and has six children. Her eldest child is 35 years old and the youngest is 18. To make a living, Cirila owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. 

Cirila joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cirila has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Cirila is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is 53 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She has been running a clothing store for the past six years. She only sells woman clothes. She always presents new collections to attract more clients to her shop. Her business income is vital for her family as she  supports her husband. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory of new winter clothing. She is certain that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to also sell shoes in her store.

loans.use: To expand her store’s inventory of new winter clothing

loans.name: Catherine Kalunde

texts.en:
Catherine Kalunde, 27, is married to Sammy Kavengi, who is a mason. They have two children together: a son, aged 5, and a daughter, aged 4. Catherine lives and works in Tala. She has been running a retail shop for 4 years, and earns KES 8,000 a month.  She works hard, and her customers are very happy.  Her income goes towrd meeting her family’s basic needs, including helping her husband to educate their young children. 

Catherine was introduced to KADET by the loan officer in charge of the Tala office. She intends to use her loan to buy stocks of cooking oil and fat, sugar, rice, and charcoal to boost her business and increase her profits. If the loan improves her business, Catherine will use the extra income to start fulfilling her big dreams for the future by increasing her stock and starting a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cooking oil and fat, sugar, rice, and charcoal

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has five people who live in K'am Samnar Leu village Kandal province. Mr. Sim U., 52 years old, is the group leader selected by the other members.  The members will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. 

He and his wife, Mrs. Key Ket, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land to grow rice and corn to sell to support their family.  He also does bicycle repairs.  He is now facing problems because his field has infertile soil and a lot of insects.  To improve production, Mr. Sim U. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. 

He is a father of three childR., two of whom are farmers, while the other is a student.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora C. Y. tiene 33 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.
