Maria se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio para tener dinero para educar a los hijos.

Le gusta salir a pasear todos los domingos con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora C. Y. is 33 years of age.  She lives in Unión Libre with her companion and children.  She lives in the Ventanas canton in the Province of Los Ríos. She has 5 children.
 
The members of the V.R.C. El LA UNION are found in the Aguas Frías region, belonging to the Ventanas canton.  This branch is dedicated to agricultural workers who grow crops with a short growing cycle such as corn, rice and beans.  This activity requires a great deal of time.  

Doris has been dedicated to agriculture, especially the growing of corn, rice and beans for 5 years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.  

She requests the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer for her crops.  The support of the loan will help her economically to supply her needs.  She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to grow her business in order to have money for the education of her children.  She likes to go for a walk every Sunday with the family

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia N. lives in the Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is divorced and has four children, all of whom are in school.  

Dalia has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for two months, and she works 7 days out of every week. Dalia sells her products at the market by means of retail.    

Dalia has requested for a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Dalia include thieves and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only, and to educate her children up to university. 

Dalia lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 34 years old. She is married with two children between 6 months and 3 years old. Solange has a small retail store selling a wide variety of goods. She has been in this business for two years and the hours of her business are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. She currently employs one person.

Solange will use this loan to purchase different goods to sell, such as bread, juice, lotion, fruits, etc. Any profits she makes will allow her to continue taking care of her children. In addition, she will start to save for the future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase bread, juice, lotion, fruit and other food items

loans.name: Zakirjon

texts.en:
S. Zakirjon is a 37 year old farmer. He is married and has 5 children. His wife is a housewife and this leaves him the sole breadwinner. He has been farming wheat, onions, potatoes for the past 16 years on his piece of land. Zakirjon would like to adopt new farming technology to boost his agricultural yield. He needs to be able to meet the financial responsibility educating of his children and of maintaining his family's living costs, but he lacks the capital. Zakirjon requests a loan of $3000 USD to be used towards purchasing seeds and fertilizer for growing his crop. He is very responsible and promises to repay the loan on time.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, tiene 75 años de edad y tiene 8 hijos, el socio vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Roberto es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a la venta de artesanía, el tiene un puesto de venta en el centro artesanal de la ciudad de Corao. Corao se encuentra ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 
Roberto requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo chompas de lana de alpaca, cerámica, etc. 

Roberto pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 75 years old and has 8 children.  He lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Roberto is an entrepreneur and worker that sells crafts.  He has a stall in the crafts center in the city of Corao.  Corao is located 30 minutes from Cusco.

Roberto needs a loan to purchase more merchandise, such as alpaca wool sweaters, pottery, etc.

Roberto belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas" in the UMF Arariwa Association in Cusco, Peru.  The communal bank is composed of entrepreneurs and workers who seek at every opportunity to raise their children well.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Carranza

texts.es:
doña Maria Carranza O. tiene 49 años de edad vive en la colonia 7 de mayo de la comunidad de Guasaule, Maria es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la compra y venta de naranjas.
Maria es madre de 2 hijos que le ayudan con las ventas de las naranjas.
junto con su esposo han trabajado duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Maria todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para salir a vender sus naranjas.
sus tiempos libres se los dedica a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de naranjas al por mayor.
esta fruta la vende a varias personas que se dedican a la venta de fresco de naranjas.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Carranza O., 49, lives in the 7 de Mayo neighborhood in the city of Guasaule.  María is an enterprising woman who is an orange merchant.

María has two children that help her sell the oranges.

Together with her husband they have worked hard to raise their children.

María rises daily at 5am to go out selling her oranges.  She devotes her free time to her family.

She will use the loan to buy oranges at wholesale.

She sells this fruit to several people who sell fresh orange juice.

loans.use: To buy oranges.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
“We cannot make good news out of bad practice,” Edward R. Murrow said. Nieva S., 52, makes sure there is good news about her business to tell about. Nieva reached only elementary school; now, she is running her own business. She is married to a driver named Jose and is a mother to three children. Their family resides in Caloocan City, Metro Manila.

It is Nieva’s business to deliver daily news to her community by making the local newspapers more accessible to them. She is a newspaper dealer earns around Php12,500 every month. This job is something Nieva really enjoys as she gets hold of the daily news first and is able to witness immediate reactions of her fellow community members upon the sight of the news for the day.

To help her sustain her business, Nieva is borrowing the amount of Php 50,000. The money will be used mainly to order newspapers; part of the money will go to pay other bills. Nieva also mentioned saving up to be able to establish another personal business. This loan will go far toward enabling her to get to that dream and make it happen soon.

Nieva admits her work is tiring, but emphasizes that she enjoys doing it no matter how exhausting it can be. She makes certain that she implements good practice to offer good service to her community. She desires for more success to her business, so that she can be able to help others, especially her family.

As a CCT Community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: ordering newspapers

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica, de 43 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus tres hijos, de los cuales solo se hace cargo de la menor, pues los dos mayores  trabajan. 

Cada día esta empeñosa mujer se dirige  al taller de costura que tiene su madre en su casa, y desde hace 14 años se desempeña en este lugar con la costura de collects (para  el cabello)  y binchas. Esta muy satisfecha de su labor, pues aunque la realiza durante todo el día, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, obtiene regulares ganancias por la producción de estos accesorios femeninos, pues su madre es una gran mayorista de estos productos. Lo que no le gusta es que debe dejar mucho tiempo sola a su hija menor, pero sabe que tiene que trabajar para que ella pueda seguir una profesión. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado comprar una máquina de coser para empezar su propio taller de costura en su vivienda para que así pueda estar pendiente de su hogar. 

Angélica tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales que necesita (telas, elásticos e hilos) que necesita pues quiere concretar un pedido que tiene pendiente, de esta manera espera continuar adelante. 

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Angélica, age 43, lives in her own home with her three children. She takes care of the youngest child since the two older children are working.

Each day this hardworking woman operates a sewing workshop located at her mother’s house. For the past fourteen years, she has managed this business in which she manufactures hair accessories and headbands. Angélica is extremely satisfied with her work because she is able to generate steady income from the production of these women’s accessories. She works from 8am to 10pm. Her mother is also a successful wholesaler of these products. What she dislikes most is spending so much time away from her youngest daughter, but Angélica knows that she must work in order to continue with her profession. Being an enterprising woman, Angélica has future plans to buy a sewing machine so that she can start her own workshop at home, thereby giving her the ability to look after her family while she is working. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of materials (fabrics, elastics, and thread) necessary to complete an outstanding order. This will enable her to continue moving forward.

This is her first loan with MFP. Angélica promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to look bad in the eyes of those responsible for making this loan possible so that she could continue working and making progress.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, elastics, and thread

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis M. is 36 years old and single. He is from the village of Canabuan within Aritao municipality, a part of Nueva Vizcaya province on the islands of Luzon. Francis is a farmer who plants and harvests rice for sale. Francis has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2011, Francis joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. He is requesting a loan, his first from ASKI, of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Zokir

texts.en:
Zokir is a very experienced taxi driver who supports his family by driving his taxi around the city of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He has been providing transportation services for over 12 years and is still going strong. His monthly income is typically around $200-$300. Zokir would like to continue providing reliable transportation and has requested a loan of 7500 Somoni to have some work done on his car. We are happy for this opportunity to help Zokir as he works hard to make a living.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchas spare parts for his car

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en la ciudad de Asuncion, trabaja en su tercer ciclo dentro del programa.
La Sra. Dilma S. de 30 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, todos ellos en edad escolar, por las mañanas y cuando regresan del colegio le ayudan a su mamá a desgranar el choclo y lo cargan en una bolsita de hule para vender en la zona de San Antonio (ciudad cercana a Asuncion).
Ella realiza la venta de choclo en horas de la tarde (horario en que sus hijos van a la escuela) y regresa a su casa ya cuando anochece, es muy sacrificada porque trata de sustentar a su familia, cuidar su hogar y educar a sus hijos.
Es una señora muy guapa y valiente porque lucha día a día para poder salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera y vive en un asentamiento muy pobre de la zona.
texts.en:
This committee is located in the city of Asuncion and is in its third cycle.

Dilma S. is 30 years old and has three children, all school aged.  In the mornings, when they come home from school they help their mother husk the corn and carry it in a rubber bag to sell in the San Antonio zone (near Asuncion).

She sells corn in the evenings (when her children are in school) and returns home at night.  She makes many sacrifices because she tries to support her family, care for her household, and educate her children.

She is a very pretty and brave lady because she struggles daily to get ahead with her children.  She is a single mother who lives in a very poor part of the zone.

loans.use: to buy corn and rubber bags

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: La Sra. Fanny  es casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar  y tiene 25 años D. edad, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Dios es Amor” grupo  conformado por 9  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Fanny   trabaja desD. hace  5  años, ella se dedica a la venta D. útiles D. escritorio, papel, lapicero, cuadernos etc. y a su vez venD. artefactos este trabajo surge a raíz D. que ella quería conseguir mejores ingresos para su familia y brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida, es así que trabajo muy duro para obtener lo que hoy en día tiene,nos cuenta que nada fue facil pero  gracias a su esfuerzo  y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, ha construido su casa hasta el segundo piso , hizo su baño, cocina,  . El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería.  Sabemos que Fanny  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Fanny is married and has 2 school aged children. She is 25 and is a member of the “Dios es Amor” community bank. This group is maD. up of 9 members who work in different business activities. Fanny has worked for 5 years. She sells desk accessories, paper, pencil holders, notebooks, etc. She also sells artefacts. She started doing this work because she wanted more income for her family to offer them a better quality of life. She worked very hard to get what she has today. She tells us that nothing was easy, but thanks to her hard work and dedication she was able to have more income. She has built her house up to the second floor and she maD. a bathroom and kitchen. The loan was given to her to buy merchandise. We know that Fanny will meet her goals with a lot of hard work and dedication and the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Loretta

texts.es: Loretta, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Julio de 14 años y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida. En el ovalo el Zapallal, en un paradero muy concurrido, Loretta tiene un pequeño lugar donde vende sus deliciosos desayunos, el aroma que sale de sus ricos potajes es suficiente para atraer a los clientes, su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general sirve muchos desayunos a sus comensales. Tiene 3 años en este negocio, el cual le ha dado el dinero necesario para alimentar a su hijo y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea poner un restaurante, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus sabrosos platos y así mejorar su ingresos económicos. A ella le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil atender a todas las personas que concurren a su puesto, pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo y no traerle problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetuosa con las demás socias. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para preparar la comida que vende y así podrá preparar más platos.
texts.en:
Loretta is 38 years old, a hard working and generous woman.  She lives in her own house with her dear son Julio, 14 years old.  She is willing to work hard so that they can have a better quality of life.  

In the Zapallal oval in a very crowded whereabouts, Loretta has a small place where she sells her delicious breakfasts.  The aroma coming out of her delicious dishes is enough to attract customers, her post is very busy and she usually serves many breakfasts to her guests.  She has been doing this for 3 years and she has earned the money necessary to feed her son and pay for his studies.  

She feels that later she will have more expenses and won't have enough money, so she wants to open a restaurant where she can sell her tasty dishes and improve her income.  She enjoys talking with her customers, she enjoys it very much, but it is difficult for her to meet all of the people coming to her post. Even so, she does not decay in her desire to succeed and is willing to work hard to achieve.

This is her fifth loan with MFP and she hopes to be able to pay on time and won't cause problems in the Community Bank, where she is respectful to the other members.  With the 500 soles she is requesting, she will by more ingredients to prepare the food that she sells and therefore will be able to prepare more dishes.

loans.use: To buy more food for the preparation of her dishes.

loans.name: Malvy Luz

texts.es:
Marly vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 21 a 27 años de edad en el barrio  Ciudadela 20 de Julio, lugar donde interactúan actividades productivas del sector formal e informal, conjuntos residenciales, viviendas e infraestructuras recreativas y deportivas, como El estadio Metropolitano, sede del balompié profesional de Colombia donde juega e Junior de Barranquilla, equipo de futbol muy querido en la Costa Norte; en este ambiente mezclado Marly tiene una sala de belleza donde ofrece los servicios de manicure, pedicure, corte, blower y peinados dirigido a damas caballeros y niños, enfocada en el mejoramiento de su imagen personal y profesional y en los gustos y preferencias de los consumidores de sus servicios. Este negocio lo inició Marly desde que cumplió sus 18 años de edad en las Islas de San Andrés donde aprendió todo lo relacionado con la belleza mediante un curso que hizo en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “Sena” y posteriormente trabajó con una amiga donde lo perfeccionó. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará productos de belleza, como champo, enjuagues, tintes, masajes, pinta uñas en mayor volumen, pues cada día crecen sus clientes y requiere tener insumos en su negocio para responderle de la mejor manera y también para venderle una vez hayan recibido su asesoría que es el valor agregado que ella en su salón de belleza ofrece.
Su sueño más adelante es comprar el local donde funciona para no seguir pagando arriendo, y mientras trabaja por su sueño continua esforzándose por aumentar su margen de utilidad que está en porcentaje no inferior al 25%.
texts.en:
Marly lives with her husband and three children, aged 21 to 27. They live in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood, a place where the productive acitivities are in the formal and insector. There are residencial areas and housing, and recreational and sports infrastructure such as the Metropolitano Stadium,  a Colombian professional soccer site. That is where Junior de Barranquilla plays, a much beloved soccer team on the Costa Norte. This mixed ambience is where Marly has a beauty parlor, where she offers manicures, pedicures, haircuts, blow-outs and styling for men, women and children. She is focused on improving her personal and professional image and on the tastes and preferences of the consumers of her services. Marly started when she turned 18 years old on the Islands of San Andrés, where she learned everything related to beauty in a course she took in the "Sena" National Learning Service. Later, she worked with a friend, where she perfected her technique. At present, she is using her Kiva loan, which is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy beauty products. She will buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, massages, and nail polish in greater volume. Every day she has more customers and she needs to have materials for her business to better respond to them and also to be able to sell to them once they have received her services. This is an added value her beauty parlor offers.  

Her dream for the future is to buy the locale where she is so that she doesn't have to pay rent anymore. While she is working on her dream, she continues to strive to increase her profit margin, which is no less than 25%.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as shampoo, rinses, dyes, massages, and nail polish in greater volumes.

loans.name: Evanjelyn

texts.en:
Evanjelyn is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Evanjelyn has a shop that sells "ukay-ukay" (used clothing). She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more bundles of ukay-ukay. 

Evanjelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evanjelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of ukay-ukay (used clothing)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
L. socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILL.”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a L. provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

L. socia tiene 35 años D. edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; L. socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. artesanía, elL. venD. chalinas, chompas, muñecas, pantalones, llaveros entre otros tipos D. artesanía, L. socia también trabaja como odontóloga, elL. tiene un consultorio dental, por medio D. estos trabajos L. socia saca adelante a sus hijos, L. socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. artesanía e implementar su consultorio odontológico. L. socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía y para comprar sillas para su consultorio dental.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
 L. socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Inti QuilL.” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, single, and has one child. The member spends part of her time operating a business in which she sells handicrafts such as scarves, sweaters, dolls, trousers, shirts, and other handmaD. items. She also works as a dentist and has her own dental practice. Through these businesses, the member is able to help her children get ahead. The member wants to expand her craft business and keep her dental practice in operation. She is requesting a loan to buy crafts and to acquire chairs for her dental office.

The member is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for her dental office and merchandise for her craft business.

loans.name: Chhung

texts.en:
In the beginning of 2005, Mrs. Chhung built a small store in the Reussey Keo commune in Phnom Penh City. In her shop, she sells a few snack products, fast foods, sweets and grocery items to people near her store and those who pass by. Mrs. Chhung is 42 years old and mother to five children. Four of her children are single and work in a variety of occupations, and one is married and has already started a new family. 

Mrs. Chhung's husband is a motor taxi driver who has spent almost his whole life in the motor taxi service. Mrs. Chhung will use the loan to buy a vehicle for her kids to drive to their workplace so they won’t pay for a motor taxi anymore.  She will use the rest of the loan to repair the parts of her house that are broken down.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle and to repair her house

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Gulu region of Uganda.  He is single and has no children. John has a small retail shop that sells electrical items, which he has had for three years.         

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase electrical items for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for himself.  In the future, John hopes to open up the same business in another area. John is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase electrical items for resale.

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Monsieur Matar habite au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 25 ans. Il exerce  deux activités parallèles. Il est en meme temps maçon  et aviculteur. Son  objectif est de se procurer des revenus et renforcer le pouvoir financier de la famille. Il est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de  100 000 frs prévu pour le réaménagement de son poulailler  et l’achat de quelques poussins. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permet de bien participer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Mr. Matar lives in Senegal. He is 25 years old and has two kinds of work at the same time. He is a mason and a poultry farmer. His goal is to bring in revenues and to bolster his family's financial power. He is an associate of one of the U-IMCEC branches and is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for renovating his chicken coop and buying a few chicks. Increasing his profits will enable him to help with family expenses.

loans.use: to renovate a chicken coop and to buy chicks

loans.name: Michleen

texts.en:
Michleen is a 56-year-old woman, married, with three sons and one daughter. One of her sons works as a teacher with a low salary. Michleen lives in Biet Sahour near Bethlehem city in Palestine. She owns a grocery store that sells grocery goods such as sugar, frozen food, rice, etc. 

Michleen wants to purchase more grocery goods for her store but she hasn't enough cash to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN.

When Michleen takes the loan, that is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to increase the number of grocery items she has in the store and also has got more options for consumers to choose from and buy. That will increase her income and lead her to change her life positively. Michleen is photographed in her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods for the store.

loans.name: Esequiel

texts.es: Esequiel, de 21 años; es un joven soltero y trabador. Pues cuida de su papá Juan, su mamá Doris y sus 5 hermanos, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Como hijo mayor apoya a sus padres en su economía. Por eso desde que obtuvo la mayoría de edad comenzó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. Sus padres necesitaban su apoyo en la agricultura, su principal actividad económica. Desde entonces le brindaron un terreno donde comenzó a sembrar alverja. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de cosecha, pues ve recompensado el arduo trabajo que desarrolla. Además comenta que siembra en baja escala por ello en temporadas de cosecha de café en la selva, viaja para trabajar como peón en las diferentes haciendas cafetaleras. “Tengo que trabajar en otros lugares para poder ahorrar dinero, soy mil oficios”, menciona. Su mayor deseo es convertirse en gran agricultor y sembrar en extensas hectáreas de terreno. Por ello trabaja sin descanso, esperando pacientemente el momento en el que pueda invertir con su propio capital. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Esequiel de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Esequiel, 21 years old, is single and hard-working.  He takes care of his father Juan, his mother Doris, and his 5 siblings in his house located in the town of Bellavista Huaracayo.  As the eldest son, he financially supports his parents.  For this reason, as soon as he reached adulthood, he began to work for himself.  His parents needed his help with farming, their main source of income.  Since then, they gave him land where he began to plant peas.  What he likes most about his work is harvest time, because he sees the reward for the arduous work that he does.  Moreover, he tells us that he plants on a small scale because during the coffee harvest, he travels to work as a laborer in various coffee plantations.  "I have to work in various places in order to be able to save money; I'm a thousand positions (a jack of all trades)" he mentions.  His greatest desire is to become a great farmer and sow extensive hectars of land.  For this, he works without rest, patiently awaiting the moment in which he can invest with his own capital.  He belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Muruhuay” and this is his second loan with MFP, where he feels grateful for the opportunity he's been given.  For this reason, he promises to be punctual with his payments.  Esequiel, upon receiving your support, will invest the requested loan in the purchase of 2 bags of pea seeds and various sacks of natural fertilizers for his next sowing.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia is 44 years old, married and has four children. She is able to raise her children with the income she gets from dairy farming. Now, it's five years since she started farming. She also runs a grocery stall to supplement her income. She has grown the business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya hence improving her living standards. Anastacis has requested for 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maura Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora. Maura es socia del banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que esta rodeada de montañas y regado por múltiples corrientes de agua, tiene una hermoso centro histórico, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos y se caracterizan por ser amables y de un corazón cálido.

Doña Maura tiene 47 años, es madre soltera y ha concebido 3 hijos de 25, 14, 12 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en la escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Maura se dedica al comercio 12 años, vende  cobijas y sabanas, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo y vende sus productos ambulantemente.
 
En la banca comunal se encuentra hace dos años y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cobijas y sabanas para la venta y también víveres para su hogar.
  
Su meta es seguir prosperando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres con Vision."  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city surrounded by mountains and numerous streams.  The city has a beautiful historic center, and its people maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.  The people of Cuenca are known for being friendly and warm-hearted.

Maura is 47 years old, and she is the single mother of 3 children aged 25, 14 and 12.  Her oldest daughter is married and is independent, her middle child studies in school and her youngest also attends school.  They do not own their own home, so they live in a rented dwelling.

Maura has had a business for 12 years selling blankets and bed sheets.  She works every day, but does not have a fixed schedule, and she sells her products in an itinerant manner.

She has been with her communal bank for 2 and a half years, and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of blankets and bed sheets to sell, and also groceries for her home.

Her goal is to continue to prosper with her business.

loans.use: to buy blankets, bed sheets and groceries

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of dried fish to sell. Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Vilma De Los Santos

texts.es: Vilma De Los Santos tiene 53 años, Vilma ha realizado ciertas mejoras a su vivienda de acuerdo al poco salario que obtiene ella labora como docente de primaria. Vilma tiene muchas esperanzas de mejorar cada día su vivienda, pues actualmente los materiales de construcción están muy caros. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento es para la compra de bloques, arena, cemento entre otros.
texts.en: Vilma De Los Santos is 53 years old. Vilma has carried out some improvements to her home, in line with what her low wages allow. She works as an elementary school teacher. Vilma has high hopes of improving her home but building materials are currently very expensive. She is therefore requesting financing to purchase blocks, sand and cement among other things.

loans.use: to buy blocks, sand and cement, among other things.

loans.name: Badam

texts.en: For the last several years, Mr. Badam has earned a living by providing transportation services in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He is widowed and lives with his son and his sister's family in a suburb near the city. In the future, he plans to increase his income by opening a grocery store adjacent to his house. He is beginning to build the store, and is applying for a loan for MNT 1,500,000 to buy the materials he needs to continue the job.

loans.use: to buy materials he needs to build a store.

loans.name: Nibal

texts.en:
Nibal is a 48-year-old woman. She is married with two sons and three daughters. Her husband works in selling vintage items and has a low income. He wants to buy a vehicle to help him in selling vintage items in many areas to expand his work. 

Nibal wants to help her husband to get such a vehicle to increase the family income, so she needs to get a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Nibal gets the loan, she will enable her husband to purchase a vehicle that will help him to sell vintage items in many areas and work extra hours to increase his income and offer to his family better living conditions. Nibal is a conservative woman, so her son, who is over 18 years old, is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to sell vintage items.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is 29 years old and married with one child. His wife is a teacher. He owns a general store, which he has been running for 7 years. Pascal would like a loan to buy items such as sugar, rice, and potatoes to sell in his store. Any profits will be used to create savings for his family.

loans.use: To buy items such as sugar, rice, and potatoes to sell in his store.

loans.name: Noy

texts.en: Noy, 30, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area well-known for tourism. Married to a construction worker, Noy is a vegetable and fresh water vendor who is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for transporting her vegetables to market. In the future, she would like to expand her business, build a new house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to carry her vegetables to market.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат, женщина 53 лет, мать семерых детей. Она вместе с мужем занимается откормом и продажей скота. Мамлакат живёт в пригорном кишлаке и поэтому её скот пасётся на пастбище, а вечером пастух загоняет их всех по домам. У неё сейчас три коровы. Кроме откорма скота она занимается производством пряжи, и вязанием зимних носков. Она хочет купить корм для них, поэтому её сумма не большая. Но планирует через три месяца получить побольше сумму для увеличения численности коров. Она рада сотрудничать с нашей организацией.
texts.en: Mamlakat is a 53 year-old woman and a mother of seven children.  Together with her husband, she is involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  Mamlakat lives in a mountainous village, and this is why her livestock goes to a pasture, and a shepherd brings livestock back home in the evenings.  Besides fattening up livestock, she is also involved in producing yarn and knitting winter socks.  Mamlakat wants to purchase animal feed for the livestock, and this is why her loan amount is small.  But she plans to obtain a larger loan in three months to increase cattle quantities.  She is happy to be partnering with our organization.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria de 51 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su mamá, hermana y un sobrino. Victoria es una mujer llena de energía y sobre todo emprendedora.  Ha trabajado toda su vida para dar  a su familia una calidad de vida diferente. Ella se dedica a los negocios, desde hace 13 años logro instalar  una tienda en su hogar de residencia en la cual ofrece diversidad de productos de primera necesidad. Para Victoria lo más importante son los clientes  por  lo que siempre trata de dar el mejor servicio posible y es por esta razón que se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas que cada vez la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de abastecer su negocio con variedad de mercadería de tienda para siempre estar un paso delante de la competencia. Para esto ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar variedad de artículos tales como: huevos, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal, pan dulce, café, bebidas, golosinas, detergente, papel higiénico, y de más artículos que sean atractivos para los clientes.  De esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia que es lo más importante para ella.
texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old, and lives in her own house with her family including her mother, sister and nephew. Victoria is a women full of energy and above all enterprising. She has worked all her life to give her family a special quality of life. She works hard in her business. Thirteen years ago she opened a store in her own home offering a variety of staple needs.

For Victoria the most important thing is her customers so she always tries to give the best possible service and it is for this reason that she has earned the confidence of many people who each time would like something more. She has taken the decision to supply her business with a variety of merchandise in order to always be a step ahead of the competition. This is why she is asking for a loan from Integral in order to be able to buy a variety of articles such as  eggs, beans, rice, sugar, salt, sweet bread, coffee, drinks, sweets, detergent, toilet paper and other items that are attractive to customers. In this way she hopes to increase the quality of life for her family which is the most important thing to her.

loans.use: to buy eggs, beans, rice, sugar, salt, sweet bread, coffee, drinks, sweets, detergent, and toilet papers among other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy Wants to buy rice in large quantity from the farmers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase modern tailoring equipment and higher quality fabrics to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif J. is from the Apsheron district of Azerbaijan. He is married, with two children. He started his business in 2003, and took a loan of $500. Now he would like to borrow $1000 to expand the store inventory.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Soa S. is 40 years old and a widow who lives with her 3 children in Preyveng province, Cambodia. By the way, one of her children works at a small private company, and the rest are enrolled in school. In order to support her household and pay for her children's school fees, S. runs a small grocery booth at home and makes around $2/day of income. S. would like to continue increasing her profits by adding more grocery products to meet her clients’ needs. She believes it will enable her to generate more income if she can add a variety of products.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila makes handicrafts such as table clothes, napkins, shawls and cushions which she sells to the wholesalers of San Cristobal, or in Tuxtla Gutierrez where they allow in certain quantities to the handicrafts shops. Domitila is 37 years old, with 3 children. Her husband works selling fruits and vegetables in the village market closest to his neighborhood. With the loan, she will by more thread and fabric, to create and embroider more garments to sell. She is part of the group Merced 1.

DOMITILA , es artesana hace manteles , servilletas , chales , cojines los cuales vende a los mayoristas de San Cristóbal o en Tuxtla Gutiérrez donde entrega por cierta cantidad y ahí son comercializados en tiendas de artesanía . Ella tiene 37 años, 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como comerciante vendiendo frutas y verduras en el mercado del pueblo mas cercano a su comunidad .Con su préstamo comprara mas hilo , telas y así confeccionara y bordará mas prendas para vender . Pertenece al grupo Merced 1

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith has always worked with patience and friendliness towards her customers. She is the mother of 2 children, one of them is studying at university and the other is in primary school in their small city.

She lives with her husband, who works independently selling various articles for home decoration, which he brings to their city from the capital. They both contribute with their work to the family costs and education of their children.

Judith began a telephone service when she realized that there was no service like this near where they lived. She saw that in the cafes and restaurants there was a telephone service, but only with coins and they were often not working. She didn't doubt she made the right decision to offer a local service when she saw the favorable results and satisfaction of her customers. Because of the lower cost, every one of her customers is talking with the families inside and outside the country.

With the overflowing demand of her neighbors, she is requesting a loan to construct more telephone cabins, to grow her business and improve the service she offers.

Let's help Judith realize this project. She already has another goal of selling telephone cards, improving her service every day and improving the situation of her family.

Judith, trabajó desde siempre prestando sus servicios y hasta ahora lo sigue haciendo con mucha paciencia y amabilidad; es madre de dos hijos; uno de ellos está estudiando en la universidad y el otro en una escuela primaria de su pequeña ciudad. Vive con su esposo que se dedica a trabajar en forma independiente a la venta de diversos artículos de decoración para el hogar que lleva a su ciudad desde la capital; de esta manera contribuyen ambos cada uno en su actividad con los gastos familiares y la educación de sus hijos. Judith implementó un locutorio telefónico a raíz de que no había un servicio como este cerca al lugar en el que reside junto a muchas familias jóvenes; y como observó que en las bodegas lejanas existía el servicio telefónico pero a través de monedas y fallaban constantemente no dudó en poner las cabinas viendo los resultados favorables de su decisión en forma paulatina y satisfactoria, debido al bajo costo que les resulta a cada uno de sus clientes comunicarse con sus familiares dentro y fuera de nuestro país. Teniendo en cuenta la desbordante demanda de sus vecinos solicita un préstamo para construir más cabinas telefónicas con el objetivo de seguir trabajando y mejorando su servicio para satisfacción plena de cada uno de sus clientes. Ayudemos a concretar los proyectos de Judith, ya que tiene como meta invertir en la venta de tarjetas telefónicas, mejorar cada día más su servicio y asegurar el progreso de su familia.

Tranlated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE WOOD FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF TELEPHONE CABINS.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe has always been interested in the world of beauty and beauty salons. When she started out she worked as an assistant in a beauty salon and she fell in love with the profession. At home her father was not able to bring in much money so she decided to take a course in esthetics and when she finished she started her own business as an esthetician. Along the line she had a baby boy that today is the light in her eyes - being a single mother she works hard to make it through. And she also manages to help her parents with their expenses.

The hard work continues even with tough competition. Maria is requesting a loan in the amount of $550 US to be repaid in a term of 6 months. With this loan Maria will be able to purchase chairs and tables to make her beauty salon more presentable and this way clients will feel more comfortable in the salon wher they have their beauty make-overs. With your help Maria will be able to provide for her son and help her parents so that all will have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

María Guadalupe siempre se interesó por el mundo de los salones de belleza, cuando comenzó a crecer trabajó como ayudante en una estética y después de ahí le tomó mucho cariño a esa profesión y dado que en su casa su papá no llevaba mucho dinero ella decidió meterse a un curso de belleza y después de que terminó inició su carrera independiente como estilista. En el camino tuvo a un pequeño niño que hoy es la luz de sus ojos, siendo madre soltera y por quien ahora lucha para salir adelante. Además de ayudar con los gastos de sus papás.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue y la competencia es muy difícil. Es por esto que María está solicitando un crédito de US $550 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar sillas y mesas para poder tener un mejor aspecto en su salón y así más clientes vayan con la confianza de que ese es un lugar en dónde se hacen buenos trabajos de belleza. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a su hijo y ayudar a que sus papás tengan una vida de calidad.

loans.use: To purchase furnishins for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Selling clothing is a common business in the city of Managua, especially in the city’s markets. Nevertheless, María Jarquin has been doing just this for 2 years in order to support her three school-aged children. It is necessary to note that she is a single mother so she is fulfilling the roles of both father and mother.

She has worked with Ceprodel for a year bettering her business and she has been able to support her three children in school. It is necessary to point out that she has been timely in her loan payments to Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de ropa es un negocio muy común en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en los mercados de la capital. Sin embargo, la señora María Jarquin se dedica desde hace 2 años a este negocio para mantener a sus tres hijos que se encuentran en la etapa escolar. Es necesario destacar que es madre soltera por lo que hace el papel de padre y madre.

Desde hace un año ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo mejoras en su negocio y además ha podido mantener a sus tres hijos que se encuentran en la etapa de estudios. Es necesario destacar que ella ha sido fiel con el pago de estos créditos en Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mirembe Ii(C) Group

texts.en:
Harriet is 26 years old and married with three children aged 6, 3 and 1. Two of the children go to school. Her husband has a small bakery. Harriet owns a beauty salon and wants to use the extra business profit to construct a house. She sees a business opportunity of opening up another salon in the city suburbs of Kampala. Rehma has a restaurant business and wants to buy more saucepans with the loan. Manjeri is a millet grainer. Prossy sells new clothes and intends to expand business with the loan. Regina sells charcoal for a living and wants to use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more salon equipment

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a member of the "Friendship and Peace" communal bank and lives in Juanjui in the San Martín region of Peru. Her business, a convenience store, is located in her home in the neighborhood of La Merced, where she sells general groceries and other daily necessities. She is widow who has undertook various business endeavors, and with the support of her children, her faith in herself and her perseverance she has been able to make headway and reach her expectations.

With the $600 loan, which she plans to repay in six months, she will purchase products like rice, sugar, milk, oil, canned fish, soft drinks, snacks, cleaning supplies and personal hygiene items (brushes, detergents, soap, etc.) and thus have her store well-stocked and be able to provide better customer service.

Juana is 69 years old and lives with her daughter, her main support. Juana's jovial spirit and constant smile has allowed her to gain the respect and loyalty of the people in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Juana es socia del banco comunal “Amistad y Paz ”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situada en el Jirón 28 de Julio en el Barrio La Merced , en la que tiene instalada una bodega donde vende abarrotes en general y otros productos de consumo diario. Al quedarse viuda emprendió diversos negocios con apoyo de sus hijos, su fe en si misma y su perseverancia logró salir adelante y ver realizada sus expectativas. Con el préstamo de S/.1,700, el que pagará en 6 meses, comprará mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, conservas enlatadas de pescado, gaseosas, golosinas, artículos de limpieza para el hogar y aseo personal como escobas, detergentes, jabones entre otros, y de esa manera poder tener un stock surtido y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. La señora Juanita tiene 69 años, vive con su hija, quien es su principal apoyo. Su espíritu jovial y siempre sonriente hace que se haya ganado el aprecio y la fidelidad de los moradores de la zona.

loans.use: Purchase grocery products (rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.) / Compra de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, etc)

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
The committee was formed in July of 2006. The present committee was created by Teresa De Jesus Valiente who heard talk of the “Committee of enterprising women” from some women who had formed the own group.

The present day Committee integrated 16 women from the neighborhood of San Isidro in the city of Lambaré. This program promoted entrepreneurship and solidarity of its members. The committee possesses a savings fund that each of its members contributes to and additionally, each member hosts an activities in order to be able to contribute further to the fund such as hamburger cook-outs, barbeques, and early morning meals.

These ladies, who are also housewives and mothers, are dedicated to an additional activity to generate income for their homes. Among the activities that members of the committee participate in are: selling natural remedies (medicinal plants); jewelry making; clothes making; dressmaking; the sale of fruits, vegetables and fast foods.

The requested loan will be used to purchase merchandise and necessary supplies such as: fabrics, threads, fruits, milk, meat, flour, sugar, oil, eggs, jewels, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

Este Comité se formo en julio del 2006. El contacto con este grupo se realizó a través de la señora Teresa De Jesús Valiente, quien oyó hablar del programa “comité de mujeres emprendedoras” de unas señoras que ya conformaron su propio grupo.

El Comité esta integrado 16 mujeres del barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Lambaré. Este programa ayuda a fomentar el emprendedurismo y la solidaridad de las integrantes. Ellas poseen un fondo de ahorros que cada una aporta y además realizan diferentes actividades extras para aportar a sus ahorros como hamburgueseadas, asados, meriendas etc.

Estas señoras se dedican a diferentes actividades para generar ingresos extras para sus hogares, ya que ellas son amas de casa y madres. Sus actividades son: venta de remedios naturales (plantas medicinales), joyas, ropas, frutas, verduras, comidas rápidas, modistas.

El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de mercaderías e insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, frutas, lácteos, carne, harina, azúcar, aceite, huevos, joyas, etc.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase goods and necessary supplies such as: fabrics, threads, fruits, milk, meat, flour, sugar, oil, eggs, jewels, etc.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun K. is 42 years old, married, and has five children. Khun and his family live in Rumchek Village, in the Siem Reap Province. Two of his children attend school, and Khun needs to supply their educational costs. Khun earns an average of $4 day from selling pork, while his wife, Len, earns around $1.50 selling groceries at the market. Khun would like a loan of $1,100 to purchase meats and improvements for his grocery store to increase the family’s income to support his children and household.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to sell meats and decorate grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in natural medicines to sell in her community

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em S., 47, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. Since 1998 she has been in the business of producing rice wine, a favorite local drink, and she makes around $4/day in sales revenue. Her husband, Hub Hun, raises pigs for a living and can earn up to $3/day. Together the couple has four children, one of whom is employed and contributes to the family income.

Em is now seeking to borrow $1000 in order to start a new business venture. She would like to purchase a generator for recharging batteries. With the rest of the loan she would like to help support her husband’s business by purchasing more pigs for him to raise.

loans.use: Em would like to open another business by purchasing a generator and to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Roberto Ado

texts.es:
Roberto is 52 years of age. He lives with his wife, his 28 year-old daughter who is studying at the university of Tarma, and his little four year-old granddaughter.

Together with his wife, they are dedicated to raising small animals, especially guinea pigs, which are very profitable because they sell them in the capital where their price is higher. They have been doing this for more than three years and, thanks to his wife, who risked going to the capital to sell, they have more orders. She travels fortnightly. What he likes about this business is that it gives him the opportunity to spend time working in a metal shop where he helps. Nevertheless, raising animals demands an improvement in the breed, which is expensive. Roberto works so that he can help pay for his daughter's education, as well as that of his granddaughter, and he pushes every day to increase his orders.

The money that he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of pure-breed animals in order to improve the quality of his guinea pigs, of which he has 120. He not only wishes to increase the quantity of animals, but he also hopes to have a small metal shop in the future where he may work.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Roberto, tiene 52 años, vive con su esposa y su hija de 28 años quien cursa estudios superiores en la universidad de Tarma y su pequeña nieta de 4 años. Junto a su esposa, se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, sobre todo de cuy, los cuales son muy rentables, porque los vende en la capital donde sus precios se elevan. Esta actividad la realiza por más de 3 años y gracias a su esposa, quien se arriesgó a ir a la capital para vender es donde tienen mayores pedidos, ella viaja quincenalmente.Lo que le agrada de esta actividad, es que le da tiempo para trabajar algunas horas en un taller de carpintería metálica, donde colabora. Sin embargo, la crianza de animales demanda la mejora de la raza, lo cual es costoso. Roberto trabaja para solventar los estudios de su hija y sobre todo el de su nieta de 4 años, quien lo impulsa día tras día para incrementar sus pedidos. El dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de animales de raza, para mejorar la calidad de sus cuyes que hasta ahora son 120, y no tan solo espera incrementar la cantidad sus animales, sino que en el futuro pueda tener un pequeño taller de metálica en donde pueda trabajar.

loans.use: Purchase pure-breed animals in order to improve the quality of his guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Mrs. Ean N. is a 42-year-old widowed factory worker living in Khsang Cheung Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She has three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the third is attending school. 

Although three of the family members are employed, living conditions in their old house are poor. In order to improve upon those conditions, Mrs. Ean N. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a new house.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for better living conditions

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina A., who is married and has nine children, received schooling through Junior High level. In business since 1991, Justina sells cooked rice, preparing both the rice and the sauce for her customers. Her enterprise is thriving in Cape Coast.

Her husband is a trader, and Justina uses her income to help him in the payment of the children's school fees and the utility bills. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and other ingredients for her food preparations. With the new profits from her expanded business, Justina plans to help her husband begin construction of a house for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and other ingredients for her food preparation business.

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es:
Eudosia tiene 45 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada y madre de 04 hijos (03 varones de 26, 13 y 4 años y 01 mujer de 24 años de edad). Vive en la Parcialidad de San José, distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri desde hace 03 años. 

Desde los 12 años de edad vendía fruta en la ciudad de Ilave, Conduriri, a los 19 años de edad tuvo su pareja y desde entonces se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras a la fecha.

Con el préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 sacos de zanahoria con S/.120, un ciento de repollo con S/.60, dos de tomate con S/.40 y con el saldo comprará cebolla, apio, poro, etc.

Su meta es cambiar de negocio, dedicarse a la compra y venta de carne de alpaca, ovino al por mayor y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Eudosia is 45 years old, studied through primary school, is married, and has 4 children (3 males who are 26, 13, and 4, and one female who is 24). She lives in the area of San José, the district of Conduriri, the province of El Collao, in Puno. She has been a member of the communal bank "Maria Parado de Bellido" in Conduriri for 3 years.

When she was 12, she started selling fruit in the city of Ilave in Conduriri. At 19 she got married and since then she has sold vegetables. With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 3 months, she will purchase 2 sacks of carrots for 120 nuevos soles, 100 cabbages for 60 nuevos soles, and 2 sacks of tomatoes with 40 nuevos soles. With the balance she will buy onions, celery, leeks, etc.

Her goal is to change her business and to buy and sell alpaca and sheep meat wholesale and to support her children so they can get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, celery, leeks, etc.

loans.name: Suzana A.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Suzana M. from Mbeya, married with three children between the ages of 3 and 12 and also supporting one dependent who is an orphan. Suzana has been selling potatoes since 2001, working 13-16 hours per day, 4 days per week. She currently earns about $30 per month from her business.

She is now requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase more potatoes in bulk, and in the future plans to establish another business. Suzana thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Sau Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vũ Thị Sáu 38 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ việc đánh bắt cua cá nên cuộc sống gia đình đang ngày càng ổn định hơn. Nhờ có thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị  Sáu cũng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu  tư cho  các con ăn học. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua nguyên vật liệu sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sau Thi V. is 38 years old. She joined the Fund in 1999. Currently her family's main source of income is raising livestock and farming trees. Besides that the family also has an income from fishing and crabbing, so their finances are becoming more stable day by day. Thanks to a monthly income of 6,000,000 VND/month, Mrs. V. and her family are much more able to improve their quality of life and pay for their children's schooling. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in materials to renovate the livestock pen and buying more pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovating livestock pen, buying pigs

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.fr: A. Pelagie a 55 ans et 3 enfants, 30, 28, et 5 ans. Le plus âgé est déjà a l’université. Elle est veuve, et elle pratique une activité depuis 25 ans. Au début, elle est allée a Ghana, Togo, et Nigeria pour acheter les sacs et les chaussures. Actuellement, elle prépare les ignames, les bananes, et le piment pour vendre au bord de la rue. Elle achète sa nourriture a Dantokpa. Grace au crédit, elle n’achète plus sur le crédit, et elle a pu mettre l’argent a coté pour acheter le ciment pour construire une maison. Dans l’avenir, elle voudrait construire une maison pour louer les chambres.
texts.en:
Pelagie A. is 55 years old and has three children, ages 30, 28, and 5. The eldest is already at university. Ms. A. is a widow and has been working for 25 years. At first, she went to Ghana, Togo, and Nigeria to buy handbags and shoes. Now, she prepares yams, bananas, and chili peppers for roadside sale. She buys her food in Dantokpa. Thanks to this loan, she no longer buys on credit, and she was able to put money aside to buy cement to build a house. In the future, she would like to build a house for renting out the rooms.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van N. is 56 years old and lives with her husband and her children in Battambang province, Cambodia. She stays at home and with her husband, Siv San, 61, earns a living by raising pigs on a plot of land behind her house. This couple together make about US$ 4 every day. Four of their children are employed as garment factory workers, while two are in school.  Mrs. Van N. would like to take out a loan to expand her livestock by adding more pigs and purchasing feed as well. (Mrs. Van N. and her husband were unavailable so her oldest daughter is pictured instead.)

loans.use: buying more pigs to raise and purchasing feed

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia C., in her 50s, still believes her income-generating project (grocery retailing) would be progressing for the next 2 years.  She is a "Cebuano" (a Philippine ethnicity and language), migrated to Bukidnon, looking for a greener pastures. Before, the couple was dependent on being  laborers on their master's farm.  The income is not convincing so she shifted to business (retailing) and it works since she was assisted by HSPFI for years. She wishes for an increment of  business stocks. Hence, she is in need of PHP 24,000 to realize this business outlook.

loans.use: To purchase big quantities of grocery items for sale

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
“Learn to survive and get out of poverty by means of hard work and patience,” shared Rogelyn C., together with her husband, Joel C.. They live happily in a rural place located at Barangay (township) Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya with their two children, namely, Erikamae C. and Harold C.; they are currently studying in high school and college.

Rogelyn is a housekeeper while her husband is only a tricycle (local three-wheeled vehicle) operator who only earns a net income of 180 pesos daily. Aside from that, they also manage planting onions on their half-hectare farm lot. Providing their needs for farm inputs and allowances of their children is too hard for the couple thus Rogelyn decided to help her husband to earn a living in order to satisfy their basic needs, especially the school needs of their two children. She plans to engage in hog-raising since farming is a seasonal business, using the amount she is able to borrow from lenders, at least PHP 5,000.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Funke

texts.en:
Funke is 34 years old and married. She sells shoemaking materials like leather, etc. She has been in this business for a long time.

Funke is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more shoemaking materials to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more shoemaking materials to sell

loans.name: Am-Maya

texts.fr: Madame K. habite le quartier d’Agoè kagomé à Lomé, elle est mariée et a 01 enfants qui fait l’école primaire. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle exerce son commerce en face du marché d’Adétikopé. Son stock actuel est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de riz, 5 bidons d’huile, 6 sacs  de savons et 8 cartons de spaghettis.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. lives in the Agoè Kagomé neighborhood in Lomé; she is married and has one child who is in primary school. She sells groceries to earn a living. Her place of business is opposite the market of Adétikopé. Her present inventory is used up, so she wants to replenish her stock and is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 10 sacks of rice, 5 jerrycans of oil, 6 sacks of bars of soap, and 8 cases of spaghetti.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Primo

texts.en: Snack vending is the primary source of income of Mr. Primo M. T., 49 years old, of P5 Villa Consuelo, Ozamiz City. He is married to Mary Jane T. and they are blessed with 2 children. His daughter is a graduate of 1 year HRM course and plans to continue her studying this coming June, 2009. The other child is now in 3rd year high school. Mr. T.’s partner in business is his wife. She helps him make snacks and fruit salads to be delivered to different schools and offices. He also accepts orders for additional income. He started this business 10 years ago with an initial capital of PHP 1,500. Now, he is applying for the amount of PHP 5,000 to add his capital and to purchase ingredients for his business. The couple want their children to become professionals so they can find better jobs in the future.

loans.use: Addtional capital for their snack vending and fruit salad making business.

loans.name: Nzovwe 1 D Group

texts.en:
Sarah is an animal feed seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Nzovwe 1 group loan (Group code 2018). She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more animal feed to add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Sarah is 40 years old, widowed, and has three children, ages 18, 12 and 5. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mwamvua, who has her own small business, a hair dressing salon in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed to add to her current stock

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty O. is 58 years old and married with eight children. She sells sarongs and the demand for them is high. Therefore she is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. Beauty sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en: Since 1980 Nourn M. has had a business selling fruit near a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. She has an income of US$12 per day. She lives with her husband and her two children; the elder is working at a garment factory and the younger is in high school. Her husband is a village chief who usually earns around US $5 per day. M. wants a loan of US $1000 to expand her inventory. She hopes to generate more income if her business plan succeeds.

loans.use: buying more fruit

loans.name: Djamoliddin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Джамолиддин 1987 года рождения. Студент Худжанского Универститета на четвертом курсе. После учебы торгует продуктами питание на автовокзале «Рохи Абрешим». Товар он закупает на оптовом рынке Панчшанбе. Спрос на товар большой из-за расположение место. Родители Джамолиддина поддерживают сына и не против, чтобы он взял кредит. На запрашиваемый займ он увеличит ассортимент.
texts.en:
Djamoliddin was born in 1987. He is a forth-year student at the Khujand University. He sells food products after school at the Rohi Abreshim bus station. Djamoliddin buys his products at the Panchshanbe wholesale market. The demand for his products is high due to the retail location. Djamoliddin's parents help him and support his desire to obtain a loan. He will use this loan to increase his product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of buckwheat, sugar and various types of tea

loans.name: Mariam O.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is Mariam M. from Mbozi. She is 37, married and has 6 children between the ages of 8 and 17. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents because they are orphans. 
Mariam has been running a milk business since 1993; she purchases, prepares and sells milk.
She works at the business for 9-12 hours a day, 6 days a week,  and she is assisted by one employee. Mariam currently earns about 80 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to improve the quality of her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Mariam thanks you for your support!
ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To improve the quality of her business

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Here are Magret I. K. and Isatu F. of the “In God We Trust Group”. They are requesting their fourth Kiva loan to enable them to further expand their businesses. Previous loans have been a great blessing to these borrowers. With previous loans, their businesses expanded and profit margins also increased.
