Magret (right), for example, started trading with fried cakes but with consequent Kiva loans, she today owns a very big shop. However, she is still asking for a new loan as she believes in “the more the merrier”.

Magret is the leader of this group. She is 35 years old; she was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a driver and they have five children, who are in secondary and primary schools. Magret owns a shop where she sells grocery items – milk, sugar, bread, mayonnaise, drinks, and many more items. Magret has had ten years of experience in business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
N. Betty is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in secondary school and the last born is a baby. She also helps to take care of two in-laws including paying their school fees and general upkeep.

Betty has owned and managed a fruit and vegetable selling business in Namulesa for four years from which she is able to make 70,000/= of profits a week. She gets her produce from the villages and from her farm because she is a farmer herself and this helps her to have stock all the time and hence more customers.

Betty needs a loan to be able to buy more fruit and vegetables for resale and partly to pay school fees for her children. She is such a friendly and hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to sell and to pay school fees

loans.name: Darlit

texts.en:
Darlit T. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Biasong. Darlit has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Darlit joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Darlit is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used for additional working capital. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 25 years old and married without children. She sells drinks retail to her customers to earn a living. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ma. Verly

texts.en:
Ma. Verly V. is from the village of Maribojoc, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children.

Ma. Verly owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ma. Verly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Ma. Verly is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase some baking equipment. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase some baking equipment

loans.name: Saobaddin

texts.en:
K. Saobaddin is 40 years old. He is married and has three children. He has successful business selling flour at the local market in Isfara. Saobaddin sells an assortment of good quality flour. Because he buys the flour wholesale, his price is cheaper than the price of his competitors. Thus, he has many customers, some of whom even buy flour straight from his house. Today he has a great demand for his goods and that is why he wants to take an individual loan. Saobaddin has requested a loan of $1100 USD to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once and a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy flour to sell

loans.name: Daysi Rosalvina

texts.es:
La socia DAYSI pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos; una mujer y un varón. Ellos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su tienda donde vende zapatos. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere casar a adelante a sus hijos. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como zapatos para niños, damas y caballeros así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Daysi belongs to the communal bank, "Vilcanota." She is 33, married, and has two children, one boy and one girl. They live in the Urubamba province, which is located to the north of the city of Cusco. She alternates her time between her home and her store where she sells shoes. She has done this for several years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she has put into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who wants to take good care of her children. She needs a loan to buy merchandise like shoes for children, women, and men so she can increase her capital and to have more income and to give her children a better quality of life. She is thankful for the opportunity that is being offered to her and she promises to comply with her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like shoes for children, women, and men to be able to increase her capital

loans.name: Umoja Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Margaret is 59, divorced, and has two children, aged 24 and 19, who are both at university.  She also takes care of other siblings and orphans. Margaret has had a retail shop in Kiwanga for 4 years and although she has debtors to her business, she is able to make 900,000 Ugandan shillings (about $46 US) as profits a month. 

She says that her supplementary sales help win more customers to her shop and she hopes to expand it further as well as have good health for her children. This is her second loan with her group and she would like to restock her business--especially now that it is a festive season and the consumption level is so high.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
El Sr. Cosme G. es de la ciudad de Carapeguà cñia.Espartillar.

     Hace màs de 5 años que cuenta con experiencia en dicho trabajo.   Manifiesta que tiene mas de 100 clientelas formadas,gracias a su sacrificio y a su perseverancia.

    El mismo es cliente de nuestra entidad desde el año 2001 con varios créditos cancelados,comentò que gracias a los prèstamo otorgados por la fundaciòn paraguaya fue aumentando su capital y al mismo tiempo agradeciò por la confianza puesta hacia su persona.

  Solicitò el prèstamo con nuestra entidad para la compra de mercaderias queincluyen ropas, zapatos, lenceria y otros. La venta de estos productos lo realiza en forma ambulante de casa en casa por los barrios de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mr. Cosme G. is from the city of Carapeguà cñia.Espartillar.

More than 5 years ago he has experience with his current work. He explains that he has more than 100 customers thanks to his sacrifice and perseverance.

He is a member of our organization (Kiva’s field partner) since 2001, with various paid loans. He adds that thanks to the loans given by the Paraguayan foundation he increased his capital and at the same time he is thankful for the trust given to him.

The loan with our organization is to buy merchandize that includes clothing, shoes, lingerie and other goods. The sale of these products is made by selling house to house in the neighborhoods of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Nilo Marcio

texts.es: Nilo tiene 47 años de edad, el un hombre trabajador y que le gusta mucho su trabajo. Su actividad económica es la venta de hot- dog, hamburguesas, sándwich y refrescos naturales, además de tener este negocio también se dedica a brindar el servicio de recargas telefónicas el tiene 3 hijos y solamente 1 está a su cargo que es la menor de 9 años. El inicia este negocio, ya que anteriormente donde laboraba lo corren por recorte de personal, es así  que se arma de valor para emprender su propia empresa. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de jugos, gaseosas, tomate, cebolla, pan y materia prima. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Nilo is 47 years old. He is a hard-working man who likes his work very much. His business is the sale of hot dogs, hamburgers, sandwiches, and natural drinks. In addition to this business, he also recharges telephone cards. He has 3 children, and only one is in his care, the youngest, who is 9 years old. He began this business because he was laid off at his previous job due to personnel cutbacks, and thus he plucked up his courage to begin his own business.

He is asking for this financing for working capital for the purchase of juices, soft drinks, tomatoes, onions, bread, and basic ingredients. His goal is to continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia A. is from the village of Tuburan Villaflor Oroquieta City in Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Olivia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Olivia works in someone else's business venture in the food sector operating a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving foods to customers in the local community. Olivia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Olivia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Olivia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Olivia is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used for additional capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Olivia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for additional capital

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 42 year-old father of three children who attend school.  He was a casual employee before he started selling water.  His wife is a farmer.  He has been running his water business for two years. He is a member of Kiva partner Faulu Kenya and he appreciates that he has learnt how to keep business records.  He has requested a loan of Kes.20,000 to buy a water tank and water pipes.  He hopes to have a financially stable family.  He sees himself operating a well established company in the future.  He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Key Of Prayer Group

texts.en:
Sallie K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Key to Prayer. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children who range from 4 to 16 years old. He is a high school graduate.

For three years, Sallie has been selling rice at the Harbel Market. He sells the rice in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  Sallie plans to use his 7,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 29,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more rice. His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his children in school so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sallie is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Leandra Yesenia

texts.es: Leandra Yesenia de 33 años de edad es casada, no tiene hijos, se recibio como Administradora de Empresas, pero actualmente trabaja para el Sr. Nolberto Mendoza como vendedora de productos farmaceuticos desde hace 2 años, pero ademas es pequeña comerciante de cosmeticos, carteras, ropa, etc, tiene su negocio ubicado en el mercado Mayales de la ciudad de Juigalpa, y en este momento necesita financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de productos para fortalecer su inventario, ya que como es epoca de verano quiere comprar sandalias, sobreros y otras cositas que se venden  en semana santa.  El mayor sueño de Leandra es poder fortalecer su negocio para cuando lleque a tener su propia familia, pueda brindarle las condiciones basicas del hogar.
texts.en:
Leandra Yesenia, 33, is married and has no children. She graduated with a business administration degree but has been emplyed by Mr. Nolberto Mendoza selling pharmaceuticals for the last 2 years. In addition, however, she is a merchant selling cosmetics, purses, clothing, etc. She has a small business in Juigalpa's Mayales market. She needs funding to invest in stock items to increase her inventory especially with Summer items like sandals, hats and other things that sell well during Holy Week. Leandra's greatest wish is to strengthen her business so that, when she has her own family, she will be able to provide her home with basic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals, hats and other inventory items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy palm oil

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 34-year-old married man with two children in school.  He runs a taxi business and also does farming to earn a living.  He uses part of his income to pay his three workers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been motivated to work hard by his group members who share business ideas. George is fortunate to be in this group because its members have guaranteed him a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers.  He hopes to own a fleet of vans for a transportation business. He sees himself expanding his business in a few years.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn and beans

loans.name: De Los Santa

texts.es:
La  Sra. De Los Santa es casada, tiene cinco hijos,  tres   en edad escolar.
Ella  tiene una pequeña despensa  en el km 7 Ciudad Nueva, cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso es por ello que quiere construir un salon aparte para surtir mejor su negocio y solicita el préstsmo para la compra materiales de contrucción(ladrillos, cementos, tierra, pago de mano de obra) .

Con la ayuda de su esposo y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
texts.en:
Sra. De Los Santa is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She manages a small food pantry located at Km 7 in Ciudad Nueva. Her sales continue to increase every week, so she is able to generate a good income. She wants to build a separate room so that she can keep her business well-stocked. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, and sand) and pay for labor.

With the help of her husband and the rest of her family, De Los Santa has been able to move forward after much sacrifice and effort. Today she is a successful businesswoman with many loyal customers due to her kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor needed to build a separate room for her business

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
Ngư Trần Thị, age 51, lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong-tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Ngư is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đông Mai nhóm 07 (Nhóm 07).
  
Ngư is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Ngư makes and sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Ngư has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

Ngư joined SEDA to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. The loan will be the first loan she has taken out from SEDA.  Ngư plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

Tạ Thị Bé is a 43-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,840.000,VND loan to support her furniture making business.

Nguyễn Thị T., age 27, is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

Đỗ Thị

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials to build a room for one of his children

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Zambougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
Avec ce  prêt, FATOUMATA B. S. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de    45000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women with an average age of 42 and an average of two children.. Mostly they live in polygamous families in Zamougou, a village in the prefecture of Diooila, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso so as to get their farming activity on a sounder footing before the rainy season begins.. This will be their first seasonal loan.They grow peanuts, millet, corn, beans and other crops. Fatoumata B. S. plans to use her loan to buy fertilizer before its price goes up, and also to buy small tools and pay hired help to work on about one hectare of peanuts and beans. The harvested crops will be sold in Fana and Dioila, to both men and women. Each member of the group is counting on making a profit of about CFA 45,000 at the end of the season

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and small tools and pay hired help

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony J. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. He is 30 years old. Sony is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sony owns & operates a business primarily providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. Sony has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sony joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Sony is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Sony from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Ambali

texts.en: Monsieur Ambali O. is 35 years old and lives in his hometown of Lomé, Togo. He works as a tailor at a workshop he calls Ouro Couture, after his last name. He has had this business since 2005. Monsieur Ouro-Akorkio is 35 years old and married to an entrepreneur. They have one child. He has requested a loan of 300,000 CFA in order to purchase an embroidery machine. The addition of this machine to his business will allow Ambali to diversify his offerings and add creativity and style to his services, thus better satisfying his customers and hopefully increasing his profits.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan O. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older son attend a local secondary school while the younger daughter goes to kindergarten. 

Jargalsaihan used to work in a cafe from 2002 to 2010. She started to sell various kinds of household products especially those used in the kitchen in April, 2010. She has her own car which is used in their business. She is the kind of person who is hard-working and modest. She says, "Everything will be fine if you try hard."

 Jargalsaihan is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products

loans.name: Temps De La Grace Plus Group

texts.en:
Gyka K. is 68 years old and a father of six children. He is the leader of the Community Bank group named “Temps de la Grace Plus,” which means “grace period” in English. It is composed of fifteen members united in solidarity through receiving loans from Hope, a Kiva partner, with the goal of developing their businesses.

Since 2005 Gyka has been in business selling flippers and miscellaneous goods. He joined one of Hope’s groups (part of a DRCongo microfinance program) in 2007 and has received fourteen loans that he repaid properly. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Gyka’s business has prospered and generates a profit of $10 per day.

Gyka intends with his next loan to diversify his business by buying different plastic items to resell at a profit in order to increase his capital. His ambition is to open a plastic goods shop due to high demand in his neighborhood. He has been working hard to achieve his dream.

loans.use: To buy different plastic items to resell

loans.name: Punta Del Este Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Punta del Este, el mismo nombre del comite.

Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.

Las señoras  están en el ciclo Nº  5º con sus 18 integrantes. 

La Sra. Olga quien forma parte de comite, posee una cantina, la misma es bastante concurrida, posee una buena clientela ya formada, brinda buena atención y calidad con sus productos, se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y así también almuerzos, a la vez bebidas, gaseosas, refrescos, ensaladas de frutas, etc.

Desea ampliar el negocio con mas variedad de comestibles, así como los dieteticos y vegetariano, además,teniendo en cuenta la llegada de la primavera deseea comercializar helados y más variadas bebidas.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from the Punta del Este neighborhood of the city of Tobati, which is 26 kilometers from the regional office in Caacupé.

These women are very satisfied with the economic support that Fundación Paraguaya offers them. With this capital, the women are expanding their small businesses and thus increasing their income for a better quality of life.

They are in their 5th loan cycle and have 18 members.

Sra. Olga, who is a member of the group, has a restaurant that is quite busy. She already has a well-established clientele. She offers good service and quality products. She sells fast food and also lunches, soft drinks and other beverages, fruit salads, etc.

She wants to expand her business with more varieties of food, such as dietetic and vegetarian; in addition, with the coming of spring, she wants to sell ice cream and a greater variety of beverages.

loans.use: Acquire products to prepare foods such as meats, bread, vegetables, condiments, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. is 36 years old from Misikhu area. He is married to Caroline M. and they have two children aged 8 years and 6 years old.

Joseph sells cereals in the market and is in dire need of buying 14 bags of maize and beans to add to his stock. He has been in this business for the past 3 years and has seen his business grow. His business is centrally based in the market and he has a huge clientele. He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd after successfully completing the first one.

His desire is to diversify into a boutique business.

loans.use: Buy 14 bags of maize and beans to add to his stock.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr:
CHANTAL M. N.


Femme faisant preuve de responsabilité par rapport au prêt, elle a remboursée et épargnée sans problèmes.

Le prêt lui a permis de réorganiser son système de gestion, à connaître son bénéfice, à améliorer son activité ce qui lui a permis d’augmenter son capital.
Ses recettes journalières sont passées de 60000f à 150000f par semaine et elle occupée une autre table pour élargir son activité.
Avec  le prochain prêt, elle va augmentée son stock en achetant 5cartons de poisson salé morue, 5cartons de poisson salé sole, 5cartons poisson salé thons.Tres enthousiaste , elle tient a aller loin en tenant compte de ses ambitions et pense toujours travailler avec Hope.
texts.en:
Chantal M. N. is a woman who manages loans responsibly, since she has repaid her installments and saved some money in the past without any problem.

Her loan enabled her to reorganize her management system, to know her profit and to improve her activity. All this enabled her to increase her working capital. Her turnover rose from 60,000 to 150,000 CFA francs a week, and she used an additional table to expand her activity.

She will use this new loan to increase her inventory by purchasing 5 boxes of salted cod, 5 boxes of salted sole and 5 boxes of salted tuna. She is very excited and expects a bright future, taken into account her ambition. She believes that she will always work with the microfinance institution Hope.

loans.use: To buy salted fish

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
M. Safina lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, three of whom are in school.     

Safina has a retail shop business.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Safina sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Safina has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. The main business challenge(s) for Safina include transportation. Her aspirations for her business are to expand her business.   

Safina lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “Sembradoras” está iniciando su ciclo Nº13 en el Centro Focal D. Cascada. Cuenta con diez integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Teófila, por la tesorera, la señora Feliza y como secretaria D. actas Soledad. Los negocios D. las señoras están relacionados con el comercio y servicio. 

La señora Teofila, presidenta D. la asociación “Sembradoras”, es socia antigua, ella comentó que solicitó su primer crédito hace once años atrás, después D. un tiempo dejó  D. solicitar el crédito, hasta ahora, que lo necesita y que ha sido invitada por una "comadre" a formar parte D. la banca comunal.  La señora Felisa cuenta con el negocio D. compra venta D. Baterías D. auto, inició el negocio por iniciativa propia, ella compra las baterías usadas D. automóvil y luego las venD. a una fábrica.   Ahora requiere D. crédito para iniciar un nuevo negocio D. costura, ya cuenta con la máquina D. coser, lo que le falta es la tela.  La señora Felisa está casada y es madre D. tres hijos.
Cuando se le consulta sobre  qué es lo que más le gusta D. Pro Mujer, ella responD. con énfasis que le gusta el “ahorro” y que por eso ha vuelto.
texts.en:
The 'Sembradoras' (Sowers) community bank is starting its 13th loan cycle as part of the Cascada regional office.  The bank has ten members.  Its board is maD. up of a president, Teófila, a treasurer, Feliza and a secretary, Soledad.  The ladies' businesses are in commerce and services.

Teófila, president of the 'Sembradoras' community bank, is an old client of Pro Mujer.  She tells us that she requested her first loan eleven years ago.  After a while she stopped requesting loans.  However, she now needs a loan again and has been invited to be a member of the community bank.

Feliza has a business buying and selling car batteries.  She started her business on her own initiative.  She buys used car batteries and then sells them to a factory.  She requires a loan to start up a new sewing business.  She already has a sewing machine but needs fabric.  Feliza is married and has three children.  When we asked her what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replied emphatically “the savings” and this is why she has come back.

loans.use: To buy used batteries and fabric

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 34 years old. He is married and has one child. He also cares for one adopted child.  Bernard sells household products, such as spoons, plates, pans and other useful items. He also employs one other person to help him in the store. Bernard will use this loan to increase his stock of housewares. With any profit he makes, he plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lizzy Atieno

texts.en:
Lizzy Atieno O. is 28 years old and a single mother of two children aged between four and six years old. She lives with her children and the Corner Legio area of Kisumu county.

Lizzy has a business of telephone money transfer locally known as "MPESA." She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy credit cards and sim cards to add to her stock. Lizzy earns a profit of 13,000 KES per month. Her family depends entirely on her for upkeep and this means that the profits made are utilized to cater for the family's needs.

Her desire is to have another telephone service outlet in the town center.

loans.use: To buy scratch cards and sim cards to add to her stock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de unos parientes. Realiza bellos bordados desde hace 2 años, se inicio por invitación de una de sus amigas que le enseñó todo sobre este arte. Ahora trabaja de manera independiente y desde la comodidad de su casa, así no descuida su hogar ni sus hijos. Por otro lado cultiva alfalfa para poder venderla al por mayor. Es por ello que no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo pero es muy constante en la realización de sus bordados  ya que por la complejidad del trabajo y el grosor del bordado en la tela este trabajo dura hasta un mes de realizado, como resultado se da una bella prenda  típica  que causa admiración en sus clientes y finalmente son los que compran al contado. La época más rentable  en su negocio es cuando  están en plena época de festividades típicas llamada, fiesta de Santiago, que se celebra mucho por su zona. Desea crecer en su producción de faldas bordadas y contratar a personas apara ayudarla en esta elaboración. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.
Con el crédito que solicita, comprará hilos y telas al por mayor y también  en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar mas alfalfa.
texts.en:
Victoria is 42 years old and she lives with her husband and children in a house belonging to a family members. She has been crafting beautiful embroidery for the past 2 years. She started out when a friend taught her everything there is to know about this art form. Today she works independently and from the comfort of her home. She can take care of the chores and look after her kids. In addition to this she also cultivates alfalfa to later sell in wholesale. She doesn't have a fixed work scheduler but she is very dedicated to her embroidery. With the detail of the work involved and the richness of the embroidery takes up to a month to complete one piece. But the final product is a beautiful traditional piece of clothing that is the subject of admiration from her clients who ultimately decide to make the buy, in cash. The most profit is earned during the traditional season of festivities, named the Feast of Santiago. It is a time for celebration in her region. She wants to increase the embroidered skirts and to hire help to assist her in production. It is her fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know she has this source of financial support. She has always demonstrated to be responsible with her payments and she is very glad to be a member of her community bank. All of the other members of the communal bank are responsible and make a very strong group. She is thankful to those individuals who are contributors to the loan she requests. It will be very helpful in the development of her business. 

With the loan requested she will purchase threads and fabrics in wholesale and she will also purchase fertilizer to cultivate more alfalfa.

loans.use: To purchase threads and fabrics for embroidery, and to purchase fertilizers to cultivate alfalfa.

loans.name: Milena Patricia

texts.es: Milena A. vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos mediante revistas especializadas, así ella va donde todos sus clientes muestra su revista  y también los asesora respecto a que productos pueden usar de acuerdo a sus perfil o condiciones. Desde hace dos años se ha dedicado a este negocio y logró su vinculación a esta empresa que trabaja comercialmente a través de catálogos, por medio de una vecina y desde que inició sus primeras ventas  Milena empezó a gustarle esta actividad, porque le genera ingresos y se encontraba desempleada, porque como asistente administrativa no lograba ubicarse laboralmente.  Este es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y también es su primer credikiva, con el comprará productos cosméticos como cremas, productos para el hogar, joyerías, productos de aseo personal, maquillajes y tratamientos faciales, para ampliar su mercado. Con este negocio ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos  y planea fortalecerlo mucho más,  porque su meta es convertirse en generadora de empleos a través de esta actividad para ver cumplir su sueño de viajar por todo el mundo y progresar .
texts.en:
Milena A. lives in the city of Cartagena and sells cosmetics through specialized catalogs that she presents to all of her customers. She also provides advice as to what products should be used based on a customer’s profile and conditions. Milena started her business two years ago when a neighbor convinced her to contact a company that sells through catalogs. After making her first sales, Milena enjoyed the work because of the income she generated since she was unemployed at the time. She had not been able to find a position as an administrative assistant.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, as well as her first with Kiva. Milena will use the funds to buy cosmetic products such as crèmes, household products, jewelry, personal use products, make-up, and facial treatments to expand her inventory. She has already improved her income through her business and has plans to strengthen it even more. Her goal is to create jobs through her business because she dreams of traveling all over the world and making progress.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, household products, jewelry, personal use products, make-up, and facial treatments

loans.name: Marivonne

texts.en:
Being connected is something that Marivonne L. values deeply, whether it is being connected with family members, or with business acquaintances. Yvonne, as she is called by her friends, is a college graduate.  At 38, she runs her own business, serves her husband Edgardo who works abroad, and mothers two children who both study in elementary school.

Marivonne is in the business of buying and selling merchandise. What she sells often is food, which is a basic need of people everywhere. She looks for the kind of food that is a daily essential and that which suits the tastes of her customers. With this entrepreneurial effort she earns a net income of 9,800 PHP.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Marivonne would like to request a loan of 14,000 PHP. With the loan and the learning she receives from CCT as a community partner, she will grow her business. She will purchase frozen food, cookies, and some canned goods, and strategize on how to get as many satisfied customers as she can.

At present, Marivonne deals with the problem of collecting payments from her customers. Nevertheless, she believes that good relational skills will enable her to solve this issue with her business connections. She continually holds on to the strength and favor God gives her to make her life better, such as having an expanding business with its own official commercial space. A sweeter success that she aims for is to make their living sustainable enough that her husband would not have to work abroad. Then, her desire of a family that stays together will be fulfilled. 

As a CCT community partner, Marivonne faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase frozen food and cookies for sale

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 39 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive independientemente en la casa de su madre, junto a su esposo Andrés de 42 años, quien trabaja de obrero en una mina y sus 2 hijos, a quienes desea dar una buena educación. El arduo trabajo que Marlene realiza en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus cultivos sean muy productivos y abundantes. Sus productos, los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene buenos precios por sus productos, ya que tiene clientes muy fieles, quienes le compran todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, puesto que el transporte es muy escaso. En adelante, desea tener un puesto de ventas en el mercado mayorista, donde pueda vender ella misma sus cultivos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de gladiolo y de arveja, también comprará sacos de abono para sus chacras.
texts.en: Marlene is 39-years-old and a mother to her family.  She is very loving and hard-working and lives independently in her mother’s house along with her husband Andrés, who is 42-years-old and a mine worker, and their two children who they hope to give a good education.  The hard work that Marlene does on her farm has made her plantings very productive and abundant.  She takes her products to sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma where she gets good prices for her products as she has very loyal customers who buy everything from her at wholesale prices.  What she likes best about her work is protecting her plantings from the pests that can damage them.  She has worked in this for 27 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the market as transportation is very scarce.  Looking forward she would like to have a sales stand in the wholesale market where she could sell the products she grows.  This is her eighth loan with MFP.  She knows that she has to make all of her payments punctually and is ready to do so.  In her communal bank she is a very joyful and supportive member.  With the 1500 nuevos soles she is requesting she will buy gladiolus bulbs and pea seeds as well as sacks of fertilizer for her fields.

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds and gladiolus bulbs as well as fertilizer

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en: Yanjmaa, 40, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Uvs province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past five years. Her older daughter attends college and the other three children go to a local secondary school. Yanjmaa makes clothes at home. She began exporting her handmade clothes and other consumer goods to Russia in 1997. She has gained much experience by running her business and built a good reputation among her customers. Her business revenues are much more stable now. Her husband helps her with the business and they are planning to have their own stall at the local market in the future. She is a hardworking and honest person. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 tugriks to purchase clothes and materials from China.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and materials.

loans.name: Patita  Ole

texts.en:
Patita O. O., 45-years old, is married. He is a father of two children. He has been a farmer for the past twelve years with a monthly income of KES6,500. 

Patita O. O. paid his previous loan well and in good time. He has applied for his fourth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm supplies. With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams to be prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain his set goals.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea H., 64, is a widow and a traditional cake seller in Takeo province. She is able to earn US $4 each day. Chea H. now lives with one of her daughters who works as a grocery seller, making US $8 per day. To earn more money, Chea H. is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase rice in bulk for resale. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy rice in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Johany Jackely

texts.es:
Johany de 23 años de edad, soltera vive con su madre y dos hermanas en edad escolar, lacualcuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en la capilla a 20 minutos del distrito de la Unión y a una hora del departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Johany es la crianza y venta de aves de corral (pollos, gallinas, patos y pavos), desde hace 4 años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales en la parte anterior de la casa (donde tiene un patio grande), los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura.  Esto le permite obtener mayores ganacias para cubrir sus gastosdiarios. 

Johany solicitau n préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento para sus animales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para venderlos a un mejor precio y mejorar el espacio o corral que tienen sus aves, para que estén más seguros.  Johany es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque es una persona que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el ideal que en un futuro brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su madre y hermanas.
texts.en:
Johany is 23 years old, single, and she lives with her mother and two school-aged sisters. Their home is equipped with water and electricity and it is located in La Capilla, at 20 minutes from the district of Union and one hour from the department of Piura. These regions are known for their agriculture, farming, and for their crafts.

Johany's business has been to raise and sell poultry (chicken, hens, ducks, and turkeys) for the past 4 years. She raises her livestock in the front section of her property (she has a large patio). She feeds them balanced feed and natural grains. Once they have reached an ideal size and weight she offers them for sale at the different markets. She has her own clientele in the city of Piura. This helps her have more earnings to cover her daily expenses.

Johany requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase feed for her livestock. This will help her keep them well fed and to sell them at a better price. She will also improve the space or corral where she keeps her poultry for greater safety. Johany is a well known where she lives because she is someone who is always looking out for the wellbeing of her own. Her ideal for the future is to provide a better quality of life to her mother and sisters.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and to improve the corral.

loans.name: Junet

texts.es: Junet, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Willy de 38 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Edith de 15 y Arnold de 6 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Ella pasa sus días bordando chompas, chalinas, guantes, etc., sus tejidos son comprados por tiendas de ropa, donde son vendidas con mucha rapidez, es por eso que tiene una gran demanda y trabaja mucho para satisfacerla, ya que sabe que es un muy buen ingreso para su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucha habilidad, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es realizar los acabados a las prendas que teje, con todo el trabajo que realiza, espera tener más adelante una tienda de ropa, donde pueda vender ella misma la ropa que teje y así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere tener problemas más adelante. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para confeccionar más prendas y así ofrecer una mayor variedad a las tiendas con las que trabaja.
texts.en: Junet is 30 years old. She is a very simple and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband, Willy, 38 years old, and their 2 beloved children: Edith, 15, and Arnold, 6. She wants to provide them with a better quality of life. She passes her days knitting sweaters, scarves, gloves, etc. Her knits are purchased by clothing stores where they are sold very quickly. She sees a great demand and she works long to satisfy it. She knows that it is a very good income for her business. What she most enjoys about her work is to knit and she does it with a great deal of skill. She has 3 years in the business and she considers the finishes on the articles of clothing she knits to be the most difficult part. With all the work that she does she hopes to have a clothing store in the future where she will be able to sell the clothing she knits herself to improve her earnings. This is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is saving to make her payments on time. She doesn't want to have problems in the future. With the six hundred nuevos soles she requests she will purchase more yarn to make clothing and to offer the stores with which she works a wider variety.

loans.use: to purchase yarn to knit articles of clothing.

loans.name: Nancy  Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Nancy es una  muy trabajadora que  desde hace  mas  de   ocho  años  se  dedica  a la compra  y  venta  de  ropa   usada , accesorios y  zapatos, actualmente   ella renta un local  donde tiene gran variedad de  productos para la venta,  en  esta  ocasión    ella utilizara el crédito  para acondicionar su establecimiento para  que  así su clientela  se sienta  mas  agusto cuando  acuden a  su  local, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Señora Nancy is very hard-working, and she has had a business buying and selling used clothing, accessories, and shoes, for more than 8 years.  She rents in a location that has a large variety of products for sale.  She will use this loan to fix up her location so her customers feel more at home when they arrive there.  She is thankful for the support that is being offered her so she can carry out this project.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 27 avril 2008. Il est  constitué de neuf femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont les mêmes affinités. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en charge quatre autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de sucre, de l'huile de palme et de pâte d'arachide. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis trois ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was set up on 27th April 2008 and is made up of nine women who live in the same district and get on well with each other. Their main activity is small-scale trading.

Fatou, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 53 years old, married and mother to four children. She also has four other children entrusted to her care.

She sells sugar, palm oil and groundnut dough. She has good experience in this field, having carried out this activity for the past three years.

This loan will allow her to boost her capital and to build up her business. The profits she makes will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing,etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, palm oil and groundnut dough

loans.name: Nahima Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Nahima del Carmen  ella es trabajadora activa de la Alcaldía Municipal de SRS desempeñándose como Asistente de Proyecto tiene  catorce    años  de trabajar para esta institución es casada  actualmente. Ha obtenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación  y este lo solicito para sufragar los gastos  de una medicina para su odio ya que necesita un tratamiento urgente para su odio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Nahima del Carmen is employed by city hall as a Project Assistant.  She’s been working for this entity for fourteen years.  She’s married.  She has had five CEPRODEL loans where were each used to buy building materials and supplies like sand, stone, gravel, concrete blocks, etc. to enlarge and improve her home.

She needs this loan to buy medicine for her ear that needs urgent treatment.  Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for her because she’s been able to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ear medicine.

loans.name: Yea

texts.en: Mrs. Yea, 53 years old, is a married woman who lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. She owns a small store in her village. The village is full of passengers and other villagers who pass by, and she uses this store to sell breakfast and lunch foods. She generates a profit of approximately US $1.50 a day to help support her family’s daily expenses with more stability. Her husband has been a domestic rice cultivator for many years. This couple has five married children. Mrs. Yea will be using the requested loan money to purchase seed, fertilizers and other farming materials.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizers and other farming materials.

loans.name: Herlinda Mariuxi

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Herlinda, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hermoso bebé de un mes de nacido. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende pollos por libras y en pie, dice nuestra amiga que ella compra estos animalitos a vecinos de la zona y los cría ya que así le queda más ganancias pero por la cantidad que vende se ve en la obligación de comprar también pollos pelados listos para la venta. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas aunque si algún cliente necesita algo ella sin ningún problema le vende a cualquier hora, lleva cinco años en su negocio y está muy contenta ya que se gana algo y no tiene que descuidar ni el hogar ni a su pequeño bebé, ya que su negocio está en casa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pollos pelados listos para la venta y alimentos para los que esta criando ya que aun están pequeños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido comprando cosas necesarias en su negocio. 

Sus sueños son mantenerse en su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "María Inmaculada" ["Immaculate Mary"] communal bank meets every 15 days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, a canton known for being the birthplace of the famous revolutionary Eloy Alfaro and and for its famous palmetto straw hats, admired in Ecuador and abroad.

This is where you would find Ms. Herlinda. She is 21 years old and married, and has a beautiful one-month old baby from this relationship. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

She has a small spot in her house from which she sells chickens by the pound, and she also sells them on foot. Our friend tells us that she sells to her neighbors and others in her area. She raises chickens herself because it is most profitable, but because of the quantity she sells, she is also obliged to purchase some plucked chickens that are ready for sale. She works every day in the mornings, although if a customer needs something she will sell to them at any hour without a problem. She has been running her business for five years and is very happy because she is able to earn money without neglecting either her house or her small baby, since the business is in her home.

This loan is for buying plucked chickens ready for sale, as well as feed for those that she is raising, which are still small. Herlinda has been in the communal bank since three cycles ago and she likes it because she has been buying necessities for her business with the loans.

Her dreams are to maintain her business and to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy plucked chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Alexandra Maria

texts.es:
Alexandra Maria tiene 40 años, Es soltera vive con la madre no tiene hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE, se encuentra ubicada recinto EL ROSARIO, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol.

Alexandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Guzman en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y frejol, para la compra de abonos y semillas para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es ingrametar la produccion comprarndo mas terreno para seguir cultivando.

Le gusta leer y escuchar muisica.
texts.en:
Alexandra Maria is 40 years old. She is single with no children and lives with her mother in the Cantón Ventanas division of Los Ríos, Ecuador.  

The members of the V.R.C. SAN JOSE are located in the EL ROSARIO area of Cantón Ventanas, which is dedicated to planting short-cycle maize, rice and beans. 

Alexandra plants corn and beans.  She buys her products in the Guzman commercial area in Cantón Ventanas and sells them in the wholesale market.

She is requesting a loan to plant corn and beans and to buy fertilizers and seeds for production. The loan would help her to meet her financial needs in spite of facing challenges such as pests and crop diseases.  Her dream is to increase production by purchasing more land for cultivation.

She enjoys reading and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sheep and expand the project.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
el sr. Víctor Manuel tiene 38 años de edad vive en la comunidad de la Toyosa, Teupasenti; una zona montañosa apta para el cultivo de café, y la misma es su fuente de ingresos.
Don Víctor es padre de (2) hijos y cuenta con más de 16 años de experiencia en el manejo y cultivo de cafe.
Victor utilizara el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar, ya que no cuenta con este servicio básico lo cual es de importancia en todos los hogares. gracias a este sistema el podra contar con iluminacion por medio de focos y asi dejar de usar candelas y candiles que no son nada favorables para la salud. ademas de esto podra cargar su telefono y podra conectar un equipo de sonido para escuchar noticias y musica durante el dia.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel is 38 and lives in the community of La Toyosa, Teupasenti, a mountainous region that is suitable for growing coffee, which is his source of income.

Víctor is the father of 2 children and has more than 16 years of experience managing and growing coffee.

Víctor will use the loan to buy a solar plant, since he doesn't have this basic service that is important in all the homes.  Thanks to this system he will be able to have lighting by means of light bulbs and stop using candles and oil lamps, which are not at all healthy.  He will also be able to charge his telephone and connect a sound system to listen to the news and music during the day.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy plant.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El Sr. Marcelino es cliente antiguo  desde  el año 2009, esta casado con la se señora Olga la cual  también tiene un negocio  es comerciante que viaja  a otro departamento a comprar su mercaderia, tiene 3 hijos que  se encuentran en  edad escolar,  el  cliente vive  en la zona de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de  La Paz. El Sr. Marcelino   vende ropa deportiva y chamarras de segunda mano,  el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  mercadería ropa deportiva y chamarras por mayor, el cliente es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable el cliente esta contento y agradecido con la institución por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelino has been a longtime client since 2009. He is married to Sra. Olga who also has a business. Marcelino is a merchant who travels to another department to buy merchandise. He has three children who are of school age. Marcelino lives in the District of Vino Tinto in the city of La Paz. He sells sportswear and secondhand jackets.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of sportswear and jackets in bulk. Marcelino is a hardworking and responsible individual who is pleased and grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase sportswear and jackets in bulk.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is from the village Breta, Khashuri District, East Georgia. He is 61 years old and lives with his wife Limer.  Levan and Limer are internally displaced persons from an area of conflict.  They receive a relevant pension from the Georgian government. 

Levan has two hectares of land, where wheat, cabbages, maize and tomato are grown.  Harvested vegetables are sold locally to retailers.  Their average income is 400 Laris, including their monthly pension.  His family also owns an electrical corn mill.  Their mill is out of the order at the moment.  Levan requests a loan to repair the mill.  After the mill is running, he can get orders from neighbor households and mill various types of corns.  

Levan will get additional income and work hard to expand his family's agricultural business.

loans.use: to repair his mill.

loans.name: March

texts.en: March is 35 years old, and works in a shoe factory where she earns $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $2.5 per day. They have one child who is 10 years old and in school. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on house rent, $2 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work. She wants to buy a cow to feed, and get its baby to sell when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es:
Guisela de 42 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Guisela desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (cuenta con 35 ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un óptimo crecimiento para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado y sanidad de su ganado ovino, con las ganancias que obtenga en la actividad podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Guisela es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia para que logren su objetivo.
texts.en:
Guisela is 42, and lives with her family in their own house, which only has electricity. It is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, which is part of Piura department.  People in this area make a living from farming, livestock-raising, and crafts. 

For several years, Guisela has raised and sold sheep (she has 35 sheep). Her pen is located behind her house and is suitable for this purpose.

She provides them with nutritionally balanced feed, and natural grasses, so that her animals reach their optimal growth, and she can sell them in the various markets in the area. In this way she makes good profits for meeting her daily household expenses.

She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy nutitionally balanced feed and to look after the health of her sheep.  With the earnings she gets from this work she will be able to pay back her loan and have a better quality of life, Guisela is a person who with effort and a lot of determination, has managed to help her family get ahead and achieve their goals.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed for her sheep, and look after their health.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 59 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in the Philippines. Francisca has a shop that sells fish such as milk fish and sardines. She has had this business for five years. 

Francisca is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fish to sell. Francisca has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Francisca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Kamalladin

texts.en:
Kamalladin is a 41-year-old man who has grown corn, fruits, and vegetables for the last 20 years. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. His wife actively helps him to run the business. 

His monthly income from crop selling is 250 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN). The demand in fresh fruits and vegetables is very high and Azerbaijani people use them in everyday life. Kamalladin applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer as well as working tools.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and farming implements.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Andrea, quien había oído acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, se informó y luego comento a sus amigas y vecinas sobre el tema, y ellas gustosas decidieron formar su grupo. De allí surge el comité llamado Mujeres Activas, el cual está integrado por 18 mujeres, todas ellas muy activas y trabajadoras.
La señora Andrea, la precursora del grupo, comenta que trabaja incansablemente, recorriendo las calles, ya que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ella se dedica al reciclaje. Junta todo tipo de materiales reciclables, como ser botellas de plástico, cartones, papeles, con lo cual con mucho esfuerzo logra mantener a su familia. comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de botellas, y cartones por cantidad para la posterior venta al mayor, ya que eso le dará mayor margen de ganancias. Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le da, pues es una oportunidad de progreso para ella.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Andrea who had heard about Fundación Paraguaya’s Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women] program.  She informed herself and then commented to her girlfriends and neighbors about the topic.  They gladly decided to form their group.  From that the “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) group arose with 18 members who are all very active and hardworking.

Andrea, the group’s precursor, comments that she works tirelessly walking throughout the streets because her work is very demanding: she’s a recycler.  She collects all types of recyclable material like plastic bottles, cardboard and paper which with much effort she’s able to use to support her family.  She comments that she’s very proud of what she does because it’s a honorable, honest job.

She requests the loan to buy bottles and cardboard in quantity to later resell at wholesale because this will leave a larger profit margin.  She’s very grateful for the opportunity she’s given because it’s an opportunity for progress for her.

loans.use: to buy bottles and cardboard for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is thirty-eight years old and married with three children.

Amy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Amy has borrowed and repaid twenty-three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seventeen years and also earns an income from ambulant vending vegetables.

Amy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ajhan

texts.en:
Ajhan is a vibrant 41-year-old woman who has a big proud smile on her face as she shows her home in Iraq. She created and maintains a beautiful living space for her and her two children whom she is raising alone since her husband died. Since then she had to work twice as hard to create a respected social status.

At the end of the hallway is a separate room for her sewing, tailoring work. She developed her small business slowly, but the 20 years of experience shows in her work and in her positive attitude. 

She has and she will continue to work hard to make sure she can secure a great future for her children, and provide them the necessary means for a good education.  

Ajhan has successfully applied, received and repaid three consecutive loans in the past from Relief International-Iraq - each she used to step-by-step build up her equipment and workspace. She now took a loan of 1700 USD from RI-Iraq in order to purchase more fabric and raw materials and other small items to advance her workspace and advance her business.

loans.use: to purchase new fabric and other materials for her sewing and tailoring work.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Lina is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products and home products in the local community. Lina has been in her business for 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it. In 2011, Lina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Lina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang, 32, is widowed and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries since 2003, earning USD 6 per day. Each month she has to spend USD 30 on food,  USD 7on utilities; her child’s school fee is USD 5 and other expenses are USD 25. 

Samnang is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase construction materials to repair her house and build a toilet to be hygienic and more comfortable. In the future, she would like to construct a room for a Karaoke. Moreover, she wants to support her child to study until her child finishes high school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair her house and build a toilet.

loans.name: Sop Sa Aladji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe sop sa aladji a été créé le 08 mai 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues du même village. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce et l'embouche. Binta debout à droite sur la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et a la charge de 05 enfants. Elle est fait la transformation d'huile d'arachide. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis 04 ans. Son prêt va lui permettre d'acheter des arachides. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire des  enfants
texts.en:
Sop Sa Aladji Group was established on May 8, 2010. It is made up of 12 women coming from the same village. Their main businesses are retailing and raising livestock.

Binta is responsible for the group. She's the one standing on the right and raising her hand in the photograph. She's 37 years old, married, and has five children to support.

She transforms peanuts into oil. She has a good experience in this field, due to the fact that she's been running this business for four years. Her loan will enable her to buy peanuts.

Her ambition is to help her husband in taking care of the children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 30 year old married woman from Hay Nazal Jordan who supports 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD to buy materials for flower arranging that she will sell. She will also be buying clothes which she will be selling as well. She had a previous loan for her flower arranging business and would like to expand it. In the future she would like to buy a car. 

* Mariam prefers not to upload her photo on the internet thus the above photo is of her husband

loans.use: to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell, and clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on Business

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Born in 1943, Mrs. Beauty A. is married and a mother of three (03) children. Her main business activity is the sale of cosmetic products. With this income, she manages to contribute to the household needs. As a good business manager, she has reimbursed her loans several times without any problems.

At this time, she is asking for a credit of $700 to build her business and to increase her source of income. With this new credit, she will be able to make her business more profitable and to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1943 Madame A. Beauty est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente des produits cosmétiques ; avec ses revenus, elle arrive à contribuer aux dépenses de son foyer. Par sa bonne gestion, elle a plusieurs fois honoré ses engagements sans incidents. A présent, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour renforcer son commerce et multiplier ses sources de revenus. Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle pourra rentabiliser plus ses affaires et contribuer efficacement à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish stocks and refrigeration equipment needed to start her fish-selling business

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela is 44 years old, is married, and has 8 children. Her husband works as a bricklayer assistant in the construction field.
