She breeds chicken and then sells them among people in her community and in the city’s market as a traveling salesperson. She is part of the group “Montebello 4” together with Cristina Navarro H. (breeding of pigs). With the loan both women will purchase more animals and medication to avoid plagues and diseases.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmela tiene 44 años , casada , tiene 8 hijos , su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil en la construccion . Ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos los que posteriormente vende entre las personas de su comunidad y tambien en el mercado de la ciudad como vendedor ambulante. Forma parte del grupo Montebello 4 junto con Cristina Navarro H. (crianza de puercos). Con el prestamo ambas compraran mas animales y medicamentos para evitar plagas y enfermedades.

loans.use: Purchase of animals

loans.name: Clara Magdalena

texts.es:
Clara Magdalena prepares tamales three times a week, and she delivers them to a snack bar that orders them every Saturday. She is 67 years old and she will use the loan to buy pots and pans to to improve the preparation of the food. She is a part of a group called “Circonia 9” together with Mrs Norma del Carmen Najera L. (sales of sweets and refreshments in a secondary school) and Mrs Karla Viridiana Meneses Archil (computers accessories). With the loan Norma will refit the place so that the children who come buy to her store have a better service and Karla will buy more accessories for computers.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Clara Magdalena hace tamales tres veces a la semana, y los sábados entrega por pedido a una cafetería. Ella tiene 67 años y con su préstamo invertirá comprando ollas para agilizar la preparación de los alimentos. Forma parte del grupo llamado Circonia 9 junto con doña Norma del Carmen Najera L. (venta de dulces y refrescos en una escuela secundaria) y doña Karla Viridiana Meneses Archil (accesorios para computadoras). Con el préstamo Norma acondicionara el lugar para que los niños que le compran tengan una mejor atención y Karla invertirá en mas accesorios para computadoras.

loans.use: Buy pots and pans for food preparation.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng S., aged 52, works as a broker buying and selling yams.  She earns about $1 per day.  Her husband works as the village chief and as a motor-taxi driver, earning about $2 per day.  They have six children.  Four children are students, one child helps his father at work, and one child is a laborer.  In order to buy yams in bulk at a lower purchase cost, she is requesting a loan of $800.  Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase yams for resale.

loans.name: Sanobarhon

texts.ru:
After getting a divorce and having a young child to provide for without a higher education, trading was the only way for Sanobarhon to earn a respectable living. She liked sewing since she was young and knew about fabrics, so she decided to sells fabrics at the markets in her region. After 3 years of experience she decided to take out a loan and establish a credit history. She is currently working on expanding and strengthening her business in order to respond to the demands of her family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

После развода с мужем - с ребенком на руках - без высшего образования - выход на базар оказался для этой женщины единственно приемлемым путем для достижения достойного существования. С юности увлекаясь шитьем и имея опыт и знания относительно женских материалов - Санобархон решила заняться поставкой и реализацияей именно этого товара на рынки своего района. Трехлетний опыт предпринимательства позволил ей без страха и риска для своего бизнеса начать свою кредитную историю. Думая о будущем - Атахонова Санобархон - работает над расширением и укреплением устойчивости своего бизнеса - что позволит ей без волнения отвечать все растущим потребностям своей маленькой семьи.

loans.use: Purchase of Winter Fabrics

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
20 years ago Mrs. J. decided to invest a small savings that she gathered with much effort and sacrifice in purchase meat.

Previously she had her business in her home but for the low sales she decided to move the business to an air conditioned location in the market with the economic help of Ceprodel who provided unconditional help in growing her business little by little and supporting her family.

One of her biggest dreams is to support her family, who is small grandchild she has been taking care of the past two years upon her parents’ death, and she hope the child continues with her studies in school.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 20 años la Sra. J. decide invertir un pequeño ahorro que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logra reunir y decide invertirlo en la compra de carne.

Anteriormente su negocio lo atiende en su casa de habitación pero por lo bajo en las ventas decide trasladarse al mercado en donde acondiciona un local con el apoyo económico que le brinda su mano amiga CEPRODEL al cual agradece su ayuda incondicional al ir progresando poco a poco en su negocio y en su vida familiar.

Uno de sus mayores sueños es sostener a su familia que lo representa su pequeña nieta a quien por infortunios de la vida cuida desde hace 2 años a raíz de la muerte de sus progenitores y que siga con sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is twenty-eight years old and has three school-going children. She sells a wide selection of shoes, pants, and shirts to the men of her community. Rosa slowly started her business four years ago and had to work very hard just to maintain the business because she did not have much access to capital and was unsure about the future of her business. Fortunately, she received funds from FSMA and she invested the money to purchase many goods that her customers were looking for and subsequently purchased. Now, Rosa would like to expand her business. She is seeking a second loan to add an assortment of perfumes so as to diversify her product line and to attract new clients.

loans.use: To purchase a large variety of perfumes and other goods in order to expand the entrepreneur's business.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
I have an unfinished construction project on one side of my house. I have already purchased some of the materials needed, but I ran out of money. I urgently need to finish this project because my daughter must move in as soon as possible due to the fact that my house is too small. I am requesting $1,200.00 USD in order to finish the construction of an additional bedroom in my house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar a un lado de mi vivienda ya he comprado algo de material pero me falto dinero, me urge terminar esa construcción ya que mi hija tiene la necesidad de habitarlo debido a que nuestra vivienda es muy pequeña” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda

loans.use: Construction of an additional bedroom

loans.name: Gladiz Maruja's Group

texts.es:
Maruja, Gloria and Olga belong to the Pampachacra communal bank and are from the community of the same name.

Maruja is a 41-year-old single mother with one son. She has a small convenience store in the community.

Gloria is married, 32 years old and has five children. With the loan, she plans to start breeding small animals.

Olga is a 44-year-old single mother of two. She buys and sells tara (a native plant), sows and tuna in her community.

Maruja, Gloria and Olga dream of having their own homes, to have a bigger business and for their children to get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maruja, Gloria y Olga pertenecen al Banco Comunal Pampachacra, ellas son de la comunidad de Pampachacra, distrito de Quinua.

Maruja es madre soltera, tiene 41 años y 1 hijo, Maruja tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su comunidad.

Por otro lado Gloria es casada, tiene 32 años y 5 hijos, Gloria con el préstamo que obtendrá comenzara con la crianza de animales menores.

Mientras que Olga es madre soltera, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Olga compra y vende tara, cochinilla y tuna en su misma comunidad.

Maruja, Gloria y Olga necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, tara, cochinilla y para implementar su pequeña granja.

Los sueños de Maruja, Gloria y Olga son construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, tener casa propia, tener un negocio más grande y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Maruja, Gloria and Olga need loans to purchase rice, sugar, soft drinks, tara (a native plant), sows, and to start a small farm / Maruja, Gloria y Olga necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, tara, cochinilla y para implementar su pequeña granja.

loans.name: Popeal Khaer Ii Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sareth T. is the Village Bank President in Popeal Khaer II in Kandal Province. She is 44 and the mother of seven children, one of whom is working in a greenhouse plantation field while an other is a motorbike taxi-driver. The remaining five are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Seourn Sao, is a motorbike taxi driver who generates only a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sareth T. is a farmer and last year she obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to grow vegetables. Unfortunately last year in August, her husband got a liver disease and curing him was very costly. These unforeseen expenses prevented Mrs. Sareth T. from being able to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her field. In order to be able to produce more healthy vegetables, she asked for a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides. She will also use the loan to buy more vegetables seeds.

loans.use: These women would like to buy fertilizers, insecticides and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María started the business because years ago she helped a neighbor to sell clothes in the small market. Since things went well for her neighbor, one day she decided to establish her own business selling used clothing out of economic necessity. Her husband had little work and with what the neighbor with whom she was working paid her, there wasn’t enough to cover household expenses. She started 10 years ago selling clothing and at first she sold very few articles, only men’s and women’s slacks. Little by little she gained a better clientele because she offered good quality and to this day has continued to add more variety of clothing. She now sells almost all types of clothes and has frequent clients.

She needs a loan for US$600, which she plans to repay in six months, to offer clothing that’s in season. With your help María will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria inició el negocio porque años atrás le ayudaba a una vecina a vender ropa en el mercadito y como le iba muy bien un día decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de ropa de medio uso, ante la necesidad economica ya que su esposo tenía poco trabajo y con lo que le daba la vecina con la que ella trabajaba no se completaban para los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace 10 años con la venta de ropa, primero vendía muy pocas prendas, solo pantalones de hombre y mujer, poco a poco fue teniendo mayor clientela porque surtía ropa buena y cada vez iba metiendo mas variedad de ropa, hast la fecha que ya vende de casi todos los tipos de ropa, y tienen clientes frecuentes

. Ella necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir ropa de temporada.Con tu ayuda Maria saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Ouk K., 55, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. She is a housewife and her husband is a construction foreman. Together, the couple has eight children, three of whom are married. Three of their daughters work in garment factories, and two of the children are students.

Mrs. K. is seeking to help her husband’s work. She would like to borrow $700 to purchase a motorbike so that he can easily commute to work.

loans.use: Ouk would like to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela is very hardworking. For the past 25 years she and her husband have been farmers, and this work has allowed her to support her 4 children. She currently is 49 years old and still supports a 14 year old son, who has many dreams and hopes for advancement. In addition, she and her husband have a passenger transport service. She tends to her animals in the high plains of the Andes and cultivates her fields. The main crop she raises is potato. Later she plans to produce ecologically-friendly potatoes, for which she is preparing some seeds for planting. For this reason, she needs to get the fields ready for planting, and she is requesting a loan to buy sacks of organic fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Marcela es muy trabajadora, junto a su esposo se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, son 25 años que viene realizando esta labor, que le ha permitido sostener a sus 4 hijos, en la actualidad tiene 49 años, a su cargo aún está su hijo de 14 años, el que tiene muchos anhelos y deseos de superación.Paralelamente, también en compañía de su esposo ofrecen servicio de transporte de pasajeros.Ella cuida de sus animales que tiene en la puna y de sus campos de cultivo, el producto principal que producen es la papa, en adelante incursionarán en la producción de la papa ecológica, para lo cual está preparando las semillas que ha de sembrar. Por tal razón le urge preparar la tierra para la siembra, por ello solicita un préstamo con el que comprará sacos de abono.

loans.use: Buy organic fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Khosrov

texts.en:
Khosrov (his mother is pictured above) was born in 1982. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan. He has settled in the town of Khirdalan, where he is married with one child. He has been running a general store for five years.

Khosrov is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy additional food items to increase business and improve their general store.

loans.use: To buy additional food items to increase business and improve their general store

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
El señor Osvaldo López es del Barrio Navidad, distrito de Guayaybi, tiene casa propia, y es casado.

Es odontólogo, tiene su consultorio en su casa, cuenta con todos los elementos y herramientas para su trabajo. Su consultorio lo ha equipado con mucho sacrificio gracias a ahorros y créditos que fue adquiriendo, pues el cuenta de que son muy caros.

También realiza servicios a domicilio en otras localidades para cumplir con sus pacientes. Además de eso también tiene una finca en donde tiene cultivos de mandioca y maíz, lo cual representa un buen ingreso para la familia también.

Osvaldo está muy contento con los logros que obtiene de su profesión, dice que desea seguir ayudando a más personas a acceder a este servicio ya que en la ciudad no existen muchos odontólogos y el desea ayudar a niños de escasos recursos a cuidar sus dientes.

Osvaldo desea ampliar su local, y comprar más muebles para su consultorio de este modo dar mayor comodidad a sus pacientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Florencio M. Ortiz is 53 years old and from Joaihu-Guayaybi where he owns his own home. Hs is married to Marina González and they have 3 children. The client is an electricity and electronics technician, repairing televisions, radios, refrigerators, and more. In addition he owns a disc jockey business called FM DISCO, where he is contracted to play for parties such as weddings, birthdays, etc. His wife sells cheese and milk, as she has milking cows and with them she produces additional income for the family. Today they are asking for a loan to acquire more new tools and parts for his electricity and electronics workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials, parts and tools

loans.name: Donald

texts.es: El señor Donald habita  en el barrio Memorial Sandino, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 36 años, se encuentra casado con la señora Rosa Elieth  Rodriguez, tiene la edad de 30 años, quien le ayuda a los gastos de la casa, ella se dedica a  la venta de ropa y cosméticos, juntos tiene  3 hijos. Actualmente el señor Donald se desempeña como guardia de seguridad de la alcaldía de Managua, en los tiempos libre cultiva frijoles, maíz y trigo, tiene 16 años de trabajar para la alcaldía, el aspira darle buenas condiciones  de vida a su familia y por tanto solicita un crédito de C$  14,000  a 9 meses para mejorar el piso de su casa, así mismo en un futuro desea fortalecer sus tierras para obtener mayor producción y  poder comercializar maíz, trigo y frijoles.
texts.en:
Mr. Donald lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, which is located in the capital city of Managua. He is 36 years old and is married to Rosa Elieth Rodriguez, who is 30 years old and helps him with the household expenses by selling clothing and cosmetics. Together, they have 3 children. Mr. Donald is currently employed as a security guard at the mayor’s office of Managua. In his free time, he also grows beans, corn and wheat. He has been working for the mayor’s office for 16 years. He aspires to give his family better living conditions, which is why he is requesting a loan of C$ 14,000.00, which will be repaid in 9 months, so that he can improve the flooring in his house. In the future, he would also like to strengthen his crop fields so that he can yield more produce and sell corn, wheat and beans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair house floor

loans.name: Binta Yami

texts.fr: Binta Yami D., 24 ans, mariée, 02 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Dinguiraye depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de marchandises diverses en approvisionnant sa boutique en riz, huile, thé, lait, sucre, cigarettes, etc.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Binta Yami D., age 24, is married and has two children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Dinguiraye for two and a half years. She wants to bolster her business of diverse goods by supplying her shop with rice, oil, milk, sugar, cigarettes, etc. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop:  rice oil, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: A. Manzura lives in the B.Gafurov region. She is a loving mother and grandmother. She has been engaged in the family business of livestock  for 40 years so she has taken care of animals all her life. She helped her mother when she was young and continued when she got married. She has 2 cows and 3 bulls. She dreams of having a milk cow so she decided to apply to KIVA for a business development loan of 2000 STJ for 6 months fto purchase a milk cow. She thanks KIVA in advance for its support.

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena Z. N., tiene 30 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 1er ciclo de Relaciones Públicas, carrera que abandono cuando se caso, tiene   01 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Maria inicio su negocio ayudando a su esposo en la elaboración de estampados de polos, con las ganancias que obtuvo compro algunos productos y decidió poner una pequeña bodega, con el tiempo ha logrado surtirla con variedad de productos que le dan muchas ganancias, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de pinturas para estampados.
Con el crédito de 600 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra abarrotes para su bodega.
Maria sueña con tener un minimarket en su casa y viajar por todo el Perú
Ella pertenece al programa de vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Maria Elena Z. N. is 30 years old and she finished the first trimester of the Public Relation degree. She has a dependent daughter. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Maria started her Business helping her husband to make stamping designs. With her money she made, she decided to open a small shop. With time she was able to diversify her business so she makes a good profit out of them. She runs her business at home. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to purchase paint to make stamping designs. With this $200 loan, which will be paid off in 4 months, she will purchase grocery products for her shop. Maria’s dream is to open a minimarket at home and to travel around Peru. She is part of a Peruvian government’s program called “Glass of Milk” where she receives a daily basket of basic food products to feed her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery products for her store

loans.name: Chadulu L Group

texts.en:
Sarafina has been a clothing seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for four years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. She works at her business every day. Sarafina is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money.  

Sarafina is 27 years old and single. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Lucy and Rose. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Emma Procesa

texts.en:
Emma Procesa R. is 47 year old, married and a resident of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has three children and she is engaged in fruits and vegetables retailing. The husband is a barangay councilor and at the same time a meter reader of MOELCI II - an electric power company.  One of son is already working abroad as a marine engineer.

Her business started with a minimal capital of PHP 2,000 and one display table. After her membership with PMPC she was able to build a storage room for the fruits and vegetables. She needs additional capital in order she can purchase fruits and vegetables in bigger volume and lower cost.

She hopes to become a wholesaler in the municipality of Jimenez

loans.use: Fruits and Vegetables Retailing

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi L. est un jeune homme de 32 ans, marié et père d’un petit garçon. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à womé. Il espère avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto étant donné que celle qu’elle utilisait ne répond plus à ses attentes. Avec cette nouvelle moto, Kossi pourra mieux exercer son activité afin de pour mieux épargner afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Kossi L. is a young man, 32 years old, married, and the father of a little boy. He drives a motorbike taxi, or moto taxi, in Womé. He hopes to use this loan to buy a new moto, given that the one he has been using no longer meets his expectations. With this new moto, Kossi will be able to perform his work better, so as to save more money in order to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Manos Juntas Rumichaca Alta Group

texts.es:
El grupo “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICAHACA ALTA”; Tiene 14 miembros activos, en su mayoría son nacidos en el distrito D. Rumichaca, está situado a 15 minutos D. la provincia D. Urubamba en el departamento del Cusco.

Estos socios están en su etapa inicial con este banco comunal, tienen entre sus actividades la agricultura, la ganadería y la artesanía, alternando sus actividades domésticas y en la mayoría D. los casos estás actividades son heredadas D. generación en generación, por lo que ellos requieren el préstamo, para poder comprar sus productos agrícolas (semillas, maíz, cebada), en la ganadería (animales menores cuyes, aves D. corral y animales vacunos), en cuanto a los que se dedican a la artesanía, requieren comprar materia prima (arcilla, maquinaría y otros).

Los socios del banco se encuentran muy agradecidos y expresan sus saludos, valorando este préstamo por lo que se comprometen a cumplir con sus obligaciones D. pago en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
This loan group, Manos Juntas (Hands Together) Rumichaca Alta, has 14 active members most of whom were born in the District of Rumichaca, which is situated about 15 minutes from Urubamba Province in the Department of Cusco. These members are in their first stage with this communal bank. Their activities incluD. agriculture and livestock in addition to their usual domestic chores, and for most of them these activities have been passed down from generation to generation. They are requesting this loan so as to be able to buy their supplies for agriculture (seeds, corn, barley) and animal husbandry (young guinea pigs, poultry, cattle) and raw materials for those engaged in hand crafts (clay, machinery and such). The bank members are very grateful and send their regards. They are taking this loan very seriously and promise to fulfill their obligations to repay it according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for farming and handcrafts.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana G. is forty-seven years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Juliana is an entrepreneur, dynamic and very dedicated to her work. She got married twenty-three years ago. Three of her children are in senior high school and the other three are learning trades.

She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for over three years. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. Juliana produces the palm oil and sells it to food vendors for preparing their meals. She even treks to other villages to purchase finished goods when demand becomes very high. Her major business area is her neighboring country, Togo, in West Africa. She takes gallons of palm oil to be sold in Togo, and when she returns she brings foodstuffs like gari (fermented and dried cassava), maize, etc. and retails them in her community.

Prices of raw materials are very high, making it difficult for her to achieve her target. Loan support will help her to realize that dream. Juliana wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts fruits, and gallon containers to increase her efficiency in producing larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income for supporting her children's education. Juliana belongs to a village bank called ‘Divine’.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and gallon containers.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Mạnh Nguyễn Thị (432061000) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has two school-aged children. Mạnh owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Mạnh has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2006, Mạnh joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Mạnh is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her 3rd loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Passy

texts.en: N. Passy is 48 years old and lives with her husband.  In 2008 she began her business dealing in clothes. She is using the loan to purchase more clothes such as shirts, pants, material, blankets, etc., for her business located on Herbert Street. Her hope is to increase her daily income and be able to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes such as shirts, pants, material, blankets etc

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Одинаева Нафиса – женщина  29-ти  лет,  замужем,  имеет  одного ребёнка. Она  вместе  со  своим  мужем   больше  двух  лет  занимается  продажей  сахара  и  макаронных  изделий и других продуктов питания. Возле своего дома они имеют маленький магазинчик,который пользуется хорошим спросом у соседей.  В начале  своей  деятельности  она  брала  товар  под  реализацию  у  оптовиков.  Благодаря  нашему  кредиту  она  получила  возможность  ездить  в  город  Худжанд  и  покупать  товар  за  наличность  по  выгодным  ценам. Нафиса очень  рада  сотрудничеству  с  нами  и  благодарна  нашим  кредиторам  за  помощь  в  осуществлении  её  планов.
texts.en:
Nafisa O. is a 29-year-old woman. She is married and has one infant. For more than two years, she together with her husband has engaged in selling sugar, macaroni products and other food products. Near their home, they have a little store that is in good demand by neighbors. In the beginning of her activities, she brought goods accessed through a middleman. Thanks to the loan, she received the opportunity to travel to the city of Khujand and to purchase goods for her stock at advantageous prices. Nafisa is very happy with the collaboration with MLF MicroInvest and is thankful for the loan that has helped her realize her plans. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy granulated sugar

loans.name: Karema Group

texts.en:
Karema is the group leader of the Karema group, which has four members.
Karema and Sareya want a loan for their carpet-weaving business; they want to buy necessary materials. A. W. wants a loan for his taxi business, and wants to buy necessary materials. Omid wants a loan for his metal shop business; he wants to add to his stock and enlarge his shop. They all want to expand and improve their businesses and want to earn more money to support their families. 
They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. They want to thank all AFSG and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: enlarge their business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and poultry food

loans.name: Armelle

texts.fr: Armelle née le 16 Aout 1972 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Armelle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Armelle a été à l’école. Après l'abandon des classes, Armelle s'est mise dans de petits commerces. Aujourd’hui, avec l'aide financière de son mari, Armelle a pu démarrer une vraie activité d'alimentation générale. Armelle a besoin de renforcer son fonds de commerce pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Armelle sollicite d’ALIDé son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Armelle was born on August 16, 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married and the mother of three.  Armelle has been in school.  After dropping out, she started off in small-scale businesses.  Today, with financial help from husband, she was able to start a real business in grocery items.  Armelle needs to bolster her working capital in order to respond better to the demands of her customers.  For this reason, she is requesting her third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, corn, onions, canned food, drums of vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna V. lives in the village of Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 44 years old, married and has five children, all now grown. She makes a living running a sari-sari (or variety) store, where she sells mostly food and other products that customers use daily. 

Last year, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She has successfully repaid three previous loans from HSPFI, which she used to expand the range of items she sells from her store. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs and has requested a loan for N50,000 to purchase more stock. She would like to thank all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est une diplômée d’une école de formation professionnelle ; en effet, elle est titulaire d’un diplôme d’agent de développement. Malheureusement, elle n’a pas eu la chance d’être employée par une institution classique ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’est lancée en 2005 dans la gestion d’une activité génératrice de revenu, en exerçant le commerce d’habits pour enfants ainsi que des produits de beauté comme les boucles d’oreille, les perles et bijoux. Elle exerce cette activité dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle est fière de cette nouvelle opportunité dans laquelle elle réussit à bien gagner sa vie. Elle souhaite renouveler son stock en baisse ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des habits pour enfants et des produits de beauté. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
This woman is a graduate of a professional training school; she actually has a degree as a Development Officer. Unfortunately, she has not had the chance to be employed by a traditional institution; it is for this reason that, in 2005, she began managing her own income-generating activity by seling children's clothing as well as beauty products such as earrings, pearls, and jewelry. She runs this business at the Hédzranawoé market in Lomé. She is proud of this new opportunity through which she has been able to make a living successfully. She hopes to replenish her diminished stock; it is for this that she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy children's clothing and beauty products. She is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Roxana Estefa

texts.es: La señora Roxana trabajo con la institucion desde el año 2002 con el grupo solidario Delicia en 10 secuencias, despues de 3 años retorna a la Empresa solicitando credito individual. Ella se dedica a la venta de helados hace mas de 10 años, el esposo Nicolas tambien se dedica al mimo rubro en la zona de Miraflores; Tiene hijos que ya son independientes, pero aun les quedan dos hijos que estan en edad escolar. Ambos lograron comprarse un terreno en la zona Santa Rosa por Villa Fatima en el cual estan construyendo su vivienda, son clientes que pagan puntualmente
texts.en:
Roxana worked with the institution since 2002 in the solidarity group “Delicia”, after three years she is back to request an individual loan. She has been in the business of selling ice cream for more than 10 years, her husband Nicolas also works in the same line of business in the Miraflores area; she has children that are independent, but still has two children of school age. Both were able to buy a piece of land in the Santa Rosa area around Villa Fatima, in which they are building a home, they are clients that pay on time.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise and house repair

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia sells drinks, loaves of bread, and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is a focused and hard worker. She is 54 years old and married with seven children. Her husband is a farmer. 

She has been in this business for a long time. She is hoping for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more drinks and loaves of bread to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca D. is from the village of Salimpuno. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Rebecca owns and operates a business planting and harvesting cassava for sale, earning an income of 3,000 Php more or less. Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her cassava plantation

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina S. P. es una joven señora de 23 años de edad quien vive con su esposo en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Ella  se dedica a la avicultura, específicamente a la cría de pollos para engorde. Ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad. 

Actualmente doña Carolina   está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones) para la compra de más pollos para engorde, así como compra de concentrado para su alimentación y productos para la prevención y  tratamiento de enfermedades, además de ampliar y reforzar su local. 

Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Doña Carolina es socia de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Carolina S. P. is a young woman of 23 who lives with her husband in a small community called La Trinchera de Pital, located in province of Alajuela. The principle commercial activities in the area are cattle raising and agriculture, especially pineapple. These products are sold on the international market. For this reason, the community has been growing in recent years, generating more demand for products and more opportunities for work.

Carolina’s business is poultry, specifically the raising and fattening of chickens. She sells her products to the neighbors in her community, and they are quite satisfied with their quality.

Carolina is seeking a loan of 300,000 colones to purchase more chickens, as well concentrate for their feeding, products for prevention and treatment of diseases, and to strengthen the pens. With this loan, she hopes her microbusiness will grow and be able to serve more clients and offer better products. All this will help Carolina improve her living conditions.

Carolina is a member of the “Empresa Communal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital,” one of the 100 organizations associated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it, she expects to continue growing personally and economically. She also wants to actively participate in the loan organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and supplies

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 58 años, esta felizmente casado con su esposa Dora de 55 años, y juntos tienen 7 hijos, de los cuales sólo viven con ellos, Maritza de 9 y Ruth de 16  años, en su propia casa que esta ubicado en una pueblo lejano en la sierra del Perú.  Desde hace 40 años se dedica a la agricultura de alverja, papa (tubérculo peruano), habas, cebada y flores como el gladiolo, paralelamente a esta actividad, se dedica también a la crianza de ovinos y reses que le ayudan arar la tierra para el cultivo además de la ayuda incondicional de su esposa e hijas. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura es cultivar gladiolos y alverjas, ya que le generan buenas ganancias económicas  en comparación a los otros productos que existe en la sierra. Además su producción es en menor tiempo y se comercializa rápidamente en los mercados aledaños a su zona. Con los ingresos que obtiene de estas dos actividades puede  brindar a sus hijos una adecuada educación, y cubrir la manutención de su vivienda e incluso puede ahorrar para comprar más terrenos para cultivo.  Es así que espera en el futuro comprar grandes extensiones de terrenos, sembrar productos que más se cultivan en la zona y luego repartirlos a sus 7 hijos. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y esta muy entusiasmado porque ya tiene planeado en la inversión que hará. Además continuará siendo el presidente de su grupo comunal en donde dará el ejemplo de cumplir puntualmente con sus cuotas. Con el préstamo tiene pensado comprar bolsas de semillas de alverja, semillas de la flor de Sarita, así como insecticidas, sacos de fertilizantes y abono orgánico, productos que están valorizados alrededor de mil soles.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 58 years old and is happily married to his wife Dora who is 55 years old; together they have 7 children, but only two live with them, Maritza who is 9 and Ruth who is 16 years old, they live in their own home located in a distant town in the sierra del Perú. Since 40 years ago he grows green peas, potatoes, broad beans, barley and flowers like gladiolus, he also raises bovines and heads of cattle that help him plough the land for the crops, he also relies on the unconditional help of his wife and daughters. What he enjoys most about agriculture is growing gladiolus and green peas since they give him good profits in comparison to the other products that grow on the sierra. Additionally, their production takes less time and it is commercialized faster and sold in the border markets in his area. With the income that he gets from both activities he can give his children an acceptable education, cover the maintenance of his home and buy more land for his crops. He hopes that in the future, he can buy more land and plant more crops that are grown in the area and later distribute them among his 7 children. This is Guillermo's seventh loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner), and he is very excited since he has already planned on how to use the money. Moreover, he will continue to be the president of his communal group where he will be an example by paying punctually his loan quotas. With the loan he will buy bags of green pea seeds, Sarita flower seeds, as well as insecticides, sacks of fertilizer and organic fertilizer; the products are sold for about a thousand soles.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy green pea and flower seeds, fertilizer, organic fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Thelma Leonor

texts.es:
Thelma Leonor A. es una señora trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable y honrrada.  Ella llego a Adim con el deseo de mejorar y aumentar el negocio lo cual a logrado poco a poco. 

En sus inicios ella  vendía ropa usada de forma ambulante, luego puso un pequeño caramanchel donde instalo una pequeña tienda de ropa usada  la cual ha mejorado. Ella desea convertir su pequeña tienda en una megaboutique.
texts.en:
Thelma Leonor A. is a woman who is hardworking, enterprising, responsible, and honorable. She came to ADIM with the desire to improve and expand her business gradually over time.

In the beginning, Thelma sold used clothing as a street vendor. She later acquired a vending post where she opened a small used clothing store, which was an improvement. Thelma wants to convert her small store into a mega-boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Sok-Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok-heng D., 28, (shown in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Sarorn Oeur, 29, have been married since 2000. They have three children: two daughters and one son. Two of them attend school and other one is still young. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sok-heng has been selling fish since she was married. Her husband is a construction worker. In the past he was a truck driver. Sok-heng buys fish from the villagers and transports them with her motorbike to sell at Phnom Penh market. Because her motorbike is so old, she is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to carry fish to market.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en: Leonides T. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Leonides owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Leonides joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Leonides plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Guèye née Awa F. est mère de 4 enfants avec une moyenne d’âge de 7 ans. Elle est membre U-IMCEC depuis Juin 2009 et sollicitée un crédit de 120 000 FCFA pour compléter son budget d’approvisionnement.  Elle vend maintenant des habits pour hommes et elle veut se ravitailler en  ceinture, ensemble maillots, lacostes, tee shirt et des pantalons jeans qu’elle vend par commande.
Au paravent, Madame Guèye vendait des tissus, du thé, de l’encens et des chaussures. Elle a fait 10 ans dans la vente et compte sur ce prêt pour augmenter sa production. Ainsi avec ce nouvel investissement, Madame Guèye âgée de 43 ans espère régler les frais de scolarité de sa petite sœur qui suit une formation à Dakar.   
C'est ainsi qu'elle pense que le crédit va lui procurer un impact positif sur sa situation sociale et sur son business en lui assurant une dépendance économique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guèye (maiden name Awa F.) is the mother of four children, whose average age is seven years. She has been a member of U-IMCEC since June 2009 and is seeking a loan of 120,000 FCFA to round out her inventory budget. She is currently selling men's clothing, and she would like to replenish her stock of belts, sports uniforms, polos, tee-shirts, and jeans, which she sells on order. Previously, Mrs. Guèye sold fabrics, tea, incense, and shoes. She has been in sales for ten years and needs this loan to increase her production. In this way, with this new investment, Mrs. Guèye (age 43) hopes to pay the school fees of her younger sister, who is studying in Dakar. Thus she believes that this loan will have a positive impact on her social situation and her business by ensuring her financial independence.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on clothing

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano tiene 65 años, casado con Eusebia de 57 años, y ambos tienen 7 hijos, de los cuales viven con 5 de ellos en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 40 años que trabaja en las tierras que lo vieron crecer, por lo que aprecia mucho la actividad que realiza, sembrando siempre maíz, papa y todas clase de hortalizas, y que son cultivados en terrenos arrendados, que junto a su hijo menor, lo ayuda en la labor agrícola, mientras su esposa se esmera en preparar los alimentos, para que de esa manera puedan continuar y resistir este trabajo, bajo el calor intenso del sol. Con las ganancias que ha obtenido ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar así como la  educación de sus hijos, quienes ya son independientes. Para su futuro, piensa comprar terrenos agrícolas, además de una casa para que pueda vivir cómodamente. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y en este tiempo ha aprendido a valorar el trabajo en  equipo, dentro de su grupo comunal, por eso le gusta participar de cada reunión que tiene. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará varias latas de semilla de coliflor, lechuga, espinaca y culantro, así también comprará productos químicos para proteger sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 65, is married to Eusebia, 57. They have 7 children, 5 of whom still live with them in a rented house. He has worked the land of his birth for 40 years; something that makes him appreciate what he does very much. He grows corn, potato and all kinds of vegetables on leased lands. His youngest son helps him with the farm chores while his wife prepares the meals so that they can carry on and withstand this work beneath the intense heat of the sun. The profits that have been obtained have allowed him to meet household expenses as well as pay for the education of his children, who are now independent. He plans to buy farm lands in the future as well as a house in which to live comfortably. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. During this time he has learned to value teamwork within his communal group; he enjoys taking part in all the meetings. He will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy several cans of cauliflower, lettuce, spinach and coriander seed as well as chemical products to protect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed and chemical products to protect his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Produce mushrooms

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
For the past 6 years, Rano has sold women’s clothing at “Ganjina” market in Dushanbe. Rano is married and the mother of three children. She is determined to provide a better living for her entire family. Rano is hard working and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Rano has both a strong business base and a perfect credit history with IMON International. Currently, she is seeking a loan of $1500 USD to purchase a new vending facility and to expand her business. With the increased income, Rano plans to continue growing her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the working capital with the purpose of business development.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian M. is from the village of Punta. She is 44 years old, is married, and has two adult children and one of school age. Vivian owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Vivian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to start a fish-selling business. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ukay-ukay (used clothing) items for another new business. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ukay-ukay items for another new business

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He is 45 years old, married and has 7 children, ages 10-35 years old. Three of the children are currently attending school. He has been farming for 12 years and over time has employed 12 people on a casual basis. His main products are maize, milk, beans, goats and millet which he sells to the local market. He also owns a retail shop and some rental houses in the area. His main challenges in farming are the poor prices offered by the middlemen (since he sells his goods wholesale) and lack of enough capital for expansion.

Simion has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) after having successfully completed a previous loan of 45,000 KES. He will use this loan to purchase an ox plough for farming and to increase his stock of cereals. The income from this loan will enable him to educate his children and build more rental houses that he can leave as a legacy for his children. Simion would also like to expand his retail shop and stock farm inputs for sale. He wishes to explore new and wider markets for his products. He is appealing for more help from Juhudi and, if possible, more training on agriculture production.

loans.use: To purchase an ox plough and expand his cereal busines.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida I. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Loida is married and has three school-aged children. Loida owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Loida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Loida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from ASKI, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

Loida is now requesting her second loan from ASKI, for 6,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase even more livestock feed & supplies.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Tofaga

texts.en:
Tofaga P. is 41 and married with 4 children aged 6 to 22. She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. Tofaga has 3 years experience in this business and needs a loan of WST$1750 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2008, Tofaga joined SPBD and this is her 3rd loan. SPBD's loans are Tofaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Koguilan 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Koguilan 2 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et ont en moyenne   3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, CHITAN ABOU D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Koguilan 2 are married women with an average age of 46 years and have on average 3 children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Kegne, one of the villages of the prefecture of Dioïla, area of Koulikoro, 2nd administrative area of Mali. They collaborate with the institution of microfinance Soro Yiriwaso with an aim of better being able to organize their activities at the beginning of wintering. The speculations cultivated are among others, groundnut, small millet, corn and beans. They are on their fifth countryside loan and all the previous were well repaid. This new loan, CHITAN ABOU D. takes into account to buy the crop inputs before prices rise, small equipment and to pay the expenses of ploughing to maintain about 1 hectare of groundnut. The produce is sold in the cities of Faded and Dioïla after harvests, to customers made up of men and women. They hope to realize an average benefit of 25000FCFA approximately by the end of the campaign.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
Gulmira D. is 42 years old and has three children – one son aged 7 and two daughters aged 14 and 19 years, the youngest of which helps in the household. Gulmira’s husband went off to Russia in search of a living to support his family.
Gulmira is a respectable and diligent person. She graduated from State Medical College and worked in a hospital. Unfortunately, her salary as a nurse was very low and didn’t meet her children's expenses. Gulmira got a job as a seller at a local train station selling foodstuffs to passengers, and worked there for three years. In 2005, Gulmira decided to start up her own business. She earned her starting capital of 15,000 KGS from selling cattle, and with this capital she bought a parcel of clothes for resale. Her business started well and in 2007 she applied for a loan of 20,000 KGS to broaden her assortment of clothes. Gulmira used her loan as intended and repaid it without any delays. 
Gulmira proposes to use this loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase a seasonal assortment of clothes for adults and children. With the revenues from the loan, Gulmira plans to buy her own little shop.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more radio batteries, soap, and copy books.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito S. Jr. is from the village of San Juan. He is 36 years old. Juanito is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juanito owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling breads, cakes, and cookies to the local community. Juanito has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juanito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Juanito is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Juanito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson B. is from the village of San Vicente. He is 51 years old. Nelson is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Nelson owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 35 years and earns approximately 70,000 PHP per harvest for these activities.

In 2010, Nelson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nelson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Kyandago Development A, Kihihi Group

texts.en: It is now 11 years since B. Jeninah started up her farming projects and specialized in selling bananas in Kihihi, western Uganda. With this as her only source of livelihood, she has painstakingly managed to make ends meet despite seasonal income fluctuations and poor road systems to access bigger markets. With a hard work ethic and ready market, the 49-year-old married and happy-go-lucky mother of 5 children has kept her business on a path of consolidated growth. She earns 360,000 UGX monthly. Her business has gained ground over the years, benefiting her family. Her business plan for the future is to sell more bananas to an increasingly expanding market. She will use this loan to purchase manure for her plantation for better production.

loans.use: purchasing manure for the plantation

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
Don Neri tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad, residen en el municipio de Chinameca, departamento de San Miguel, su negocio es la venta de minutas de forma ambulante por las calles, parque y escuela de la ciudad, lo aprendió solo observando como los demás lo hacían, y lleva ya 10 años en esta actividad.
Don Neri quiere invertir en su negocio y para esto solicita un préstamo ya que comprara jaleas, colorantes, azúcar, vasos, cucharas y hielo, esta ayuda vendrá a superar este negocio y tener la oportunidad de recibir mayores ingresos para la sustencion de la familia; El deseo de él es conseguir con su trabajo la obtención de una refrigeradora para mantener en ella el hielo de las minutas, así como también ver a sus hijos desarrollados como profesionales con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Neri is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and his two children,  who are 14 and 10 years old. They live in the municipality of Chinameca, in the department of San Miguel. His business is selling "minutas" [snow cones] as a mobile vendor on the streets and at the city park and school. He learned this business only by observing how the others did it, and he has done this work for 10 years now. 

Neri would like to invest in his business, and for that reason he is requesting a loan to buy syrups, colorings, sugar, cups, spoons and ice. This support will help his business advance, and he will have the opportunity to earn a better income to support his family. His desire is to earn enough through his work to buy a refrigerator so that he can store the ice for his snow cones. He would also like to see his children pursue a professional career and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Buying syrup, sugar and ice to prepare "minutas" [snow cones]

loans.name: John Mutwii

texts.en:
John Mutwii, aged 32, is married to Catherine Syokau, aged 27, who is a farmer, and together they have one child aged one year. He lives at Tala and his carpentry business is in the same area.

John has been running his carpentry business for three years and his monthly profit is Kshs 20,000. John was introduced to KADET LTD by the officer in charge of Tala office.

During the time John has been in this business his customers are satisfied with the wooden things he makes for them.

After getting this loan he intends to buy quality boards, more timber and nails for his business.

If the loan boosts the business, John intends to have more carpentry businesses in and outside Tala so as to target more customers. John is a dedicated businessman.

loans.use: To buy more wood and nails for his workshop.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a widow with six children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport.

She operates a second-hand clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Regina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a shop in the future.              

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a bale of used clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good relations.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy products for a hardware store and a grocery store

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
K. Constance lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. 

Constance has a business selling soft  drinks. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Constance sells her products in a shop by means of retail.    

Constance has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of soda, mineral water, and passion fruits. She also generates additional income through her rentals.

The main business challenges for Constance include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to open up more drinking shops within Kamwokya.   

Constance lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy soda, mineral water, and passion fruits

loans.name: Dedevi Ahoefa

texts.fr: Elle est âgée de 32 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est mariée et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de bijoux. Elle compte dans cette activité 9 ans d’expérience. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra et au Benin à Cotonou et revient vendre au grand marché de Lomé. Elle demande un crédit pour répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
She is 32 years old and the mother of 2 children. She is married and sells jewelry in order to earn a living. She has 9 years of experience in this business. 

She stocks up at Accra in Ghana and at Cotonou in Benin and then sells at the big market in Lomé. 

She is requesting a loan to meet ever-increasing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food , school fees and rent.

She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past three years, selling in a shop to her neighbors’ and passersby.  Rehema faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators in her area of operation. She hopes to establish a motorbike transport business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stocks of vegetables, fruits, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of vegetables, fruits, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua D. cooks food for sale. She also sells food items like cassava at Elmina. Efua has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this business for 10 years. She assists her husband in the payment of the family's bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to re-invest back into the food business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction supplies to fix a leaking roof

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 56 years old and married. To make a living, Roberto owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Roberto is just starting this business.

Roberto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roberto has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Roberto is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tegal Badeng Indah Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. is a farmer and housewife. She has two children: one is married and one is still in school. Ni Ketut S. started a pig business in an effort to support her family. She keeps two pigs. Ni Ketut S. took out a 1,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) loan for the first time from MUK which will be used to buy two more pigs. Ni Ketut has plans to save the income from the sale of four pigs, because she has plans to renovate her home. She has a dream – a comfortable home to live in with the whole family.

loans.use: To buy two more pigs

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua M. M. is 28 years old and married. His wife runs their general store and they have 3 children, aged between 1 and 10 years old. Joshua owns a general store and a motorcycle transport business. He has been in these businesses for 3 years now. His business is located at a fast growing business center called Kinanie, but he is served by the Kitengela Branch.  He says that these businesses are profitable, but the major challenge he has is financial constraints. Joshua works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his businesses doing well. He is using his loan of 60,000 KES to increase stock in the general store to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to open another general store in the future. He also sees himself becoming a landlord some day. He describes himself as innovative.

loans.use: to increase stock in the general store

loans.name: July

texts.es: La señora July es comerciante y tiene un puesto de venta ubicado en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, donde vende todo tipo de productos y su esposo es chofer; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de peluches ya que la señora distribuye en mayor cantidad a otros comerciantes.  De esta manera, con estas actividades cubren los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona Ballivián en la ciudad de El Alto;  es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en: July is a retailer: she owns a small stall, located in the 16 de julio neighborhood of the town of El Alto, where she sells every kind of products. Her husband is a driver. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy stuffed animals, a product she is a wholesaler for and which she distributes to other retailers.
