Thanks to these activities, she is able to pay for her household expense. She lives in the house of her parents-in-laws, located in the Ballivián neighborhood of the town of El Altro. She is married and she has two children.

loans.use: To buy stuffed animals to distribute them to other retailers as well as to sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Nueva Union 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Bernarda is one of the members of a group called Nueva Union 3 & 4 (New Union), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush but rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She enjoys attending church and sharing with her group friends. She is very committed to improving her business and helping others joined in solidarity.

Bernarda is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and is excited for the opportunity to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothes by walking to and taking the clothing into different communities. She sells different models and styles. She will use the profits to invest in her home by purchasing food and repairing her house, she need to make some changes to it. She would also like to save to reinvest if someone orders a bigger quantity. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Criste

texts.en:
Criste D. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old. Criste is single and has one infant child. 

To make a living, Criste makes and sells amakan or bamboo mat products to local businesses and community members. Criste has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Criste joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Criste is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials like bamboo for amakan. This will be the first loan taken out by Criste from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like bamboo for amakan

loans.name: Reyna Ismaela

texts.es:
Reyna de 42 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Es viuda y tiene una hija que estudia en escuela fiscal. Trabaja en un restaurant de playas.

Empezó a trabaja como ayudante de cocina hace 6 años ya que su esposo falleció . Labora para el Sr. Ponce en un restaurante ubicado en pleno centro turístico de playas. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, hierro, ladrillo para adecuar su casa y así tener una vida plena y saludable con su hija.
texts.en:
Reyna is 42 years old and she lives in the community named "Playas". It is one of the tourist locales in Ecuador where there is a wide selection of seafood. She is a widow and she has a daughter who attends a community school. She works at a restaurant in Playas.

She started out as a kitchen assistant 6 years ago when her husband passed away. She works for Mr. Ponce at a restaurant located in the main tourist center in Playas. With the help of her loan she will purchase construction materials such as cement, steel, and bricks to remodel her home, to have a full and healthy life with her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, steel, and bricks.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De Las Lomas Group

texts.es: El señor Nelson tiene 43 años es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos que viven con el, es natural D. la selva del Peru pero desD. joven vino a vivir a Lima, al inicio el empezo a trabajar alquilando mototaxis pero luego cuando reunio una suma simbolica pudo comprar su mototaxi. Gracias a este trabajo el ha podido comprar su terreno para poder construir su casa. Su sueño es poder tener su propia empresa D. mototaxis.
texts.en: Nelson is 43 years old, married, and the father of two small children who live with him. He is from the Peruvian jungle but came to Lima to live when he was young. At first he started working driving a rented motorcycle taxi, but eventually he was able to save a symbolic amount and purchase a motorcycle taxi of his own. His work has enabled him to purchase a plot of land where he can build a house. His dream is to run his own motorcycle taxi business one day.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a young married woman with no children, Hana got married recently but her husband is a Palestinian National employee with a salary that didn't allow him to purchase all the home appliances. It's been a few months since they got married and they have paid back all the money Hana and her husband borrowed to have their wedding on time.

Hana took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a fridge and a washing machine, as she was using the ones of her mother-in-law who lives next to Hana and her husband.

Hana appears in the picture, above.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and a washing machine

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, de 37 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 40 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Elva abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida, ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos que le hacen falta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. En adelante espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para poder vender más productos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a ahorrar todos los días un poco, para poder pagar su crédito por completo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Elva, age 37, is a kind, hard-working woman who lives in her own home with her husband, Jose, age 40, and their four children. One of Elva's goals is to improve their quality of life.

Elva opens her grocery store early each morning for the convenience of her neighbours. She is a highly competent shopkeeper who knows how to serve her customers, and usually convinces them to buy a little something extra. Her shop is well-stocked, and she spends a lot of time tracking down things that are running low. 

Elva has been running her store for three years. Her favourite part of work is talking with customers and finding out what's going on in her neighbourhood. The hardest part is staying in her store all day; she can't go out into the street for any reason. Going forward, Elva wants to increase the shelving space in her store so that she can carry more products. 

This is her seventh loan with MFP. She plans to save a little bit each day so that she can completely pay off her loan. Her community bank considers her a very responsible woman, and she is always respectful of the agreements she makes with other bank members. With the 1800 Soles in this loan, she will buy more merchandise and improve her grocery store.

loans.use: buy more products to improve her grocery store.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta, 28 years old and married to a forester, is the mother of three children, two at school and the third, a small baby, at home with her. Miatta attained an 8th grade education.

For the past three years, Miatta has been milling and selling cassava flour, a business she established with small loans from friends. She encounters few problems in her business other than the large amounts of travel involved which can be difficult with a small child. Miatta enjoys the independence her income gives her. Now requesting a loan to buy in bulk and cut down on travel, she wants to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy cassava in bulk to reduce the need to travel.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie, 33, is married and has two children. One is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emie has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Emie requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Emie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: La Fuente De Bendicion 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Reina is one of our businesswomen. She works selling seafood in her community, which is a rural area surrounded by forests and mountains. Reina started her business around six years ago with her personal savings. She sells all kind of seafood, such as squid, fish, crabs, shrimp, and others. Reina lives near Bahia, in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural zone. She has two children who still live at home, and she lives with her long-term partner, who is their father. Reina’s most important challenge is to live according to God’s will. 

Reina is requesting her seventh loan from Esperanza International. Because her loan repayments have all been maD. punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the re-investment from each loan. She has had the opportunity to improve her life and family and expand her business to get more clients. Reina would like to save her profits to renovate her house and give her children a safer home. In the future, she wants to become a successful and professional businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy seafood

loans.name: Nabi

texts.ru: Наби проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 52 года. Женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Наби имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он по профессии проработал 15 лет. На сегодняшний день Наби занимается торговлей топлива. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива.
texts.en: Nabi lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 52 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Nabi has a higher, pedagogical education.  He spent fifteen years working in that field.  Today, Nabi is involved in sales of fuel.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fuel.

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: La señora Ingrid  y su esposo Emilio son clientes antiguos de emprender. La Sra. Ingrid se dedica a la venta de comida la zona de villa Copacabana y el Sr. Emilio es dueño de un pequeño taller de reparación de equipos electrónicos en la zona de bajo san Antonio. Durante todo el tiempo que trabajan con nuestra institución siempre demostraron ser puntuales y responsables con sus créditos, la Sra. Ingrid vende comida tradicional de Bolivia como ser fricase y chicharrón de cerdo, también milanesas de res y pollo y sajta de pollo,  solo atiende  su pensión el fin de semana, pero aún así tiene varios clientes que vienen a comer cada semana sin falta, el Sr. emilio tiene su taller en la casa de sus padres y debido a su experiencia y buen servicio siempre tiene varios clientes. En esta oportunidad ellos solicitan el préstamo de dinero para la compra de un juego de dormitorio para su departamento, y de esta manera tener comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ingrid  and her husband Emilio are longtime clients of Emprender. Ingrid sells food in the area of Villa Copacabana and Mr. Emilio is an owner of a small workshop where he repairs electronic equipment in the area of Bajo San Antonio. The whole time they have worked with our institution they have always shown themselves to be punctual and responsible with their loans. Ingrid sells Bolivian traditional food such as fricasee and pork chicharones, as well as beef Milanese and chicken Sajta. She only works in her restaurant on weekends, but even so, she has a lot of customers  who come to eat every weekend without fail. Emilio has his workshop in his parents' house and with his experience and good service, he always has a lot of customers. At this time, they are asking for the loan to buy a bedroom set for their apartment. In this way they will be comfortable and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a bedroom set.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 40 years old, married and supports a family made up of four people. For the last 18 years, he has earned a living running a retail shop where he earns a monthly income of KES 18,000. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after having successfully repaid his first one. He plans to use this loan to buy a water tank and start selling water at his retail shop. He also plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to build rental properties, and earn enough money from his various businesses to become a wholesaler and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy water tank and begin selling water from his store.

loans.name: Fanis

texts.en:
Fanis is 57 years old and is a widower with two children. Fanis has a retail shop that she has been running for many years.  

Fanis has a very good history with KADET LTD, she is applying for her sixth loan from KADET LTD, which she intends to buy more stock to the shop like sugar, soft drinks, sweets, salt for sale.  

She hopes to expand her business and to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: buy  more stock like sugar, soft drinks, sweets, and salt for sale

loans.name: Gnet

texts.en:
Gnet, 34 years old, is a Khmer noodle seller. She explains that she typically earns $6 per day. Her husband is a soldier, and he typically earns $1.50 per day. They have two children, both of whom are in school. Every month she spends approximately $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $17 on other expenses.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a machine to make Khmer noodles for re-sale purposes. This loan would enable her make more Khmer noodles to sell to her customers. She plans to expand her business so that she can have additional customers.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to make Khmer noodles.

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.es: Godofredo, de 49 años, esta casado con Mardonia de 40 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Desde joven se dedicó a la actividad agrícola, ayudando a sus padres en tiempos de cosecha, pero no tenía la certeza que actividad continuar por lo que apostó por lo que había aprendido durante todo este tiempo. Actualmente se siente feliz con el trabajo que realiza, ya que le va muy bien con las ganancias que percibe. En tiempos de cultivo y de cosecha son las épocas en el que necesita de trabajadores para que agilicen de manera rápida y oportuna, tanto en la siembra como en la extracción de sus productos. Su producto final lo vende en los Centros de Acopio de Pichari a un precio razonable. Ahora tiene como plan comprar terrenos para que siga ampliando la siembra de café, y con las ganancias podrá dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.500 soles, lo invertirá en contratar jornaleros para que lo ayuden a podar su cafetales.
texts.en:
Godofredo is 49 years old and married to Mardonia, age 40.  They have four children and live together in their own home in the District of Pichari.  Since he was a young man, Godofredo has engaged in farming by helping his parents during the harvest season.  He was not sure whether he wanted to continue in this line of work, but he chose to continue learning throughout the entire time.  Godofredo is very pleased with the work he has accomplished and has done very well with the earnings he has generated.  The planting and harvesting seasons are the times when he needs workers who can perform the tasks quickly and timely such as sowing seeds and picking fruit.  Now he wants to buy land so that he can continue to expand his coffee crop.  The income that he will earn will provide a better quality of life for his family.

This will be his fourth loan with MFP.  Godofredo promises to be punctual with his loan payments.  This loan of 2500 PEN will be invested in the hiring of workers to help with pruning his coffee crops.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Sron

texts.en:
Mrs. Sron, a 47-year-old married mother of a single child, is in the business of doing laundry, earning around $2.00 per day. Her house, which she in in the process of rebuilding, is located in Ornlong Veng District of Siem Reap Province.

Having used all of her saved money to purchase the needed materials for her home, Sron is now requesting a loan from Kiva of $800 to hire people to perform the actual construction. She hopes that this will result in a comfortable house in which to live.

loans.use: to hire people to construct her house.

loans.name: Rose Akinyi

texts.en: Rose Akinyi is a 38-year-old married woman. She has four children whose ages range from 4 to 5 years old. She describes herself as obedient and God-fearing. She operates a salon where she provides services like blow drying, plaiting and general hair makeup. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre in Nakuru town. Her primary customers are frequent and [she has] new customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased price of the hair products. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more hair care products. Her business goal is to open more salons in the same area within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy hair care products like shampoo and hair oil.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 57-year-old married woman with seven children who are all grown up. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Ruth has operated a grocery store for the past six years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase more stocks of potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access fund to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Wiljohn

texts.en:
Wiljohn was only 22 years old when he started to live on his own. He is married to Kathleen and now blessed with a child. To sustain his family's needs, Wiljohn grows corn to sell, planting and harvesting it from his one-hectare cornfield. He usually earns about PHP 20,000 per harvest, usually during the months of March and October.

Wiljohn currently has insufficient funds to buy corn seeds and fertilizers to use in farming; therefore, he decided to take out a loan of PHP 10,000. He promises to repay this loan on time. He believes that it will surely improve his crop production, his business and their lives as well.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is a 48 year old, energetic lady and part of beautiful family, a husband and two sons. Unfortunately she couldn’t help her children in completing their education. They left their education after the 5th standard and started working with their father. 

Kosar, herself, is a seamstress. She owns & operates a sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. Besides her sewing works, she also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. Her husband is a milk man by profession. He also has some buffaloes. He takes care of them and gets their milk everyday and sells the milk to his community clients for profit.
 
Kosar is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying another buffalo that will allow him to increase the milk productivity and its profits. 

Kosar is very confident that, after investing the loan, her husband’s business will be further improved.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
Alda is from Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Alda is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Alda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, planting and harvesting corn to sell. Alda has been in her business for seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2005, Alda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 47 years old and has seven children. She is married and has six children who are in school.

Marcelina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marcelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Abdukahhor

texts.ru: Абдукаххор женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Он начал свой бизнес 12 лет назад с выращивания винограда, а теперь добавил еще выращивание помидоров и огурцов. Имеет землю в своей деревне. Абдукаххор запрашивает займ для покупки семян огурцов и помидоров, селитру и аммофос. А на остальную сумму хочет купить пленку для парника. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Abdukahhor is married and is raising three children.  He started his business 12 years ago with growing grapes and now also added growing tomatoes and cucumbers.  He has land in his village.  Abdukahhor is requesting this loan to purchase cucumber and tomato seeds, and mineral fertilizers.  And he wants to use the rest of the money to buy plastic for a greenhouse.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cucumber and tomato seeds

loans.name: Suhad

texts.en:
Suhad is 33 years old. She lives in Tulkarem. She lives there with her husband and her child. She sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many others in her grocery store. Suhad opened it four years ago. She is requesting this loan to paint her market and buy stock to sell, so she can increase her stock. All the neighbors prefer to buy from her because of her good treatment.

Suhad is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve success in her business with this loan. The one appearing in the photo is her husband. For cultural reasons she can’t publish her photos online, so she apologies.

loans.use: to paint her market and buy stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Ms. Abla A., 37, is a woman with little education who has one child. She is her husband's second wife and is a trained hairdresser with a beauty salon. She lives in a place where the lack of clean water is sharply felt, so she built a well and started collecting water reserves. This, however, was not enough, as everyone in the village is still badly in need of water. This is why she has decided to turn the well into a water drilling system. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $1200. She will pay it back by selling water to the people in the village, which will earn her enough income to improve her economic condition.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Deuxième femme de son mari, Madame A. Abla, âgée de 37 ans, est une femme d’un niveau d’étude moyen avec un enfant. Coiffeuse de formation avec un atelier à son actif, elle vit dans un milieu où le problème d’eau se pose avec acuité. Elle s’est fait un puits et des retenus d’eau. Mais cela reste insuffisant car toute la population en manque terriblement. C’est pourquoi elle a décidé de transformer le puit en un système de forage. Pour y arriver elle sollicite un financement de $1200. Son remboursement se fera par la vente d’eau à la population, une vente qui va générer des revenus susceptibles d’améliorer la situation économique de la dame.

loans.use: Water drilling

loans.name: María Justina

texts.en:
Maria Justina is 49 years old, married and mother of three children of 13, 19 and 23 years of age. Her husband Jose works for the City Council of Mérida, where they were both born. Due to the need to help her husband with the their children's education, Maria began making clothes to relatives and friends. As she expanded her business, she began to buy and sell clothes also. Fortunately her business propered and continues to grow. Responsibility and hard work are characteristics that define Maria.

At the moment she needs a $700 loan to purchase clothes and offer her clients a greater variety and to maintain their preference. In your hands is the power to help this family improve their lives. Maria and her family thank for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Virgilio Russi, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra. Maria Justina tiene 49 años, es casada y madre de tres hijos de 13, 19 y 23 años de edad, su esposo José es empleado de el H. Ayuntamiento de Mérida, de donde ambos son originarios. Por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los estudios de sus hijos, María empezó confeccionando ropa a sus familiares y conocidos y fue ampliando su negocio, ahora compra y venta de ropa nueva también, afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien y quiere que su negocio continúe creciendo.

Responsabilidad y trabajo son características que definen a María, en estos momentos ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 700 dólares que empleará en la compra de ropa, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y conservar su preferencia. En tus manos está el poder ayudar a esta familia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, decídete a apoyar a María, ella y su familia agradecen tu generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 33 years old and marries. She makes decorative blouses, pants and skirts that she later embroiders and sells in the city market. With the loan, she hopes to purchase more cloth, a sewing machine to make her garments, and also thread for her embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARGARITA , TIENE 33 AÑOS , CASADA, TRABAJA COMO ARTESANA CONFECCIONANDO BLUSAS, PANTALONES Y FALDAS LAS QUE POSTERIORMENTE BORDA Y VENDE EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD . PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 2.CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS TELA , UNA MEJOR MAQUINA DE COSER PARA HACER SUS PPRENDAS Y TAMBIEN HILOS PARA SUS BORDADOS.

loans.use: Purchase more cloth, a sewing machine to make her decorative garments, and also thread for her embroideries

loans.name: Srak

texts.en: Mrs Srak N. is 35 years old and is a widow with one child. She lives in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has worked very hard to supplement her household since her husband passed a way many years ago. Mrs Srak N. works selling grocery products to the people in her community, earning around $2.50 each day in revenue. This loan will be used to expand her inventory by increasing the number of her grocery products in order to satisfy her clients’ needs. In the future, she hopes to save enough money  to expand her business and to construct a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her grocery store in order to satisfy her clients’ needs.

loans.name: Ma

texts.en: Mrs. Ma C., age 37, sells various sculptures that her husband makes, earning about $3 per day in profit. Her husband makes about $4 per day by selling the sculptures to a wholesaler, as well as through his wife's sales. They have four children, two of whom are students and two of whom have moved away from home. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase additional raw materials for her husband to use in making sculptures. Purchasing in bulk will lower costs and increasing the inventory of sculptures they sell will raise revenue. They plan to use the increased income to reinvest in the growth of their business and pay for their children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make sculptures.

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en: Uguloy is married and has 4 children who help her with her business. She has been engaged in business for over 8 years and has good experience in business. Her business is located at a big market in Spitamen, a district of Khujand, Tajikistan. She became a client of MLF Microinvest in 2003 and her first loan was for 300 somoni. During her time working in the market, she has attracted many clients and learned much about their tastes.  She always tries to meet their needs and quickly innovate her assortment according to their needs. Now she wants to include in her assortment confectionery products as she knows that the demand for this kind of product during holiday trade days will be greater than during other times of the year and she wants to earn a big profit from it.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Maria   Ofelia

texts.es:
Mrs. Correa P. has worked selling tortillas for twelve years.

She started in this activity since she was a very young girl, because her mother taught her this business as a way to support her family.

To date, the financial loans she has requested from CEPRODEL have helped her buying raw materials with cash, which allows her to offer a better product to her customers.

With this business she helps support her family. her greatest hope is that her children achieve a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. C. P. se dedica a la actividad de venta de tortillas desde hace doce años.

Iniciándose en esta actividad desde muy niña ya que su señora Madre le enseña este negocio como una alternativa de sustento familiar.

Actualmente con los aportes financieros que solicita en CEPRODEL le han ayudado en la compra de materia prima al contado lo que permite ofrecer un mejor producto a su clientes.

Con este negocio se ayuda en el sustento de su familia y su mayor esperanza en que sus hijos mejoren su calidad de vida.<

loans.use: Buying materials for her business (Compra  de materiales para su negocio)

loans.name: Kawala A 2021(Iii) Group

texts.en: Nalongo is 42 years old and married with four children. Nalongo, Sylvia, and Mary all make and sell sponges for a living. Nalongo  intends to use the extra business profits to buy a piece of land and build a house. Lukia and Lena both have retail shop businesses and want to increase their stock with the loan.

loans.use: To expand the sponge-making business.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
The live of an artesan is one reserved mostly to creative people like Rolando, who has been making admirable and fascinating products for 38 years. With his family's help the work is more pleasant and agreeable. Thanks to his significant other he can overcome the sadness of being far from his relatives her are in Pucallpa. Rolando moved to central jungle because of his love for his wife and now his love for his 4 children. Rolando has been a good father and husband, being tireless in his work that fills his days because he works hard for his family. He hopes to increase his income and for this reason is seeking your help in order to improve the quality and increase the quantity that he offers daily.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El ser artesano es una actividad ligada básicamente a personas creativas como Rolando quien hace 38 años se dedica a la elaboración de sus admirables y fascinantes artículos y junto a su familia el trabajo es más placentero y agradable; .gracias a su pareja Rolando pudo superar la pena de estar lejos de sus familiares los cuales se encuentran en Pucallpa y el motivo por el cual Rolando se vino a radicar a la selva central fue por el gran amor de su esposa y ahora por el amor a sus 4 hijos.Rolando ha sabido ser buen padre y esposo, incansable frente a las labores que le llenan el día, siendo su familia por quienes se esfuerza. Su deseo es mejorar su ingreso y por esa razón recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda a fin de mejorar la calidad y cantidad de los productos que ofrece a diario.

loans.use: Increase capital to improve the quality and increase the quantity of her products

loans.name: Yom

texts.en: Mrs. Yom V. was born in 1956 and now lives in Prek Rung Village in Kandal Province. She is a fish seller in a market next to the village, usually earning around $2 a day, and a single mother with two children, one of whom works in a factory while the other helps her at the market. In order to improve her living conditions, Yom is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish to resell at the market.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Ven S., age 55, is a true entrepreneur and lives with her husband Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. They have four children, three of whom are students and live away from home, while one is employed as a construction worker in the province with a salary of $50 a month. Mrs. Ven S. is a farmer, and she makes on average less than one dollar per day. Her husband, Pen Ros, works as a construction worker building houses, and earns around $1.60 of profit per day.

She faces problems with the water supply, and as a result her crop is not productive. Sometimes her output cannot support the family for the whole year and she has to purchase rice from the miller to feed the family. Because of the difficulties, she would like to receive a loan from Kiva to create another business selling groceries. This will provide her with an extra income to support the family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries.

loans.name: Mahmadullo

texts.en:
T. Mahmadullo is 22 years old. Mahmadullo sells the fabrics that people use to sew tradtional Tajik national dresses. He has been in this business for 3 years. The national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and beautiful. Tajikistan is located in the Central Asia and the spring is the most beautiful season in this region. When you see all these national dresses, it feels like you are admiring the scenery when awaking from a cold winter, the festival of green leaves and grasses, of bright red and yellow tulips in the mountains, and a blue sky which is so close to you in spring.

At the same time, the national dress is one of the most important items in a girl's dowry. Mahmadullo has very good taste, and he is well equipped to advise his clients about which textiles to choose for this or that occasion. That is why he has his customers. Moreover, Mahmadullo’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population, because he has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet.

The income that he derives allows him to provide for his personal needs, as well as for the family's needs, since Mahmadullo lives with his parents.

Now Mahmadullo needs 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) to buy new fabrics. Mahmadullo promises to repay the loan in 7 months and expresses his gratitude to everyone that is supporting him.

loans.use: To buy new fabrics in order to increase the variety of his goods for sale

loans.name: Marilis

texts.es:
Sra. Marilis is 23 years old, married to Sr. Alfredo Bonilla, and they have two children. Marilis is the owner of stall in the local market from which she sells clothing, footwear, and household items. She has been in this line of work for the last seven years.

She plans to use the loan to buy winter jackets which she can obtain for a good price—it is now the best time of year to sell this product.

Marilis told us that over time she wants to expand the business and offer other types of merchandise since there is a lot of commercial activity taking place in the market.

She wishes to see our country improve and to see more investment in public health, education, and safety.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marilis tiene 23 años de edad y está casado con el Señor Alfredo Bonilla, la pareja tienen 2 hijos. La cliente es propietaria de una casilla en el mercado municipal donde vende prendas de vestir, calzados, y artículos de mercería, con una antigüedad de 7 años en el ramo.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de camperas que le ofertaron a buen precio, ya que es la temporada de mayor venta de dicho producto.

Nos manifestó que con el tiempo quiere aumentar el negocio y traer otro tipo de artículos ya que en el mercado hay muy buen movimiento comercial.

Desea que nuestro país se mejore, que haya mas inversión en la salud publica, la educación y la seguridad.

loans.use: To purchase winter jackets.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is single and has been working out of her home making bread for the past 5 years with the help of her younger brother.

Cristina goes to school in the evenings since she does not have time to do so during the day because she has to work hard to obtain the sustenance for her family. The father of her child is not with her and does not support her.

Her parents are still living but she has to take care of them because they are of an advanced age. Cristina is a very dynamic person who wants to succeed to be able to provide the basic necessities to her parents.

The loan she is asking for is to purchase materials to make her bread which she will then sell in search income for her, her children and parents.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Cristina es soltera, trabaja en su casa en la fabricación de panificados desde hace 5 años, cuenta para esto con el apoyo de su hermano menor.

La Sra. Cristina estudia de noche, ya que de día no le queda tiempo, pues debe trabajar intensamente para conseguir el sustento de su familia teniendo en cuenta que el padre de su hijo no esta con ella y tampoco le apoya.

Sus padres están con vida, pero como son de edad muy avanzada ella tiene que cuidar de ellos. Cristina es una persona muy dinámica que desea salir adelante, para brindarles a sus padres las comodidades básicas indispensables.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus panificados que posteriormente serán comercializados en busca de una renta digna para ella, sus hijos y padres.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour and milk

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en: R. Robiya is 48 years old. She is a single mother and the head of the family. She is raising her two children by herself. For the past five years, Robiya has been engaged in many income-generating activities, particularly, a children's toy sales business, and has been able to pay for her children's food and studies with the business profits. Before starting the sales business, Robiya was running a store at her house. This allowed her to take care of her children, while they assisted her with the clients. Robiya started her children's toy sales business with US $600 from her savings, with additional financial help from her older children. Currently, Robiya still needs additional capital to invest in her business to be able to increase the volume and variety of merchandise. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US $800 for a term of 12 months, which she will use to purchase additional children's toys for sale. Robiya thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be responsible with the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchase of children's toys for sale

loans.name: Nailya

texts.en: Nailya was born in 1956 and is a widow with two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Fuzuli town and has settled in Baku city. Nailya has been in a consulting business for four years and now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a computer for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros B., born in 1963, lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province where she owns a small restaurant selling food to villagers and visitors. Her husband, Mr. Suos Muny, is a construction worker who makes a small income that helps support his family. Since his workplace is far from home, he also spends a great deal on transportation. In order to reduce these expenses, Ros is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

Ros has six children, four of whom are blacksmiths while the remaining two are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is married and has 5 children. She has received no formal education. Ama sells firewood which is a source of fuel for the majority of fishmongers. She also prepares a local meal called 'banku' for sale. Maize is used in the preparation of the banku which is widely eaten in the country. She sells the banku at Kissi near Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a chain saw operator. Ama uses her income to support her husband in meeting the family’s financial needs. Ama will use the loan to purchase more firewood to meet the increase in demand. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase more firewood to meet the increase in demand.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement E. is a photographer and he also prints. He is 38 years old and married with a child. He needs the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase films, camera, and printing papers. He says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more films, camera and printing paper

loans.name: Rose Mary Mabel

texts.es:
La señora Rose Mary Mabel P. G. tiene 39 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Victor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 4to de secundaria, tiene 04 hijos de los cuales 02 dependen económicamente de ella.
Rose Mary inicio su negocio vendiendo ropa interior y ganchitos, con las ganancias obtenidas ha logrado formar un capital que le ha permitido incrementar su negocio, ahora vende todo tipo de ropa. Negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de ropa para niños.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para campaña escolar.
Rose Mary sueña con tener una tienda de ropa en su casa
texts.en:
Rose Mary Mabel P. G. is 39 years old and lives in Buenos Aires, located in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She studied to the 4th year of secondary school and has four children, two of whom still depend on her financially. Rose Mary started her business selling undergarments and hangers. With the income she has earned, she has managed to have some capital that allowed her to grow her business. She now sells all types of clothing. She runs her business out of her home. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Palmeras”, she invested in the purchase of children’s clothing. With the loan of 800.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six months, she will invest in clothing for the school season. Rosa Mary dreams of having her own clothing store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing for the school season.

loans.name: Fazira's Group

texts.en: Fazira N. is the chairperson of the Twesige loan group in Kayunga. She is married and has five children who attend school.  Additionally, she also cares for two relatives, one of whom is an orphan. Fazira used to own a small retail shop.  Now she is a poultry farmer and also sells milk from her three cows. These businesses have been allowed her to provide for her family well.  She has raised a new brood of chicks.  A loan will help her resettle and feed them.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her new chicks

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: S. is 31 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh. She has seven children; one is married and lives separately, three are single and help out with her business, and the other three are students. S. is married to Sokun, 43, who is a fisherman. S. is a morning glory planter, and has been in this business since 1995. She has gained a lot of reliable clients who always buy her products in bulk, and she has earned a good income from that. S. has a lot of lines in the water for the morning glories, and now she wants to increase her income. So, S. is asking for a loan of $150 to rent her neighbor's space for planting her morning glories. S. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To rent her neighbor's space for planting her morning glories

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en: Sarantsetseg N., 41, is the proud mother of 21-year-old and 18-year-old daughters. She lives with her husband and children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 1999, with her husband, she began to rent a small candy stall in Narantuul market, the largest open-air market in Ulaanbaatar. When she started the candy business, she had only 250,000 MNT in capital ($1=1,600 MNT). Today, thanks to the steady growth of her business, she has diversified her products. She now sells candies, fruits and vegetables and her capital has increased to 1,300,000 MNT. Her husband also has begun to run a small retail shop for various consumer products. She requests a loan to expand her business and diversify it with more products. Sarantsetseg is a well-experienced and responsible person. She hopes to be able to invest in her children’s education soon and to one day have her own supermarket with diverse food products.

loans.use: To buy more candies, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y vive junto a su esposo. Se dedica a la venta de periódicos ambulatoriamente, éstos los lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su localidad. En esta labor lleva un periodo de 10 años y su esposo la apoya mucho, cada vez que tiene momentos libres para hacerlo. Lo que a Rita le gusta de su trabajo es que se relaciona con muchas personas, con quienes ya tiene mucha confianza y se convierten en sus fieles clientes, por lo que su actividad se convierte en un negocio rentable, además que los periódicos es una mercadería que se vende por sí sola. Posteriormente, Rita quiere tener un kiosco estable y trabajar más descansada, sin tener que caminar por las calles bajo el ardiente sol o la torrencial lluvia de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Con MFP, ya tiene 6 préstamos, y lo que más le gusta de ser parte de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son unidos y actúan sin egoísmos. El dinero que en esta ocasión solicita es para comprar una moto, para entregar los periódicos con mayor facilidad, para esto gastará 2000 soles. Con los 500 restantes adquirirá mayor cantidad de más periódicos.
texts.en:
Rita is 37, has 3 children, and lives with her husband. She sells newspapers on foot. She takes them to sell in different places in her town. She has been doing this for 10 years, and her husband helps her a lot whenever he has the free time to do so. What Rita likes about her work is that she meets lots of people. These people have confidence in her and have become her loyal customers. This, and the fact that she works for herself, have made her business profitable. Later, Rita would like to have a stable kiosk. Then she would be more rested when she works and not have to walk the streets under the burning sun or the torrential rain in the city of Pucpallpa. She has had 6 loans with MFP. The thing she likes the best about being part of her community bank is that all of the members are so united and unselfish. The loan is to buy a motorcycle in order to deliver the newspapers more easily. This would cost 2000 PEN. With the remaining 500 PEN she would get more newspapers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of five. Currently all her children are in are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood. She has been selling foodstuffs like plantains, maize, kobe (salt fish), fresh tomatoes, and many more at Takroase for three years now to support her family. Her husband is a cocoa farmer.

She treks to farming communities in and around her village to buy her stock of plantains, yams, salt fish (kobe), maize etc. in bulk from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy plantains, yams, tomatoes, kobe, etc. to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. This would enable her save more to support her husband in taking care of the home. Esther belongs to a village bank called ‘Wonderful Jesus.’

loans.use: Fruits, vegetables, and fish for resale

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a trained nurse who worked for the government for some years before retiring to set up her own medicine store.

Rachael is 43 years old and married with three children. She is an active LAPO client. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N140,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says, "Thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
"I have experienced both good and bad harvest on our farm. My husband and I have been renting the farm for nine years already. Currently, we are in the process of preparing the farm for our next planting. We hope to have an abundant harvest to be able to provide for all our needs. We dream that someday we could buy our own farm and be able to send our children to school,” says Digna.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase certified seeds and fertilizers. She is also interested to venture into other lines of business.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just financial services but also training and insurance coverage

loans.use: To purchase certified seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Obus

texts.en: Obus A. plaits hair and she also sells hair extensions. She is married with 6 children and she is 48 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. Obus says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Mahmadsharif

texts.ru: Мирзоев Махмадшариф проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Махмадшариф имеет магазин, где торгует продуктами питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 7 лет. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mahmadsharif M. lives in the J. Rumy region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has 2 children. Mahmadsharif has a store where he sells food products. He has been in this business for more than 7 years. The client is asking for a loan in order to increase his turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious O. is 23 years old and she is single without a child. She is a tailor and she also sells tailoring materials. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Noroy

texts.en: R. Noroy has been selling a big variety of foodstuffs in her grocery store for the past twenty years. She is married and has six children. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Industrious and enterprising, Noroy is focused on expanding her business. Noroy is currently seeking a loan of 11,000 Somoni. She plans to use the loan to increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and to expand her business. With the increased sales and profits, Noroy hopes to expand her grocery and improve the living standard of her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and to expand her business

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia Andrea, es natural de la ciudad de Puno, ella vive actualmente en el Jr. Palacio s/n perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba en la ciudad e Cusco.

La socia es madre soltera, y tiene  2 hijos, ella tiene 44 años de edad y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, ella tienen una panadería y elabora diferentes pasteles, panes y asados, estos son las cocciones de diferentes carnes al horno a base de leña, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su negocio y obtener mayor productividad.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas

loans.use: implementar la panadería.

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en: Afaf is a 36 year-old married woman living with her husband and 3 young children. She opened her own beauty shop in 2001 where she sells make-up and beauty products to the neighboring villages. Today, Afaf is requesting to borrow $1,200 to expand her business and purchase merchandise.

loans.use: To expand her business and purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda P., 52 years old, has been repacking spices in her home for more than a decade now. She lives in Maricaban, Pasay City. Her husband Roberto, 55, is a carpenter. They have three children; one is now working his way towards overseas employment. Hilda repacks spices like black pepper, dried laurel leaves, and garlic in small plastic bags and distributes them to store owners for retail. She also repacks stuff like dye, chlorine powder, and sodium crystals. She earns 3,000 PHP a month. She has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2001. She is now on her 9th loan cycle. Hilda applied for a new loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP to buy raw materials for her business. Hilda's dream is for her children to finish their college education. About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missions in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To puchase raw materials for her repacking business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. sells maize and gari (roasted cassava). She buys them in sacks and sells in smaller quantities at Elmina near Ayensudo. She has been selling maize and gari since 2003.

Ama is divorced and has two children. She is responsible for the paying of bills and school fees. She has no educational background.

Ama’s loan will be used to buy more sacks of gari and maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of gari and maize to sell

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Esfuerzo está integrada por tres mujeres decididas, trabajadoras y que con mucho esfuerzo han construido sus negocios. María Eugenia Cuaresma Gutiérrez es la coordinadora del grupo y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos por encargo con los cuales se ayuda para salir adelante.

Teresa de Jesús R. de 42 años desde 1999  vende cosméticos y prendas de oro, plata y fantasía con sus ganancias ha conseguido brindarles bienestar y una buena educación a sus dos hijos que son su mayor fuerza de trabajo. 

Kenia del Socorro B. Silvia desde los 16 años vende cosméticos por catalogo con los cuales ayudado para continuar sus estudios y poder subsistir.
texts.en:
The group "El Esfuerzo" is comprised of three determined, hardworking women who, with much effort, have built their businesses. María Eugenia Cuaresma Gutiérrez is the coordinator of the group, and has a small business selling clothes and cosmetics on order, which has helped her to get ahead. Teresa de Jesús R. is 42 years old, and since 1999 has sold cosmetics and gold, silver and costume jewelry. With her earnings she has been able to provide her two children, who are her main workforce, with a comfortable life and a good education. Kenia del Socorro B. Silvia has sold cosmetics through catalogs for 16 years, this has helped her to continue her studies and enabled her to provide for her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise: clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha Kibayasi S. is a Tanzanian businesswoman who is married and has five children. She runs a charcoal business at Yombo Buza in Dar es Salaam and has been in the business for four years. She purchases her business goods directly from the wholesale suppliers and then sells them to her customers.

Asha is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Esperanza C. de 65 años tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en una pulpería y destace de cerdo de donde produce alimentos del cerdo como es el nacatamal, el frito, la moronga y el chicharro entre otros.	
Esta es una actividad común en la familia nicaragüense y una alternativa económica para ayudar a generar ingresos a la familia. Además tiene gran de manda en el país en especial los fines de semana para el desayuno, el almuerzo o la cena.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria Esperanza C. is 65 years old and has a small business that consists of a grocery store and a food stand where she prepares pork dishes such as nacatamales, fried pork, blood sausage, and chicharrones among other items.

Cooking is a common activity in Nicaraguan families and provides a financial alternative for generating household income. Sra. Gloria has earned a fine reputation throughout most of the country, especially for the breakfasts, lunches, and dinners she serves on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pork

loans.name: Merlanie

texts.en:
A 51 year old mother who strives very hard to help improve the living condition of her family, engaging in a different kind of business where she can get an income for a living. Merlanie L. lives in the village of Hda. Bubog, Brgy. Bubog, Talisay City, Negros Occidental. She is married to Pedro who works as a fisherman and sometimes helps his wife with her business. The couple is blessed with 4 children ages 13 to 34 years old. Some of their children help them with their business.

In the beginning, Pedro's income was just enough when the children were still small. But as time goes by she noticed that their household expenses were gradually increasing specially for the food and education of their children. She then helped her husband fish and peddle it in her community. But she wanted to put up her own business as an additional income for their family. 

In 2004, Merlanie's friend encouraged her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon as a group member so she can get a loan for the General Store. Upon joining, the business brought additional income to the family and helped with the education of their children. As her business continued, she was able to expand it because of her successive loans. As her loans continued, she was able to help her husband in putting another source of income catching crabs, and bale to buy fish net for fishing. From this business she was able to earn Php 8,000 per month. She saves most of her income for her children and for her family.

Her previous loan of Php 9,500 for her general store business was fully paid and she was able to access a bigger loan with the next cycle. At present, her 9th cycle loan in the amount of Php 12,000 will be used for the repair of her fishing boat, buy other fishing equipments and for her general store.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital and repair of fishing boat

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda C., 57, manages her own sewing shop. Married to Carito C., a security guard, they are blessed with four children. She earns money so their family can have a better life.  Her shop has been making and selling clothes for ten years.  She employs four people.

Rosalinda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than three years now.  She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow nine times from CCT.  She earns a net income of PHP 11,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan to expand her business by buying fabric and other materials needed for make clothes.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow so she can help her four sewers support their own families. 
------------------------------
All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.name: Cañaverales Group

texts.es:
El banco  comunal "Cañaverales" esta representado por la señora Lilia y conformado por 12 miembros que van cursando su primer ciclo con la institución, ellas se conocieron antas como grupo ya que hace dos años participaron en un grupo anterior.;  hay una confianza notoria entre ellas y son alegres y divertidas las señoras tienen muchas expectativas para el futuro. 

Lilia que es la presidenta del grupo se dedica a la venta de chocolate tiene una experiencia de 7 años en este rubro, Julia esta en el rubro de comercialización de empanadas desde hace 1 año atrás, Flavia se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 1 año atrás, Angélica Faviola se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 1 años atrás, Eloisa es promotora de Cosméticos desde hace 1 años atrás, Laura se dedica a la venta de gelatinas desde hace 3 años atrás, Ana Liz vende pollo y tiene una experiencia en el rubro de 5 años, Maria Luisa vende empanadas recién desde hace 1 año, Hebelia se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 1 año atrás, Marioly vende ropa también recién desde hace un año, Ruben Dario es eléctrico automotriz desde hace 1 años atrás, Raul ofrece servicios de amplificación desde hace  1 año atrás. Como se puede ver básicamente la mayoría del grupo recién desarrolla sus actividades. Todas se dedican muy conscientemente a sus negocios y saben lo importante que es  tratar bien a los clientes para que vuelvan, es la forma de combatir a la competencia que siempre esta presente. 

El destino del financiamiento es el incremento de sus capital de trabajo para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas de trabajo que ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos ya que una mayoría de las socias son madres de familia y desean darles una educación profesional a sus  hijos para que tengan una mejor futuro y mas expectativas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Cañaverales Communal Bank is represented by Lilia and comprised of 12 members. They are in their first cycle with the institution. They have already known each other as a group because two years ago they participated in a previous group. The trust they have in each other is evident. They are happy and fun women who have a lot of expectations for the future. Lilia is the group president and has 7 years of experience selling chocolate, Julia has been selling empanadas (meat/cheese pastries) for the past year, Flavia has been selling clothing for the past year, Eloisa has been selling cosmetics for the past year, Laura has been selling gelatin desserts for the past 3 years, Ana Liz sells chicken and has 5 years of experience, Maria Luisa began selling empanadas a year ago, Hebelia has been selling meals for a year, Marioly has been selling clothing for the past year, Ruben Dario has been working as an automotive electrician for the past year, Raul has been offering a sound system service for the past year. As you can see, most of the group members' businesses are relatively new. All of them conscientiously devote themselves to their businesses. They know how important it is to treat the customers well so that they return. It is a way of combating the competition that is always present. The loan is to increase their work capital to buy merchandise, supplies, and work tools that will help them improve their earnings. Most of the members are mothers who want to give their children an education to become professionals. They want their children to have a better future and more prospects for a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
The photo shows Mr. Kong K., 43 years old, who is a professional Khmer musician, a skill he learned from his grandparents, who died of senility years ago. He is always hired by people to play music for their wedding parties. In addition, his wife buys fish from her wholesale supplier and retails it for a profit. The couple now has four single and two married children, three of whom are industry employees in Phnom Penh.

Kong K. has been facing the fact that he doesn’t have adequate water to use. To solve this problem, he decided to request a loan to hire a laborer to dig a well for his family use. With the rest of the loan he will decorate his old house that frequently needs repair.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to dig a well

loans.name: Mussa

texts.en:
Mussa A. Bilal is an entrepreneurial Tanzanian businessman. He runs a business making and selling furniture at Sabasaba in Dar es Salaam. He purchases his business materials from the wholesale centers at Buguruni and Temeke.

Mussa is a carpenter. He has been in his business for three years and has managed to capitalize his business by buying a power saw power and sanding machines. He also meets his daily family needs from his business income.

Mussa is requesting a loan of TZS 1,200,000 to capitalize his business.

loans.use: To buy more business materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dry goods such as rice and body lotions.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, D. las cuales viven con tres D. ellos, en su casa propia. Anteriormente vendía frutas en el mercado D. su distrito, pero lo tuvo que dejar, debido a que no lograba vender toda su mercadería. DesD. entonces trabaja haciendo limpieza en casas ajenas, tres veces por semana y el resto D. días que le queda, trabaja con su esposo, ayudándole en la carpintería, lijando la madera, además D. cocinar para su familia. Está contenta con lo hace y no le es nada tedioso ya que adquirió mucha habilidad  en sus manos, por  lo que lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad. Lo que más anhela es techar su casa, y D. ese modo  pueda  ampliar el taller D. carpintería, para la fabricación D. puertas grandes, que suele hacer. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas, con tal D. seguir contando con nuevos créditos mas adelante. Con el crédito obtenido, desea comprar herramientas  D. carpintería, además D. algunas bolsas D. cemento para terminar D. techar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50, married, and has four children. She lives with three of her children in her own house. She previously sold fruit in the market in her district. But, she had to leave that business because she did not sell all of her merchandise. Since then she has been working cleaning other people’s houses three times a week. The rest of the days she works with her husband. She helps him by sanding wood for his carpentry work. She also cooks for the family. She is happy with what she does. It is not tedious for her, and she has gained much ability with her hands. She has been doing this activity for five years. What she yearns for the most is to put a roof on her house. That way she will be able to expand the carpentry shop in order to make large doors. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make all of her payments. She wants to continue to get new loans later on. She will use the loan to buy carpentry tools. She will also buy bags of cement to finish the roof on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy carpentry tools and sacks of cement to finish the roof on her house

loans.name: Génèse Plus Group

texts.en:
Didier K. is the president of the Community Bank called “Génèse Plus”. The group is composed of twenty-six members who are united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through micro-finance institute HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Didier runs a telephone booth to the west of Kinshasa. He began his business in 2000 with beginning capital of $50. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Didier is now well-known and liked in this new area.

Didier is a trustworthy client who has received loans five times from HOPE DRC and has fully repaid them. Since that time his business has prospered and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located business place. He makes $90 profit each week.

Didier intends, with this next loan, to purchase more prepaid cards to meet his customers’ demands and to generate additional profits.

Didier is 50 years old, married, and the father of six children aged between 4 and 19 of whom six go to school. His ambition is to open a pharmacy in his area.

loans.use: To buy more prepaid cellphone cards

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr: Madame Salimata D. habite dans le quartier de Gibraltar à Guediawaye. Elle est âgée de 34 ans et est sociétaire  de la caisse du centre de sauvegarde depuis 2004. Elle a déjà rembourse 2 prêts antérieurs. Elle est mariée  et mère de 3 enfants. Madame D. évolue  dans le commerce et la vente d’habillements ou de prêt a porter pour enfants et adultes. Elle a toujours voulu faire du commerce pour gagner sa vie. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour acheter quelques habits de prêt à porter mais aussi des sacs  à main, des parfums et des déodorants  pour diversifier ses produits. Les bénéfices  générés  par son activité lui permettront de gérer  certaines petites dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Madame Salimata D. lives in the Gibraltar neighborhood of Guediawaye. She is 34 years old, and has been a member of the credit association of the Centre du Sauvegarde since 2004. She has repaid two previous loans. Married with three children, Mme D. is developing a business selling ready-to-wear clothing for children and adults. She has always wanted to do business so as to earn her own living. She is asking for a loan of 150,000 Fr to buy not only ready-to-wear clothing but also handbags, perfumes and deodorants, in order to diversity her product lines. Her business earnings will allow her to take care of small household expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renforcement fond de roulement

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 33 años, es una mujer  muy trabajadora, vive con sus 2 hijos menores en la casa de sus abuelos. Desde que tenía 7 años se dedicó al comercio, vendiendo alverjas, habas, zanahorias y demás hortalizas, de ese entonces esta en constante actividad, comprando y vendiendo en cantidad. Su madre la ayuda en el negocio y también a cuidar de sus hijos, por lo que a veces se turnan para recoger a los niños del colegio, de esa manera han logrado salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es tener un puesto fijo dentro del mercado, ya que hasta el momento sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulatoria. Su negocio le es rentable, puesto que conoce mucha gente que acuden a su puesto de venta. Sin embargo lo más difícil y peligroso de su trabajo es que tiene que madrugar para recibir a los mayoristas, quienes le proporcionan los productos que vende, ya que se expone a que la asalten y roben su mercadería. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a seguir pagando sus cuotas como hasta ahora. En su grupo comunal es un cliente muy dinámico y responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo, para que pueda abastecer su tienda y poder captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia, 33, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her two young children in her parents home. She has been working since she was seven years old selling peas, beans, carrots and other vegetables in season and ever since she has been in constant activity, buying and selling in bulk. Her mother helps with the business and also cares for her children. Sometimes she drops off and picks up the children at school which has allowed her to get ahead. Her greatest desire is to have a permanent stall within the marketplace, but so far she has done her sales as a traveling vendor. Her business is profitable, since he knows many people who come to her market stall. However, the most difficult and dangerous part of her work is the need to get up early to go to wholesalers, who will provide products to sell, but also expose her to potential assault and theft of her cargo. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she pledges to continue her payments. In her community group, she is a very dynamic and responsible participant. The loan will increase her working capital and enable her to stock her store and therefore to reach more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more inventory to stock her market stall and attract more customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in their respective businesses, including grocery stores, plant sales, flower arrangements, hair salon, clothing sales and others.  They all want to improve their quality of life and provide a better future for their children.

loans.name: Yea

texts.en: Mrs. V., 53, is skilled at combining many types of root trees. She also buys root trees from the forest people and turns them into natural medicine, selling her products to patients who are neighbors living in the village. She is married to a vehicle repairman. V. is requesting her loan to order more raw materials to make medicine, with the remainder being used to meet some of the requirements of her husband’s business.

loans.use: To order more raw materials.

loans.name: Falefou

texts.en:
Falefou I. is 24 and single with no children.  She is operating a business venture of planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  Falefou has 2 years of experience in this business.  Falefou needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 650 talas or US $271 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Falefou joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Falefou's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
