La señora María del Refugio R. Márquez tiene 39 años, es madre soltera con dos hijos: Palmira Anahí de trece años y el más pequeño Roberto de cinco años. Vive en la Ribera Emiliano zapata municipio de Tecpatan, Chiapas México. 

  Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas desde hace diez años, comenzó en una casita,  ahora con sus a horros y la ayuda de su papá ha logrado construir una palapa pequeña donde atiende a sus clientes, comenta que la va muy bien a un así hay días que no se vende mucho pero cuando menos hay para comer y comprar más mercancía.

  El motivo de su solicitud del préstamo es para agrandar mas su negocio  tener unos ahorros para que sus hijos sigan adelante y puedan ser alguien en la vida teniendo una buena educación y un mejor futuro, así como también apoyar a su papá en algunos gastos.

  Doña Refugio es integrante del grupo buena vista la razón del nombre es porque su palapa está en una vista bonita a orilla de carretera, paso a formar parte de dicho grupo por una de sus compañeras la cual es representante.
  Las personas que integran este grupo llamado buena vista son las siguientes:

Marlevert  Hernández  Juárez: se dedica a la venta de ropas  en las  comunidades cercanas.
Sofía García Gutiérrez: compra y vende trates de peltre.
María del refugio R. Márquez: ella es la que se le tomo la entrevista y esta de cabello corto con un niño. Vende comidas.
Sergio Domínguez García: solicito el préstamo para comprar y vender verduras  de la temporada.
Marbet Domínguez S.: representante del grupo,  compra y vende ropas para salir a vender en las comunidades
texts.en:
Ms. María del Refugio R. Márquez, 39, is a single mother with two children: Palmira Anahí (13 years old) and Roberto (5 years old). She lives in the riverside community of Emiliano Zapata, in the municipality of Tecpatan, Chiapas, México. She has sold food for the last ten years. She started her business in a small house. With her savings and the help of her father, she was able to construct a small palapa hut where she now tends to her clients. She comments that it's going very well. Although there are some days when she does not sell much, it's enough to eat and to buy more merchandise. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business, so she can save money and help her children to get ahead. She wants her children to be able to be somebody in life, to have a good education and a better future. She also wants to help her father with some expenses. Ms. Refugio is a member of the "Buena Vista" ("Good View") Group. The reason for their name is because their palapa hut has a good view along the edge of the highway. She became a member of this group through one of her friends, who is a representative of the group. The members of the Buena Vista Group are as follows: • Marlevert Hernández Juárez: sells clothing in nearby communities. • Sofía García Gutiérrez: buys and sells pewter cooking utensils. • María del Refugio R. Márquez: she is the member who was interviewed and she is pictured with short hair and her son. She sells food. • Sergio Domínguez García: he is requesting this loan to buy and sell seasonal vegetables. • Marbet Domínguez Aaraos: she is the group representative. She buys and sells clothes in local communities.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare food, such as meat, vegetables and shellfish

loans.name: Libia Esther

texts.es:
Libia Carrillos O. vive en la ciudad de Bogotá en el barrio Los Nogales, con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 11 a 17 años, desde allí   tiene su negocio de confeccionar  ropa interior para damas, caballeros y para niños, el cual  comenzó hace 6 años, continuando con la   tradición familiar, porque Libia   aprendió este arte de su madre muy fácilmente y es justamente uno de sus talentos. 
Libia Esther es una mujer muy soñadora y progresista, por eso tiene una meta que es la de mejorar la calidad de su confección especialmente los acabado y como no tiene maquina especializada demora los tiempos de producción y debe recurrir a otros medios para que sus productos tengan un excelente acabado, así que se propuso comprar su maquina collarína  y para eso solicita su credikiva a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo porque quiere comprarla. Su desafío principal es poder brindarle a su familia el bienestar que ellos se merecen y por eso trabaja día a día y minuto a minuto para lograr este propósito constante.
texts.en:
Libia Carrillos O. lives with her husband and three children, ranging in ages from 11 to 17, in the Los Nogales neighborhood of Bogotá. There she runs her business where she makes undergarments for ladies, gentlemen, and children. She began six years ago, continuing the family tradition. She learned this art from her mother with no trouble and this is one of her talents. Libia is a woman with many dreams and a desire to move ahead. This is why her goal is to improve the quality of her products, especially the finishing touches. Because she doesn’t have a specialized sewing machine, it delays her production times and she must resort to other means so that her products have excellent finishing touches. She would like to buy a collar machine, so she is asking for a Kiva loan through, “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.” Her greatest desire is to give her family the well being that they deserve. This is why she works, day by day, minute by minute, so that she can meet this goal at all times.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine

loans.name: Mario Anderson

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Mario pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 56 años.  Mario nació en la ciudad de Lima y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos.  
 
Mario es licenciado en Turismo.  Actualmente, Mario es independiente y trabaja como guía oficial de turismo por el valle sagrado de los Incas y hace camino Inca. Ya son 18 años que se dedica al turismo y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de su esposa que es organizar eventos sociales y culturales. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mario is a member of the Ariariwa Association’s Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (“Little Mustard Seed”) and is 56 years old. Mario was born in the city of Lima and currently lives in the city of Cusco together with his wife and three children. Mario has a degree in tourism. Currently, he works independently as an official tour guide for the Sacred Valley of the Incas and does the Inca trail trek. He has been working in tourism for 18 years already, and it has been going well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He needs this loan to invest in his wife’s business, which is organizing social and cultural events. Mario is grateful for the opportunity provide through this means and commits to making the payments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his wife's business of organizing social and cultural events

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a married woman with four girls and one boy; four of the children attend school while one is still too young for school. Her husband is a fisherman and he contributes to supporting the family. She has been selling food for over three years to her neighbours and passersby in a shop. With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans and charcoal for sale. She has no other source of income.

Zena faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.She hopes to open a restaurant in future. She decided to work with Yehu so as to access loans. She owns a home with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Kwt Sawe Permata Indah Group

texts.en: Agung Ayu Putu W. is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali. Agung Ayu is married and does not have any children. To make a living, Agung Ayu owns and operates a business venture in traveling sales. She goes to the farmers and buys their cacao bean, banana fruit, jack fruit, coconuts, young coconut leaves, cassava and so on, and then sells them in the market. Agung Ayu has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 250,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. In 2010, Agung Ayu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 IDR which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first loan from MUK. Agung Ayu plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Agung Ayu is the leader of a 15 member group accessing a loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "KWT Sawe Permata Indah (PK-10308)". About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Agung Ayu Putu W. (0) merupakan 47 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Agung Ayu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah KWT Sawe Permata Indah (PK-10308). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari membudidayakan tanaman buah & memanen buahnya untuk dijual. Agung Ayu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Agung Ayu menghasilkan sekitar 250,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Agung Ayu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Agung Ayu meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Madame Adama S. est âgée  de 26 ans. Elle habite A Yoff. Elle est mariée sans enfant. Entre 1997 et 2000 elle a fait une formation en couture. Pour pouvoir satisfaire ses besoins elle a choisi par la suite l’activité de commerce et s’est orienté vers les produits cosmétiques. C’est surtout l’aspect lucratif de l’activité qui l’intéresse  le plus. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis septembre 2005. Elle a déjà  remboursé 3 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs en vue de renforcer son fond de roulement. Le montant du prêt servira a l’achat de produits cosmétiques, d’habits et de chaussures pour femmes destines a la vente. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer sa situation sociale.
texts.en: Mrs. Adama S. is 26 years old.  She lives in Yoff.  She is married, but has no children.  Between 1997 and 2000, she trained as a seamstress.  In order to meet her needs, she then started a business selling cosmetics.  She finds this business very profitable.  She has been a member of the Yoff village bank since 2005.  She has already repaid 3 previous loans.  She is requesting a loan of 500,000 frands to increase her working capital.  The loan will serve to buy cosmetics, suits and shoes for women.  Increasing her income will improve her social standing.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Gladis Hermelinda

texts.es:
Gladis C. E. tiene 44 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos de 25, 24, 22, y 11 anos. 

Gladis es socia de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Gladis se dedica a la venta de medicina natural y a la siembra de maíz. Compra sus productos en Guayaquil y vende en lugares distintos. Solicita el crédito para comprar más cosas que vender en su negocio de venta de medicina. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría aumentar el capital y comprar más productos, obteniendo mas ingreso económico. Su sueno es tener una casa y poner un centro de venta de su negocio de medicina. A veces se desafía por la competencia sobre la venta de su negocio y la falta de capital para comprar mas medicinas. 

Trabaja todos los días a la semana y no tiene mucho tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Gladis C. E. is 44 years old, married, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  She has four children, who are 25, 24, 22, and 11 years old.

Gladis is a member of the rural group Nueva Esperanza [New Hope], which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas.  It is a community dedicated to short-cycle workers who grow corn, rice, soy, beans, and cocoa.  There are 14 members in total.

Gladis works selling natural medicines and growing corn.  She buys her products in Guayaquil and sells them in other places.  She is asking for this loan to purchase more things to sell in her store that sells medicine.  With the support of the loan, she can increase her capital and purchase more products, so she can earn more income.  

Her dream is to have a house and a store for her medicine business.  Sometimes she is challenged by her business and her lack of capital to buy more medicines.

She works every day of the week and doesn't have a lot of free time.

loans.use: Purchase more things to sell in her medicine store

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en: Bayanjargal T. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Two of his daughters attend a local school while his wife is currently unemployed. Bayanjargal works as a taxi driver. He began his business in 2005, and since then, has gained much experience. He purchased a plot of land where he is planning to build a fence. He is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order to improve his car.

loans.use: To improve his car

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.   Prossy has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase maize flour and sugar.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Prossy hopes to become a doctor.        

Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her netball.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar

loans.name: Bokk Jom 4 Group

texts.fr: Bokk Jom 4 est un groupe de 5 femmes qui  vivent dans la localité de Bambilor. Elles s’activent  dans le commerce de diverses marchandises depuis plus de 10ans.  Elles ont choisi l’activité de commerce pour lutter contre l’oisiveté et pouvoir gagner leur vie. Ainsi avec leurs gains elles parviennent à satisfaire leurs petits besoins. Elles  empruntent  un montant de 500000 frs dans le but de renforcer leur fond de roulement  et développer leur activité de commerce.
texts.en:
Bokk Jom 4 is a group of five women who live in Bambilor. They have been in business selling diverse merchandise for more than ten years. They chose sales as their business in order to stay active and be able to earn a living. Thus, with their profits they are able to meet their minor daily expenses. 

They are borrowing the sum of 500,000 francs with the goal of boosting their working capital and expanding their sales business.

loans.use: Boost working capital

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO PROGRESO DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispincanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leonarda; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 7 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de salchipapas (plato a base de salchichas y papas fritas) y también trabaja en la región en el área de limpieza desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,la socia vende salchipapas en el mercado de Andahuaylillas y también tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz y luego lo vende en los diferentes mercados, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de salchipapas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como papas y salchipapas.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de artesanía, tienda de abarrotes, venta de frutas, venta de pasto y venta salchipapas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.


En la foto hay una socia que esta en la represetancion de su esposo el socio Giller,la socia es la tercera de la mano izquierda y una socia que esta en el foto que ya no pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Progreso de Andahuaylillas que es la segunda socia de la mano derecha.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Nuevo Progreso de Andahuaylillas". This bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district which belongs to the Quispincanchis province and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Leonarda. She is 39 years old, has a live-in partner and has seven children. She sells salchipapas (fried potatoes with hot dogs) and also works cleaning from 7:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. She sells salchipapas at the Andahuaylillas market. She also has a small plot of land where she grows corn and then sells it at the different markets. The member wants to expand her business selling salchipapas. She is requesting this loan to buy products such as potatoes and salchipapas. 

The other members sell crafts, groceries, fruits, feed and salchipapas. 

The member thanks those people that are part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments in the time established. 

In the photograph there is a member that is there representing her husband, Giller. She is the third member from the left. The second member from the right is no longer a member of the community bank Nuevo Progreso de Andahuaylillas.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes and salchipapas (fried potatoes with hot dogs).

loans.name: James Ngugi

texts.en:
For three years, James has been raising poultry and rabbits to sell as a primary business. He also owns rental houses. James earns a monthly income of Kshs.20 000.  He is married to Nancy, who is also a businesswoman, and together they have four school-going children.

He has never borrowed from any other MFI. He is applying for his first loan of Kshs.30,000 from KADET LTD. He intends to buy a new breed of poultry to raise and sell and also to buy rabbit feed. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his poultry farm and eventually build more rental houses.

In the future, James hopes to educate his children to university level.

loans.use: To buy rabbit feed and a new breed of poultry to raise

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with 12 children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Mwanaisha has operated a retail shop business for the past year. Her customers are neighbors and passers-by. The major challenge she faces in her business is high transport costs. She hopes to open another business in the future.
With this loan of 40,000 KES, Mwanaisha wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and detergent for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and detergent for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. has no formal education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. She helps her husband to provide the general needs of the family.

Florence homecooks food for sale. She makes doughnuts and other items at Breman near Elmina.
 
Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies and ingredients to enable her to increase her food production and sales. She hopes to use the additional income as a result of the loan to educate her children. She is holding in her hand a sample of the fried doughnut.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to increase sales

loans.name: Alberto José

texts.es:
En el municipio de Granada, Departamento de Granada, labora el señor Alberto José S. , el cual tiene 17 años de laborar como Operador de Pozo en una empresa ubicada en la misma zona. Es acompañado solo depende tres personas, su esposa y dos hijos que están en edad escolar.

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de realizar mejoramiento de vivienda en su casa de habitación y por tal razón visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para realizar dicho mejoramiento y también cancelar unas deudas que tiene para estar libre y de esta forma darle un hogar digno a su familia ya que quiere que ellos crezcan saludablemente.
texts.en:
Mr. Alberto José S. has worked as a Well Operator in the town of Granada, Granada department for 17 years.  He has three people with him: his wife and two school age children.

He needs to do some home improvements so visited CEPRODEL’s offices to do said improvements and also to pay off some debts he has in order to be free from them and provide his family with a worthy home because he wants them to grow healthfully.

loans.use: For home improvement and to pay off a debt.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 27 year old and single. He graduated from intermediate school. He will use this loan to purchase a horizontal fridge and develop his shop. The borrower has an upstanding character and a great ambition to gain more and more customers. The borrower sells his stuff at a sound and reasonable price; therefore he has lots of customers. The borrower treats the customers gently and kindly when they shop with him.

loans.use: For purchasing a horizontal fridge

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza M. sells cooking utensils and millet at Akaa Kkrom near Abura, a business she has operated for three years. She is married and has three children. She helps her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and the family's utility bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy additional millet to supply to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy addional millet to supply to her customers

loans.name: Alexandrine's Group

texts.en:
Alexandrine, Florence and Sonian all live together in the Segbeya district of Cotonou, Benin's economic center. They have agreed to support each other in their businesses and in loan repayments.

Alexandrine (with her hand raised in the photo) is the leader of the group. She is 34 years old and has lived in the neighborhood all of her life. She has a husband, Gabriel, and three children who are all at school.

For the past 10 years she has run a market stall at Tokpa, Benin's largest market. With this loan, she will buy additional stock of underwear for resale with the hope of growing her sales figures.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of underwear for resale

loans.name: Santos Genaro

texts.es: El señor Santos Genaro tiene 28 años es soltero no tiene hijos vive en casa de unos familiares ,trabajaba en una empresa iqueña de espárragos, el era obrero de campo y el dinero que ganaba lo ahorraba hasta que logro comprarse una moto taxi el cual ahora es su herramienta de trabajo, también es aficionado a la música toca el arpa en una orquesta el precisa seguir trabajando en su moto taxi y una de sus metas es estudiar una carrera técnica que le permita generar otro tipo de ingresos, también desea adquirir una vivienda para luego formar una familia. El señor Santos esta muy agradecido por la confianza que le están brindando.
texts.en: Santos Genaro is 28 years old, he is single and has no children. He lives in the house of a relative and he used to work for an asparagus factory in Ica. He used to be a farm laborer, and he saved the money he earned until he was able to buy a moto taxi which is now his working tool. He also likes music and plays the harp in an orchestra. He needs to keep on working with his moto taxi, and one of his desires is to get a technical career education that will allow him earning het another income. He also wishes to buy a house and to have a family one day. Santos is really thankful for the trust you will put in him.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his moto taxi.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Mabel K..  She is single and has 3 children, aged 5, 13 and 15. In 2003, Mabel established her drinks and provisions business. When she dropped out of school, she started this business to help her provide a livelihood for her children. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. 

Mabel would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy more drinks and provisions such as tea, milk, ovaltine, sugar, sardine, etc. for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 100,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 50 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merle has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from rice milling.

She is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Colón (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal Los Ángeles De Colon. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general, prestan servicios como salones de belleza, ebanistería entre otras cosas. Ellas hace cuatro meses atrás unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y están muy contentas con los beneficios recibidos de la institución.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Patricia, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y de 6 años de edad que estudian en escuela. El marido tiene una pequeña imprenta.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de zapatos y zapatillas. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque también trabaja a base de pedidos y les da facilidades de pago, ella trabaja cuatro días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas, aprovecha que a estas horas sus hijos están en la escuela ya que una vez que ellos llegan tiene que ayudarlos con sus tareas escolares. Los productos que ella vende los compra en Portoviejo en una distribuidora que le deja a buen precio. Lleva un  año realizando esta labor y dice que le va muy  bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sandalias y zapatos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta los créditos ya que estos le ayudan en su negocio. 

Su sueño  tener un negocio más grande.

La foto pequeña adjunta a la foto grupal es de la Señora Diana, que por el horario de sus estudios no pudo estar presente en la reunión donde fue tomada la foto grupal.
Tambien en la foto está la promotora quien está sentada en un escritorio leyendo un papel, detras de las socias.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Los Ángeles in Colon Parish of the city of Portoviejo, the Communal Bank “Los Ángeles de Colon” meets every 15 days. The members of this group engage in different business activities such as agriculture, general retail, beauty services, cabinetmaking, and other trades. They joined together four months ago so that they could access the benefits made available through the loans offered by Fundación ESPOIR. This is their second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and they are very pleased with the benefits they received from the Institution.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Patricia. She is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 7 and 6) who are in elementary school. Her husband operates a small print shop.

Patricia is an excellent homemaker who also sells shoes and slippers. She sells door-to-door, but she also accepts orders and offers different payment options. Patricia works four days each week, but only in the mornings. She takes advantage of the hours while her children are in school to sell her products, but when they come home she helps them with their schoolwork. The merchandise she sells is purchased at a good price from a distributor in Portoviejo. Patricia has been in business for one year and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy sandals and slippers. She is receiving her second loan from the Communal Bank. Patricia likes the fact that the loans have been a help to her business. Her goal is to have a larger business.

The woman in the small photo is Sra. Diana. Due to her class schedule, she was not able to be present at the meeting when the group photo was taken. Also appearing in the group photo is the ESPOIR loan officer. She is the woman sitting at the desk behind the members reading a stack of papers.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 40 years old and married with two children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and also earns income from raising livestock. Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She has been running her store for the past four years and has repaid three previous loans through NWTF.

Julieta is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy products to sell such as milk, groceries, and other items. In the future, Julieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 27 old and runs a bookshop in Eldoret. He has been in the business for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES. 39,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET. This is his second loan after he successfully paid his first loan, He hopes to use the money to purchase a photocopier machine as well as stationery. The profits will be used to add more stock and a computer.

He hopes to expand his business to greater heights.

loans.use: To purchase stationery and a photocopy machine

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Este cliente es asegurado  y junto a su esposa tienen un negocio de compra y venta de ropa nueva y usada, esta actividad la ejerce desde hace mas de dos años, es casado  actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como,  Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, estos créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado  a él y su familia.
texts.en: This client is insured and with his wife has a business buying and selling new and usec clothing. He has done this activity for more than two years. He is married and has two school aged children. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL and he did both to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc. This is in order to enlarge and improve his home. These loans from with Ceprodel have benefitted him and his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 48 years old and has two children. Her husband is deceased. Hoa supports her children through the income she earns from her general store that occupies the front of her house. Her store sells a variety of goods such as confectionery, toys for kids and everyday necessities. Hoa and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoa intends to take a loan to buy a larger variety of different everyday goods such as confectionery and snack foods to stock her general store and better meet her customers' needs. She also would like to use a portion of the loan to repair her store. 

Hoa hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to repair and buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 65-year-old married woman who lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has a 24-year-old child.

Teresita is a farmer who primarily grows rice to sell. Teresita also runs a sari sari store. She sells items like noodles, canned goods and soft drinks.

Teresita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her farm and more items to sell in her store such as canned goods and soft drinks. She hopes for her family always to be in good health.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm and more items to sell in her store such as canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Edwin Oliver

texts.es:
Edwin Oliver tiene 19 años, Es soltero vive con los abuelitos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE, se encuentra ubicada recinto EL ROSARIO, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol.

Edwin Oliver se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Guzman en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol, para la compra de abonos, insumos y semillas para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es superarse y trabajar mas para obtener más utilidades. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con los amigos, leer y escribir.
texts.en:
Edwin Oliver is nineteen.  He's single and lives with his grandparents in the Ventanas canton in the Los Río province. 

The members of the San Jose village bank meet in the El Rosario district, which is in the Ventanas canton.  They earn their living in agriculture, planting short-cycle crops like corn, rice, and beans.

Edwin Oliver makes his living in agriculture, planting corn, rice, and beans.  He buys his products at the Guzman Store in Ventanas and sells at the Ventanas wholesale market.

He is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, supplies, and seed so he can plant his corn, rice, and beans.  The loan would help him financially to get what needs.  He faces challenges from pests and crop disease.  His dream is to overcome and work more to make more profits.

In his free time, Edwin Oliver likes to go for walks with his friends, read, and write.

loans.use: to buy fertlizers and supplies.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo tiene 59 años de edad, está casado con la señora Tomasa de 47 años de edad, tienen 3 hijas las cuales viven con ellos.
El señor Pablo se dedica a la venta de agujas para máquinas de coser, posee una clientela formada de hace años, surte a costureros y confeccionistas de la ciudad de Itá, Itauguá y alrededores, realiza esta actividad hace más de 23 años, gracias a este trabajo logró mantener y sacar adelante su familia y ayudar a sus hijos a estudiar. El señor Pablo trabaja de lunes a viernes  movilizándose a pie y en colectivo
El cliente solicita el préstamo para compra de agujas de diferentes medidas ya que tiene un gran pedido y no desea fallarle a sus clientes.
Cabe destacar que el señor Pablo es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora, es cliente antiguo y excelente de la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Pablo is 59 years old, and is married to Tomasa, 47.  They have 3 children who live with them.  Pablo has a business selling sewing machine needles.  He has an established customer base that was formed years ago.  He is a supplier to the dressmakers and tailors in the cities of  Itá and Itauguá, and the surrounding areas.  He has been in this line of work for more than 23 years.  Thanks to this work he is able to get ahead and support his family, and help his children get an education.  Pablo works Monday through Friday, and he gets around on foot and on colectivos (vans that provide public transportation services.) 

Pablo requests a loan to buy needles of different sizes, since he has a big order and doesn't want to disappoint his customers.  It is worth mentioning that Pablo is a very hardworking and selfless person.  He is a longstanding and excellent client of Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine needles to later sell

loans.name: Mari

texts.es: Mari, de 35 años es una mujer ejemplar. Convive desde hace 9 años con Jeremías, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Britney y Noe a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Cuando formó su familia, su principal actividad económica era la agricultura. Después de un tiempo su esposo comenzó a trabajar en una mina, donde obtiene un salario estable y bueno. Desde entonces ella emprendió sola las labores agrícolas. Decidiendo los próximos sembríos; pero los 10 años de experiencia le ayudaron a mantener estable su producción de alverja, flor de gladiolo y papa, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y en cada cosecha comercializa sus productos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Según cuenta gracias a la agricultura, pudo obtener 5 terrenos productivos, en diferentes lugares, eso le permite dinamizar sus cultivos de acuerdo a cada temporada. Además tiene un negocio de venta de hamburguesas y papas al hilo con hot dog; que vende los fines de semana, obteniendo así un dinero extra. Ahora quiere mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Su filosofía es el trabajo constante, por eso está segura que logrará su objetivo.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal, “Santa cruz de patay” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo económico de todos ustedes, para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  Mari de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de alverja para su próxima siembra, asimismo fertilizantes naturales para distribuirlos en los primeros meses de maduración.
texts.en: Mari is 35 years old and an exemplary woman. She has lived with her husband Jeremías for 9 years. They both have 2 children, Britney and Noe, who they take care of and educate in their own house. The house is located in the village of Patay. When she started her family, her main economic activity was agriculture. After a while, her husband started to work in a mine where he received a good, steady salary. Since then, she has been farming alone, deciding which crops to grow. However, 10 years of experience helped her to maintain a stable production of peas, potatoes and gladioli flowers all of which she takes good care of. She sells all her crops at harvest time at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. According to her, she was able to obtain 5 pieces of productive land in different locations thanks to her farming. This allows her to streamline her crops according to the season. In addition, she also has a business selling burgers and shoestring fries with hot dogs which she sells at the weekends and lets her make a little extra money. She now wants to improve the infrastructure of her house. Her philosophy is to work hard which is why she is sure she will reach her goal. She belongs to the communal bank "Santa Cruz de Patay". This is her 8th loan with MFP and she hopes for the economic support of all of you so she can reach her goals. In addition, she promises to be punctual with her repayments. Mari, on receiving your support, will invest the loan sought in the purchase of 2 bags of pea seeds for her next planting season and natural fertilizers for the first few months of seed maturation.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ybet

texts.es:
Ybet de 25 años, es soltera, vive en casa de unos familiares, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace un año Ybet se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y de aves de corral, su negocio lo tiene en casa de sus familiares, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y solventar sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar más productos de belleza y alimento balanceado para sus animales y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para cubrir su crédito y mejorar económicamente.  Ybet es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada que con su esfuerzo a sabido salir adelante, para seguir ayudando a sus familiares con los que vive.
texts.en:
Ybet, 25, is single.  She lives with some relatives in a house without basic services in a rural area of the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura, an area known for agriculture, cattle, and crafts.  

Ybet has sold beauty products and poultry for a year.  She has her business in her relatives' house.  She has her own clientele, and with the earnings from both activities she will be able to have a better quality of life and pay her personal expenses.

She has requested a loan of 800 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more beauty products and balanced animal feed, so she will be able to get better profits to cover her loan and improve economically.

Ybet is a hard-working and dedicated woman who, through her efforts, has been able to get ahead to continue helping the relatives with whom she lives.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Jenafe

texts.en:
Jenafe is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jenafe has a food shop; she makes &  sells home-made ice-cream. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000  to buy raw ingredients for home-made ice cream.

Jenafe has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jenafe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for home-made ice cream.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Alfa.

En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no tiene hijos. El marido trabaja en albañilería.
 
Ella para ganar algo con la finalidad de  ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos y bisutería. También trabaja de lunes a sábado en una boutique de la ciudad, pero en sus ratos libres  se dedica a sus ventas las mismas que deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, ella compra su mercadeía en Guayaquil ya que allá le salen más baratos, lleva un año con su negocio y le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: zapatos, sandalias y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas,  su mamá fue quien la llevo al banco y está muy feliz por aquello. 

Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que vive en la casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Alfa communal bank meet every two weeks.  Diana, 19, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has no children yet.  Her husband’s a bricklayer.

To earn her own income to help her husband with household expenses she is a merchant; she sells shoes and costume jewelry.  She’s also employed Monday through Saturday in a boutique in the city but she devotes her free time to her sales.  She sells on credit and collects payment every weekend.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil because it’s less expensive there.  She’s been in business for a year and she’s done well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like shoes, sandals and costume jewelry.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because her fellow members are very united.  Her mother was who took her to the bank and she’s very happy about that.  Her dream is to have a house of her own because she currently lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Lorna has a shop where she sells coconuts & vegetables like spring onions  & string beans.  She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts & vegetables to sell.

Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nolmeshuki

texts.en:
Nolmeshuki is a very hardworking woman who practices farming. She has been farming for over five years. She is 28 years old and married; they have two children.

She has a good credit history with KADET LTD. She has applied for her second loan. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizers, and hire manpower to aid in the farm. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to invest in farming. She hopes to develop her farming business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Manisha

texts.en:
Manisha is 21 years old. She is married and has one child, age 2. 

In 1998, she established her meat shop business. Working seven days a week and six hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy goats and chickens for her business. 

In the future, Manisha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh.  In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with products and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: To buys chickens and goats.

loans.name: Cerlita

texts.en:
Cerlita is 50 years old and married with four children. Cerlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Cerlita has borrowed and paid for 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal, bamboo and farming vegetables.

Cerlita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 35 year old married man living in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He is a teacher, and his personal goal is to build a permanent house for his family.
He is faced with the challenge of low pay which makes him unable to set up other income generating activities. His dream is to upgrade in his studies and also buy land so as to start farming .Charles needs the loan facility to buy land.

loans.use: to buy  land.

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en: Sinoun, 34, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province. She is a rice farmer and palm sugar producer. Additionally, she raises pigs at home to generate more income to support the family. Her husband helps her grow rice and produce palm sugar. Her oldest son is a construction worker. Sinoun is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more farmland to grow rice in order to get a higher agricultural yield. In the future, she would like to raise more pigs and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more farmland to grow rice in order to get a higher agricultural yield

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Obdulia es una mujer de 64 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus 4 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones es madres soltera, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia y darles un buen ejemplo.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace 2 años Obdulia trabaja vendiendo gelatinas y flan, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de clientes, Obdulia puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Obdulia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindad podrá realizar la compra de insumos, tales como: harina, azúcar, manteca, quequeras, fuentes, moldes, entre otros; de esta manera Obdulia contará con los insumos necesarios para preparar diversos postres y queques, ay que adicionalmente desea vender postres para obtener ingresos adicionales, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para poder cumplir su gran sueño de terminar de construir su vivienda, para que en el futuro sus hijos tengan una vivienda adecuada donde vivir.

loans.use: Para realizar la compra de insumos, tales como: harina, azúcar, manteca, quequeras, fuentes, moldes,etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: On September 1 1965, Daniel was discharged from the Guatemalan Army. On that day, when his platoon and he where traveling via military truck, they were ambushed by the guerrillas using incendiary grenades causing severe burn burns. Mr. Daniel received primary care in the army, but was left with residual burn deformity that limits the function and movement of his neck, lower lip and hand due to  burn contractures. This loan will be used for corrective plastic reconstructive surgery to improve his mobility.

loans.use: to improve the motion of his neck, lip and hand

loans.name: Royasi

texts.en:
Royasi is 38 years old and lives in the town of Makidye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school.For the past five years, Royasi has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sales house hold items. 

To help expand his business, Royasi has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the shop such as utensils to sell, and will help Royasi to generate greater profits and provide more necessities for his family. Royasi hopes that in the future he will be able to construct rental houses. 

Royasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Royasi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items for the shop such as sugar, salt and bread to sell.

loans.name: Jocylin

texts.en:
Jocylin is a married woman and has four children. Of which two of them are still attending school. Her way of earning is through raising and selling of hogs.
 
 Almost 5 years now, that she has been engaged in hog raising  livelihood. Jocylin would like to raise quality hogs but the main challenge is the lack of capital. 

She  would like to boost her earnings by raising  more quality hogs and having sufficient supply of feeds, as well. That is why she join CEVI to access financial services.
 Jocylin has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feed. 

In the future, Jocylin  is looking forward to have a stable source and extend thanks for the support.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Cyrille

texts.en:
Twenty-five years old and single, B. Cyrille is a computer technician and seller of computer equipment. He’s a young man who really applies himself in his technical field, but who lacks financial means. To re-energize his activities and possess capital would give him greater bargaining leverage with his suppliers, so he’s seeking a loan of $1200 for the purchase and resale of computer equipment and also to open a small word processing and photocopy service. This is a young man with lots of experience and courage who deserves assistance that will help him really go far.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeune célibataire de 25 ans, B. Cyrille est un technicien en informatique et vendeur des consommables informatiques. C’est un jeune homme qui exerce réellement dans son domaine de formation avec une très grande expérience mais les moyens financiers lui font défaut. Pour redynamiser son activités et avoir un fonds de commerce conséquent lui permettant de disposer d’une force de négociation avec ses fournisseurs, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour l’achat et la vente de consommables informatiques et ouvrir à côté un petit service de traitement de texte et de photocopie. C’est un jeune pétri d’expérience et courageux qui mérite d’être propulsé loin.

loans.use: purchase and sale of computer equipment
